description:
Situation
- I've been to Fly bar many times, at all times of the day
- Recently, I've been coming for their brunch

Pros
- They have a great beer selection 
- You can pay by credit card
- The food is pretty darn good, for both happy hour and brunch.  The quesadillas are my go to, even for brunch as they have a breakfast quesadilla.
- There's a pool table in the back

Cons
- Only one bathroom for everyone
author: Dipesh G.

description: Great local bar to enjoy some beer a quick bite, sandwiches and comfort food. Well priced food and drinks and amazing happy hour.  I need to hit this pace for Sunday brunch, kitchen stays open until 10:00pm or later. Claire, the bartender, is a sassy well mannered happy person that will make your night.
author: Moy V.

description:
This place is a great local spot for beers and food.  However, the happy hour is what you need to come for.  The beer and sake specials are wonderful and can help ease yourself into a long night, or provide a nightcap if you have had a walking tour.  

The food, especially salads, include very large portions and can be good for sharing!
author: Joel Christian A.

description: Great place to grab drinks and pizza with friends. Ordered the Funky Chicken Pizza (bbq chicken) and pitcher of sangria. The pizza and sangria was pretty good. Service is kind of slow though. Didn't go for happy hour but they do have some great deals. Happy hour Monday-Friday 12-6pm pizzas $8.95 and $1 off pints- $6 house wine and $5 sangria. They also serve brunch on Saturdays and Sunday's.
author: Karen L.

description:
We came in with a Groupon and were seated for Sunday brunch right away (amazing). The Groupon was an amazing deal. The food was great and enjoyed good quality mimosas! Kelsey was the only waitress working and was AWESOME! She was definitely hustling to make sure each table was taken care of. She was polite, professional, and attentive. Note to management: Give this lady a raise! 
Great deal. Would recommend!
author: Jessica A.

description: I had a groupon for this place. It's weird because the groupon is for brunch and bottomless mimosas. But they don't open till noon. So is it really brunch? Anyways they serve "brunch" from noon to 3pm. When we went around 1:30pm on a weekend, there was only one dude/bartender working in the whole place (well besides the kitchen staff). But that seems tough. We kinda walked and sat down before he waved us over to the bar to order since he was the only one there. They offer a small menu for brunch - maybe 5 items or so. Which is nice - not too hard to choose. I got the breakfast pizza and my bf got the breakfast quesadilla. All the items are vegetarian and around $10-12. You can could add meat for a little extra. And we added sausage to the quesadilla. Also we got our first round of mimosas when we ordered. Mimosas were good. Found when I got my second and third refills that it's premade and in a pitcher so maybe not the freshest mimosas. Food came out a little while later and both dishes were great. The birdnest pizza is thin crust with spinach, tomatoes, potatoes, cheese and eggs. I wish the eggs were more runny when it came out bit they were pretty cooked. Still very delicious. The breakydilla had eggs, pepperjack cheese, potatoes and sundried tomatoes in a tortilla. And we added sausage to it. The cheese made it slightly spicy but they had scoops of guac and sour cream on the side to help. My bf liked both dishes as well and said he would come back. Not sure if the groupon is actually a deal. I would think the cost of the groupon us about what I would expect to pay normally. But glad I got to try this place. And they have a bunch of beers on tap so I'll prob be back also.
author: Alison W.

description:
2.5 STARS

My group of three was looking for a place to drink. Since we parked right by Fly, we decided to check out this location. We got here on Saturday, July 29th around 5:45pm. It wasn't very busy, so we easily grabbed a table across from the bar.

*Sauvignon Blanc: dry creek - sonoma ($8)
*Pinot Grigio: scarbolo - italy ($9)
*Chips & Dip: tortilla chips with house-made guacamole & salsa ($6)

Only two of us were drinking, so the other ordered food. I got the sauvignon blanc which I thought was okay. My gf hated her glass of pinot grigio. I didn't like it either when I tried it, but because I can't waste alcohol, I ended up finishing it. I don't remember trying the chips and dips, but they looked pretty standard. Our waitress was sweet and attentive.

I used to come here all the time over a decade ago as one of my coworkers loved the happy hour here. I remember their pizzas being good and a great deal. To bad this last visit was a little disappointing.
author: Elena N.

description:
This is a great local spot for tasty food and beer/wine. Is it culinary genius? No. But food is decent, staff is super nice, and prices are reasonable. 

There is a pool table in the back, plus lots of tables (with table service)! The menu has lots of good comfort snacks- pizza, nachos, etc. but don't overlook the salads - they are massive and super-tasty!

There is a great selection of beer, plus lots of wine & sake. Overall, a very casual/chill vibe - its clearly populated by residents of the neighborhood.
author: Rachel R.

description:
Really low key spot for Happy hour - so worth it! My BFF and I decided to come after reading some great reviews, and walked in to a very quiet ambiance. But to my surprise, I really liked it, because I can actually hear our entire conversation, didn't need to yell, and didn't need to fight anyone for the waiters attention.

We decided to get a half pitcher of Sangria ($14), which was about 2 1/2 tall glasses for each of us, which was plenty and gave us a fun buzz! We also ordered the Blanco pizza to share - the white garlic & dried tomatoes were delicious. Would definitely come back!
author: Carrie L.

description:
Fly Bar is an unassuming locals bar where it's straight chill time with beer and maybe a pizza. No real fancy bells/whistles--just a place to relax with a brew and/or food.

Divisadero is a great area to hang in SF and definitely underrated, I think. Are you killing time and just want to hang somewhere in this area? Check out the Fly Bar.
author: Marlon T.

description:
A friend and I visited Fly Bar the other day and had a good time. It was a Monday evening, so it wasn't packed. We were able to quickly find a small two-top and order drinks with the bartender. I had a sangria, which was decent and inexpensive at just $5. 

We ordered a margherita pizza and enjoyed our drinks while we waited. The pizza came out and was hot and delicious. 

Great staff, great music, great selection, and a great pizza = a win in my book!
author: Sarah B.

description:
I had been here once before years ago, so when we decided to kill some time before Emporium opened up, it sounded like a good idea. 

We sat down and ordered flights of beers from their menu. They even have these cute cards for you to write your order down. We completed our cards and turned them into our waitress, only to wait about 20 minutes and have her come back with completely different beers. Apparently they were out of nearly half of what we ordered. Instead of coming back to tell us this, she just "took her best guess" as to what we would enjoy. If we had known that, we would have just selected other beers from the menu. Instead, she brought my friend another IPA that she purposely did not write down on her list because she knew she didn't like it. 

Not only were they completely different flights than we selected, but when she brought them over, she couldn't even tell us which beers where which!! In the end, we struggled through some of our awful beers and I paid $15 for this story about how our waitress gave us beers we didn't even order.

Never coming here again.
author: Leana L.

description: Busy brunch! But waitress Kelsey worked her ass off! Great mimosas and the brunch hash was to die for! We'll be back when we're in town!
author: Janelle K.

description: We came here for brunch today and our server is simply awesome and very hard working girl. She is the only person covering the entire restaurant which is very busy and it took almost an hour for us to get brunch food. The owner is rather insensitive to the fact that one person can't serve the entire restaurant. Food was good and mimosa kept us going as we waited for one hour to get breakfast hash and pizza. The server is amazing and she deserves a raise!
author: John G.

description: Really appreciated the vibes from this place. The bartender was SUPER attentive even on a busy day. Erik was calm, collected, and kept up with the fast pace environment! Food and drinks options were pretty much off the hook! Would highly recommend and can't wait to return.
author: Valeria O.

description: I like going to this place after work because it's conveniently down the street, BUT sucks that this isn't a full bar.  Food during happy hour is reasonably priced and tastes good too.
author: KB B.

description: Had a great brunch at Fly Bar this morning! I had the brunch pizza and added bacon to it. It was DELIGHTFUL and perfectly cooked. My roommates got the hash dish and also really really liked it alot. The food seemed to take a little longer to make than I would've expected but it was okay because we were enjoying bottomless mimosas. : ) I would reccommend anyone in the area to come try brunch at Fly Bar.
author: Jason P.

description:
Here for brunch- and I just can't. 
It's slow in here and the food took forever. 
Also, no hard liquor.
author: Ashleigh P.

description: A classic neighborhood bar that has humbly served its community for countless years, Fly has been a special spot in the Northern Panhandle with a great selection of beers and respectful customer service. Whether its happy hour or a lively weekend night, this place is always a fantastic spot to stop by on Divisadero.
author: Aristos K.

description: It's my local bar. Easy to walk to. Friendly bartenders. Great list of beers. Sadly it's not a full bar, but it's a great place to go and watch the game and meet up with friends.
author: David A R.

description:
30 minutes to get a drink? Are you kidding me?

I was at Fly Bar with a small group this past weekend and it seriously took just under 30 minutes to get our first drink. Three of us got there ahead of our friends so had put in our order, so our poor friends had to watch us drink our drink and wait an even longer time to get theirs. 

I'm not sure what the hold up was as we just ordered beer and wine- we were there for an hour and a half and could barely order two drinks due to the service.

It's also really cramped and a bit dingy feeling in here so not sure there's any reason to go back.
author: Elliott W.

description: I was here when they first opened. I lived in the hood. I have watched this place stay consistently pretty busy. Its a local western addition hipster feeding and watering hole. Good spot before a show at the Independent.
author: Ryan N.

description: They fly bar is an old favorite for me on divis.  The food drinks and service are good, and it's usually not too crowded.   I used to go here a lot when i lived nearby.
author: Michael E.

description:
3.5 stars

Grilled Cheese - Excellent

French Fries- Perfection 

Thai Basil Chicken Pizza - Yummy

Ranch- I could drink it.

Chips and Guac- Nope. Tostitos...actually Mission Tortilla chips. Stale. Guacamole from a pouch. Never again.

Dessert- What dessert? They don't offer any dessert options here. So sad. No worries tho! Plenty of liquor stores around to pick up a Choco Taco.

Service- Friendly Staff
author: Grace V.

description:
Knowledgeable, friendly staff, good selection of drinks. Try their chocolatey stout on tap (forgot the name). It's sumptuous.

Pizzas are great, pool table is your regular 4 quarter affair, a bit cramped and tiny but fun in any case.
author: Siddhartha G.

description: Nice bar if you like beer. Otherwise it's a no... no vodka, gin or white wine (other than Sauvignon Blanc). Not too expensive though and an average bar to spend some time in!
author: Niamh O.

description: I was here for brunch a few weeks back with my girls, we had a great time. Now I will warn you there are only four items on the brunch menu but all four seemed equally delicious. I didn't see anything like pancakes or waffles so if that's what you like, you probably won't find it. The service wasn't terribly slow considering it was just one guy serving the entire restaurant. We had bottomless Mamosa's too which were awesome! I'll probably be brunching here again sometime soon.
author: Alison J.

description: Great neighborhood spot for beer and pizza. Definitely an awesome happy hour spot with $9 pizza and $4 sangria. Good place to meet and chill with friends.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Not entirely sure why this place has so many reviews. 
Dive bar
Funky chicken pizza was mediocre 
Old school rap music 
Decor is non existent also. 
Service is okay.
author: Tina H.

description: Cool bar. Stopped in here for a few drinks a couple of weeks ago. Bartender was really nice and friendly. I would return when thirsty and back in town.
author: Scott Z.

description:
Fly Bar is a tasty, cheap option. Best for chill evenings with friends or or to watch sporting events as they have a few TVs.

Service was pretty slow, but drinks and food made up for it. We ordered the garlic baked brie and a couple pizzas.

Overall great option if you're not picky about slow wait staff and like chill bars.
author: Kelsey H.

description: Really poor choice of music, but nice bar and pool table. Drinks are decent.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
"It's happy hour, so your beer is only $7."

Oh SF... of course I should not have expected my pint of beer in a hip Alamo Square bar to be cost any less. 

Shared a pint of delicious vinegary sour beer with the boo, as we were about to head over to 4505 BBQ and I wanted to ensure adequate stomach space. (So if you share your beer, prior to a 4505 feast, I guess it's reasonably priced?)

SF expensiveness aside, Fly Bar features dark lighting with mystical star-shaped hanging lamps, a backdrop of a European-looking mural, and a small display of hipster wall plants in the front (including plants growing out of Nikon cameras). I guess the ambiance lacks a theme and comes off somewhat as a hodgepodge, but overall it's still a fly place to hang out.

(Side note: I've been to Fly Bar in Tampa, and the ambiance is even more fly)
author: Edna C.

description: I stopped by this bar to have a celebratory drink with some friends and family after the birth of my Second daughter on 12/29. The Bartender, Even, was really cool and inviting (he even bought a round of drinks for me). Pretty cool spot for some good food and good beer.
author: Dennis S.

description:
Hopped in for a quick bite. We were looking for something free of pretension and a big ol pitcher of booze. Mission accomplished! Sangria hit the spot.  Spinach and artichoke dip was actually phenomenal. It was served with a soft French roll, but I think a crusty baguette or some crostini would have been amazing. I wasn't impressed with the nachos but enjoyed the quesadilla. Would totally return for a chill bite. 

Dog friendly!
author: Paige A.

description:
Fly bar, baby! What is better than sipping on a $14 half pitcher of sangria ??? Pitcher comes with no ice so it covers about 5-6 glasses?

We typically get the half pitcher or full pitcher if we're feeling adventurous, and chips and salsa/guacamole.

Delish !! We love you flybar
author: Alyssa H.

description: Great service and food. Funky chicken pizza is the dish to get if you like barbecue sauce pizzas
author: Hayman C.

description: Reviewing on merit of happy hour alone.  (Didn't have food, just drinks.) Visiting from out of town and stayed in the neighborhood.  Stopped in for an afternoon drink because the atmosphere was good.  Grabbed two seats at the bar and discovered the $5.00 sangria, which my gf was a fan of.  I enjoyed the variety of beers.  Sat at the bar, and got quick and friendly service from the bartender, Katie.  Clear that many people knew each other and the bartender.  I've been to places like this before and was given bad service/ignored, but it was anything but here.  Very quickly we're chatting with the other patrons and Katie, being treated like locals.  One round turns into several more.  Reasonably priced, good variety of beers, friendly service.  Walked out happy, would definitely seek this place out next time we're in town.
author: Ted M.

description:
We went to a photo gallery a few blocks down and were looking to grab a quick, cheap bite nearby afterwards. Some of the places around this area are really pricey and small, and we kind of just went with Fly Bar because of the cheap prices. But it was actually super solid! I haven't had dinner for two for less than $25 before tax in awhile, it's just the nature of where we live. But this bar had a really nice atmosphere, a big TV to watch the game, nice waiting staff, and pretty good food. It's not going to blow your mind, but you really can't beat the price. 

Only major gripe is how dark the place was, but it is primarily a bar so I can't completely hold it against them.
author: Kristen T.

description: Best service, best food, best happy hour, best drinks (beers)!! Best Kelsey!!! They are open late, kitchen till midnight and bar till 2. Nachos xtr beans, add corn!!
author: Alison Q.

description:
Incredible, well-curated beer selection, knowledgable, friendly staff, and the Stout Ice Cream Floats featuring High Water's Campfire Stout on draft are AMAZING! My favorite drink in the whole wide world and totally underrated. Try one ASAP!

Food choices are also excellent. I especially recommend The Opulent Nacho Tower -- just called Nachos, actually, but you'll understand why I feel they need a name more becoming when you order them and have the experience for yourself.
author: Anna F.

description: Always a fun spot for a drink and bar food. Though keep in mind, beer and wine only. I highly recommend prior to a concert at The Independent
author: Mike P.

description:
We went here for dinner and drinks last night. 
It's a small venue with few tables, a bar area and a pool table. The menu is also small with pizzas, salads and sandwiches but this made for a quick service.
Overall a really great vibe, they had a great selection of beer and wine, and to my surprise had sake as well. Go earlier in the day, they were out of a lot of beers.
author: Tricia G.

description:
I don't spend nearly enough time in NoPa. However, when in the area, Fly Bar isn't a bad choice.

The food always surprises me. I don't expect much and they keep things simple, yet tasty. Chips and guacamole? Solid! 

Sit at the bar and enjoy happy hour, one of the more affordable and reasonable timed ones in SF. Who's going to leave work at 3 pm to get a dollar off a drink? 

Bartenders are nice, have a great sense of humor and aim to please. Perfect for an early evening drink or late night meet up. Classic SF.
author: Abby S.

description:
My friend and I stopped by here last night while we were in town to see a show at the Independent nearby. 

Initially we were bummed it wasn't a full bar but decided to stay anyways and I'm really happy we did!

The waitresses were extremely nice and accommodating. The bar filled quickly around 9pm. We asked for a mimosa which isn't on the menu and she checked with the bar tenders and brought us one. 

We didn't plan on getting food but we were sat near the kitchen and the food coming out looked so excellent! It was a toss up between the baked brie and the chicken skewers. I opted for the chicken because it described a peanut sauce. When it came out, it was actually much more than I assumed. Usually when you get them at a Thai restaurant, there's 4 skewers, as that is what I had in mind. There were at least 8 skewers I'd say and my assumption about them being like a dish at a Thai restaurant was way off. It didn't have the taste of your typical chicken with peanut sauce, the chicken had seasoning and the peanut sauce wasn't as smooth as it typically is at a Thai restaurant. It was definitely not a disappointment though, I easily polished it off! It came on a bed of greens which had been tossed in a nice light dressing. 

Our waitress noticed it was my birthday and offered up a round of sake bombs for my friend and I. The bill came and it was so reasonable priced! I usually get a little sticker shock when I come into the city but I didn't here. 

Overall it was a great time with really great service in a great little bar. I would absolutely recommend Fly!
author: Brittany W.

description:
*NOTE: not hard alcohol! *

Pros:
- sake bombs for $4! (It goes down really easily b/c they use hard cider)
- sangria is a pretty good deal (I think it's $4 for a large glass)
- billiards in the back
- chill, relaxed atmosphere when it's an *empty* night

Cons:
- no hard alcohol........ their name is just misleading
- waitlist for a table?! On busy nights, you have to find the one person who has clipboard to put your name on a list
- rude service when they're busy

Bottom line: If it looks crowded, just stay away. It's not worth standing in a crowded bar where you feel unwanted. If it looks pretty empty, I highly recommend getting a sangria and just relaxing.
author: Jiann M.

description: Pretty decently priced food and quality of food for being in SF and for being a bar. They're sangria carafes are da bomb too.
author: Kelly G.

description: Only had beer, was impressed with the Fin du Monde on tap. Was looking at the food menu when I noticed ants crawling on the bar and decided to stick with the 1 drink.
author: Max I.

description: We ordered beer and some sangria. It was decent. The bar is very dark, lots of small tables - but it does get very crowded at night (and loud). Probably not the best place, in hindsight, to catch up with an old friend. But definitely a good neighborhood bar.
author: Judy S.

description:
NO HARD ALCOHOL?! BOO! 

I was bummed because it was my first time here and I was excited to get pretty buzzed and play some pool. When I ordered some tequila the bartender told me they only had beer and wine and sake. Bummer. With the amount of sake bombs and beer it would take me to get the same buzz off of 2 shots of tequila, my tummy would be as big as Santa Clause. No thanks. Point is, for this place being a bar I was pretty upset that they carried no hard alcohol. 

Pool table was cool, although the limited amount of space around the pool table allowed very limited shots to play pool.
author: Amanda R.

description: I'm very proud of our local bar. As bar food goes, the menu is superb. And now that Erich has taken over, he's cultivated a great, rotating beer selection. They also have decent wine. And sake bombs! And a great crowd frequents the bar. I highly recommend.
author: Gregory F.

description:
This Spot: is definitely A Spot not too miss.
Love lifes changes & adapt : my friend i planned on hitting the Madrone Bar a couple blocks down* it was MJ vs Prince night.. My digression ends with this : the line was long the venue small and packed. 

We, head back & discover FlyBar : The Cat at the Door(not an actual cat) very welcoming with his dog (an actual dog) on a bar stool was cool. 

We, Mainly were seeking a restroom, thats thee only Delta. And not a bad thing (male point of view) i Agree with Equality %

The Comfortable vibe and accessible bar tender. Delta : not a bad thing: Beer & wine only. lagunitas before i found my Good friend from Belguim  "Chimay" say it with your chest. Sangria for my friend. Super bonus*** The Beats** music nostalgia/classic bay area & west Coast & some Biggie & Ghetto boys & Mos Def & like i said Bay beats with thee Bay Diplomatic E40. This Spot is now my Spot of preference. Extended bonus : when the kitchen closes don't fret those late night need too feed; theres a Mexican spot across the street
author: Kenneth S.

description: Nice environment good music and happy people! Bartender Evan attentive and quick with the drinks. Unwinding or celebrating overall good place. Thanks for the good service! Fly bar for the win!
author: Curtis F.

description:
A friendly neighborhood bar. 

Doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside is a big airy space with lots of small tables and booths for groups along one wall and a pool table in the way back. Our group of 5 had no trouble finding enough table space on a Wednesday night around 9p. Staff were friendly and available, and the space has a casual relaxed vibe. Not a rage place, more of a conversation kind of place. 

They have a food menu with usual bar fare and pizza appears to be their "thing". They have a number of different varieties and the one we tried (don't remember exactly which one?) was garlic-y with a spicy kick. Not bad but nothing special, don't here for the food -- come here for drinks and friends. 

They don't serve liquor, but they've got a great beer & wine selection, along with sake. Prices are very reasonable for these parts, ~$4-6 for draft and bottle beers. The sangria wasn't very strong (but then again, when is it?), $24 for a pitcher. All in all a great casual spot, I'll be back.
author: Bud P.

description:
This place has a pretty decent happy hour menu. Three of us split a little pizza for $6.95 and had a couple drinks.

The ambiance was relaxed and the wait staff was nice.

The waitress was kind enough to keep replenishing the pita for our amazing hummus plate. The olive spread was amazing as well.

Definitely will keep this in mind the next time I'm hanging out in Nopa. Thank you!
author: Meaghan H.

description: This is one of my favorite happy hours to go to in the area.  Great beer selection and pizzas are $7 during happy hour (3:30-6:30pm).  Gf and I usually split a happy hour pizza while drinking discounted beer, sangria, and sake cocktails.
author: Dan O.

description:
Grrrrrreat! I love going back to a place I already had a good feeling at, but didn't get to try much of the food options. Fly Bar has a lot of great options, so I was very happy to go back on Friday and try it out.

My friend just got a raise so she was out celebrating at Fly Bar. Some of my friends and I headed over to join around 8PM and the place was starting to fill in. We said our hellos at the pool table and snagged a spot for two at the bar. My friend bartends there so she came over quickly to say hello and took our order of Chicken Nachos with extra jalapeños. The food took a while to come out, so we worked on our beers and chatted. 

The Nachos were seriously bomb. SO MANY EXTRA jalapeños! I was amazed, but I also did a little schmoozing at the kitchen window while I waited for the bathroom, speaking in broken Spanglish to the chef to please add mas mas! Everything was hot, both temp wise and spiciness, and extremely cheesy so we were very happy. We also got a cup of sour cream, guac, and Pico de Gallo on the side. My other friends came over to eat some nachos with us and also ordered a BBQ Chicken pizza. 

Love the food and beer options and the friendly staff. Will be trying their other location real soon.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Fly Bar remains a reliable hang-out spot for the area.

It's an easy place to stroll into and find a place to sit (though on the weekend it can definitely get busy) and their pool table always seems to be popular.

Their hummus plate is definitely worth ordering if you want a healthy meal and their other menu options aren't too bad either. 

I particularly dig Fly Bar, because their staff are welcoming and understanding if you don't drink. I popped in here yesterday and sat down at the bar. The kind bartender - was quick to get me water and checked in on me throughout the evening to see if I wanted refills. That being said - if you're like me - and enjoy gulping down the H2O - then get ready for a wait for the bathroom. Fly Bar only has one. 

If you're looking for a more cozy or social spot in the area - I'd recommend others over Fly Bar - but for a casual hangout, some solid sangria, and some decent food - Fly Bar knows what's up.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
This is a beer and wine only bar. There is no hard liquor and no red bull. Their food is limited to just sandwiches and pizza. Their pizza looked a bit oily, but I got the chicken and bacon sandwich and it was good. The chips did taste a little stale, but the beer selection on tap was nice. They have lagunitas IPA on tap and lots of other types of beers for around $5- great price.

It wasn't crowded or full when I went but it was a monday night so it makes a little sense. I would go back. it is trendy on the inside!
author: Bori B.

description: I liked the atmosphere but I would like to see a little bit more seating and a bigger TV so we can watch the games from where we sat.  But very cute place also be nice if they had more stuff on the menu.
author: Ázita H.

description:
Just one of THOSE days (that a girl goes through)...

Yesterday happened to be one of THOSE days where everything compounded to the point I resorted to something I rarely do; use FB as a venting mechanism only to look like a total attention whore. BAD IDEA. People, this is why health insurance covers "mental health". USE IT. 

Perturbed over something that went awry, I was up all night tossing and turning all night only to then oversleep. The endorphins from my morning cardio session was temporary as I got into an argument with my melodramatic friend over something very arbitrary. This followed with finding duplicate charges on my debit card only for Wells Fargo to cancel my account without my consent. Leaving work early so I can get a temporary card, I found out upon arrival Wells Fargo were out of cards and going forward I will be charged $15/month for my account because I don't have a home mortgage tied to it (WTF?). Geez, can this day BE over already? My anticipation for dinner with my girls at Bar Crudo only turned into disappointment as we left $60 poorer, hungry, and offended by the service we received there. 

F*CK IT. TIME TO DRINK. 

Enter Fly Bar. 

One friendly bartender. 

One pitcher of sangria. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/8MMhiZdt1QD4r8os_hKEvg?select=Up-H6Xf-i3ggdETtjh1dvw

Several drunk texts later. 

I was the cheery old Cherylynn AGAIN. *smiles* =D

And who says, alcohol doesn't cure misery? 

LIES. ALL LIES. 

OTHER NOTES:
*Fast, efficient, and AWESOME staff
*Diverse and easy going crowd
*HH everyday from 3:30 PM - 6:30 PM ($3 sangria, $1 off beer/sake cocktails, $5.95 all pizzas)
*MENU: apps, salads, sandwiches and pizzas (kitchen closes at 11 PM)
*Old skool hip hop and rock music
*Chic goth meets old roman decor
*With just one unnoticeable TV above the doorway, go elsewhere on game nights 
*One unisex restroom
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Their happy hour is great because the pizzas are half off!  The drinks are lacking, however.  They neither taste great nor seem to have any alcohol in them.

It was very busy when I visited.  The place was PACKED and the pizzas took FOREVER to come out.  The waitress apologized continuously and eventually offered us another drink on the house, but we decided not to take it.  When the bill came, she had given us one of our drinks for free.  Such great service!
author: Vivian H.

description:
I really like the vibe of this place!! Been here multiple times for food and drinks. If you're looking for a chill, dive-y bar for happy hour or for dinner, this is one of the best places to go! Their pizzas are good, their drinks are good and it's an all-around good time! The location is kind of small so you might have to wait for a table if you come at peak times (weekend evenings). It's seat yourself bar type seating but there's also tables so not everyone has to sit at the bar. 

It's always a great time here!
author: Malika R.

description: The atmosphere is casual, but the seating is very crowded, especially on the weekends. I chose a glass of sangria, which was refreshing, but a bit too sweet (perhaps due to the liquor they chose?). The pizzas are yummy and are very generous helpings. At $9.50 a 'za, you can't go wrong. Some of the staff is friendly, while others are a bit standoffish. Positive experience overall.
author: Bailey K.

description:
Lots of bar food here, but you can order somewhat healthy too. 

:: Hummus Plate - decent hummus. It came with olive tampenade, tomatoes, and cucumbers. The pita bread came out nice and warm. 
:: Espinacha Caliente - Very different than any other salad I've tried! It actually has a warm bacon dressing, and the salad is served warm too. I was a bit skeptical, but this was a really good salad -- this is coming from someone who doesn't normally like salads too!
:: Funky Chicken Pizza - BBQ chicken on pizza. Can't really go wrong with this, and Fly Bar does a great job. 

Total came out to $30, which was very reasonable for the amount of food we got. Very filling for three people.
author: Audrey L.

description:
Strolled in on a Friday evening for drinks and had a delightful time. We originally had dinner reservations at one of our favorite spots (nopa), but ended up cancelling them because we loved our pizza at Fly Bar so much!

Pluses:
- Happy hour (until 6:30pm)
- $5.95 pizzas - the Greek pizza (see picture) is amazing and chock full of toppings and flavor
- Plenty of seating, good ambiance for conversation

Minuses:
- Sangria - not quite for me, it tasted less like wine and more like hard alcohol
author: Grace Y.

description: Drinks are solidly cheap during happy hour (until 6pm). $4 sake bombs? Yeah, I can get behind that. Great tap list as well, with plenty of options for every type of drinker. Food is made particularly well, but man does it take a while. Order a plate of nachos, and even if the place is half full, you'll be waiting for at least 30-45 minutes. It honestly shouldn't take that long, even if you're making everything to order. The chips themselves are soggy, and if you get the chicken skewers, be prepared for some dry chicken. I'll come in for cheap drinks, but I won't really stay for too long. If you're at this place, you should grab a quick drink and then head across the street to 4505 for some real food. Super easy to grab seating though, especially in the afternoon.
author: Danny C.

description:
For a place without a hard liquor license, Fly Bar is surprisingly awesome. It's in the somewhat hipster neighborhood of NoPa (North of the Panhandle), so getting there can be a little sketchy (which is s what makes it cool). The decor inside is really loungey - red walls with random art. It's a small place that doesn't seat many people, but I was there for an engagement party, so we took up half of the tables in the location. 

We got to sample the pizzas, which were really nice; they looked and tasted a lot like CPK-style pizza, which is fine by me. I was starving, so I also ordered the Foghorn Leghorn sandwich. It was soooo good! The Foghorn Leghorn has chicken, bacon, guac, and other delicious things that came on delicious bread. To drink, I had a sake madras (oj & cran). It was pretty tasty. 

The crowd was somewhat mixed in age, gender, and hipster status. The music was really great. It seemed to mostly consist of good quality, less-than-mainstream 90s and 00s hip-hop. I'd visit again for sure.
author: Ambar C.

description:
So far best place I've been to for Happy Hour in the City.

$1 off draft beer
$3 sangria
$1 off sake cocktails 
$5.95 pizzas 

Couldn't resist having a sake cocktail. Same with the pizza! My girl ordered The Funky Chicken and I ordered South Western. I loved both, but The Funky Chicken was my favorite between the two. We also ordered their sangria. It was good too, but next time I'll stick to sake cocktails (I'm more of a sake fan).
author: Sylvia O.

description:
Bouncer was a jerk. Wouldn't let me in for no reason.

During bay to breakers, going it to meet friends and was refused entrance with a "you you're not getting in".  I wasn't overly intoxicated, was maybe 4 drinks in at this point and wouldn't give me a reason.
author: Sam S.

description: Came away from our financial district neighborhood to explore the WestAd and stumbled upon this cool little spot. The owner is awesome and super personable.... great beer on tap, wine and sangria ON POINT! Had a great time. Food awesome too! Definitely stop in!!
author: Tiffanie C.

description:
(Club) going up on a Tuuuuuuesday. Pretty packed for a Tuesday, but service was still on-par. They have a good selection of drafts, sangrias, and $4 sake bombs. I love that they use cider for the sake bombs :)

There's only one pool table in the back, so it can get a bit cramped. There's plenty of seating around though and TVs for your viewing pleasure. 

Bartenders are very friendly and efficient. Hoorah for Fly Bar!
author: Rachel C.

description: Tasty espresso and unique menu items, I really enjoyed the Nutella cold brew, it was flavorful, refreshing, and not overly sweet.
author: Juan W.

description: 1st time here and it was amazing .. Awesome atmosphere and very friendly and great service .. They have delicious pizza had the Greek and Blanco Would recommend to all you pizza lovers out there.. They also have good Sangria and sake bombs, they use cider beer which made it amazing . Will be coming back , they also have a fun pool table in the back great to play with friends !!
author: Jones K.

description: We stopped in for a drink and quick bite before a show in the area. Great beer selection. I went with a Chimay. My husband had a meatloaf sandwich and I got their equivalent to a cobb salad. Both were good and that's great for bar food!!!  It's very casual in there and looked like there were alot of locals. There's a pool table in the back.  The bartender knew her stuff. She was fast, efficient and got us sorted quickly.  I'd definitely go back for a drink!
author: Alex M.

description:
This dark, semi-jazz influenced bar was an interesting experience. The staff at first contact was fast paced and stand off-ish (though this could have been that it was Friday around 7:00).

Upon first entry on a Friday evening, the restaurant and bar were hopping! Yet, the way the seating was constructed (a long wall side booth seat with round tables and chairs) was awkward. 

I ordered the Meat Lovers Pizza, a classic pizza. The pizza wasn't bad, but was considerably comparable to a Digiorno's oven pizza -- my initial first thought upon tasting.

In Closing -- Not an entirely bad experience, as the cool space and music had a nice ambiance. There leaves room for desired improvement, even though some elements were on point.

KB
author: Kirby B.

description:
Surprisingly good!
One night after a never ending wait at Nopa, we decided to go to Fly. I never expected FlyBar to have good grub and drinks, but it actually exceeded expectations.
The Greek pizza and chicken quesadilla were above par for 'bar food' -
author: Kinjal N.

description:
Nice ambiance - dim lights and chill music.

The bar tender was attentive and the chips and salsa were great.
author: Brad S.

description: After spending about an hour at this place while we were having a mid-afternoon-drinking-walking day, my girlfriend ducked into this place and I were most delighted with the featured artwork on the walls.  There is a uniquely wonderful bit of taste working on some level here. Although understaffed, the service was very satisfying and friendly. Drinks were of good quality. Overall, with strong daylight in a decently-sized and open space, this establishment *felt* empty. If not truly empty, then as my girlfriend commented, "unfinished" without meaning to vibe as unfinished.  As in, the place gives the impression the budget was maxed out for design (beyond the already mentioned wonderful artwork) and left to fend as best as possible for itself. It is good, but not great.
author: Brad A.

description: Horrible. The minute you walk in it smells. The tables are run down (and sticky) and so is the entire bar.  How this earned any stars, not sure.  Even the music was gloomy and bathrooms were graffiti like. I don't recommend this place.
author: Kym B.

description: Laid back vibe. Only one person working so we didn't know if there was table service or not. After a bit, the bartender came over and took great care of us.
author: Matt P.

description:
We were in the area and famished. $3 sangria for happy hour pulled me in. It was good, and came out of a huge fruity bucket. Mushroom pizza was pretty good too, and filling! Sharing the pizza and a sangria each made the 2 of us nearly uncomfortably stuffed.

Best part.. I loved the bartender! I don't even know why, she was just so sweet. Nice place to come, with a date, with friends, or even on your own.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Interesting mix drinks using Sake and Soju as their base. Definitely strong in alcohol flavor but tasted the way it was described.

Duvel on tap A+! Pool table at the very back, friendly and attentive wait staff

Overall Thoughts

Would come back if I was ever in the area and looking for a place to hang out while waiting for food
author: Eddie W.

description: Definitely a nice spot in the neighborhood. I came here with my girlfriend just as much to get out of the cold as to get dinner and it was definitely worth it. Got a great sandwich (called the foghorn leghorn, gotta love looney tunes references) and my girlfriend got margherita pizza, also awesome. Tab was cheap, food was reasonably priced, definitely recommend.
author: Michael Z.

description:
This is a good, standard neighborhood place. They have a wide variety of fresh food, from tasty pizzas to healthy salads, plus adult beverages of all kinds. It's typically not too crowded on a weekday for dinner and watching a game. 

Good picks: pizzas, club sandwich, almost any salad.
author: Gabrielle H.

description:
Every Tuesday night a large group of my friend's head to Fly Bar for Mangorito Tuesday (not a real event, but a long standing tradition). We take up a few too many tables and order too many pitchers of sangria. Fly Bar isn't technically allowed to serve hard liquor, so their mangoritas employ soju. At first it was a bit odd to me, but I got over that quickly.  And I definitely suggest trying the sangria.

I've tasted quite a few items off their dinner menu and was happy with the food.  I'm a fan of the pizza and the spinach artichoke dip.  The pizzettas (pizza with salad on top) are also good.

The service is great.  We typically have a large, unwieldy group, but they've always been able to handle us.  It isn't always possible to do separate checks with a large party, so I'd suggest bringing some cash to make it easier on your server.
author: Michelle K.

description:
oh Fly Bar, I owe it to you... because of u I got my first taste of Sangria.. Yes..I know I am late for this party.. but  better late than never,.. I am now in love... 

I really really really don't like wine.. The only wine I will drink is Moscato and to all those die hard wine drinkers.. I know this doesn't even count as real wine..

At first when the glass was poured for me.. I was debating whether or not I should drink it.. or pass it to someone else... After a stare down.. and the fact that I had a few shots of grey goose before hand.. I decided.. f*ck it.. I'll try it.. At first I held my breath while sipping.. and then realized the after taste was not bad at all.. it was actually... kinda yummy..

Before I knew it, I drank almost a full cup! $20 for a pitcher of Sangria, $5.95 for a YUMMMY flavor packed Greek pizza loaded with a few kinds of delicious Cheese, This place is great for a Saturday happy hour! Mind you, The pizza had no meat, but it was still DROOLs, Delish! 

You can also play pool while you are here getting your buzz on!
author: Sharon N.

description: The Shroom Pie with sautéed onions and pesto sauce was phenomenal! My fiancé had the Carmel Blue and was as equally exceptional. Love the vibe. Met a few cool and interesting people. Nice selection of beer. Worker was a little forgetful and maybe not attentive, but could have just been too busy. However, other friendly staff stepped in when they saw we were in need. Definitely going back when we're in the neighborhood!
author: Roxanne S.

description:
My boyfriend lives right around the corner, so this has become our go to place for reasonably priced and a good selection of beer/wine/sake and small bites.  The selection of beer on tap is great for such a small place, and I tried my first unfiltered sake here (very milky, not my thing but it was cool to do). I've had the chick stix (pretty standard, can't really mess that up), the thai basil chicken pizzetta (lacked strong flavor and my boyfriend was not a fan of the salad on top), the carmel blue pizza (really really good and garlicky if you're into that type of thing), the blanco, and the funky chicken pizzas (both of which were good as well).  I've also tried bites of the black forest ham and brie sandwich and liked that as well.  

Fun casual bar that's a great place to grab food & drinks or just hang out with friends when you don't feel like venturing far.  Really glad their dishwasher is working again and the Solo cups are gone :)
author: Raina D.

description:
I love Fly!  My favorite bar in the neighborhood by far.  Their sangria is delicious, they have a good beer selection, some ciders, good fresh food, and great ambience with fantastic rotating art.  There are lots of regulars and plenty of others too. I feel super comfortable here. I come to hang out with friends, meet new people, watch the Giants, grab a drink, or even for dinner.

Service is sometimes not the best, or I would give five stars.  Last Friday night my cousin and I were evicted from our seats because we weren't ordering food.  The previous Friday I had to jump through monumental hoops to convince a waitress to let us order food.  There were two, and both kept declining to take our order, saying the other would get it.  When I finally convinced one to do it, she literally ran away after only the first item was out of my friend's mouth, and we had to get up and track her down to complete the order. The bartenders are usually great though, and there's one guy who provides good table service (wish he were there on Friday nights!)
author: Natalie W.

description: Grabbed a late dinner and ordered one of their grilled cheese sandwiches was pretty good. There fries were pretty tasty as well, not sure if they handcut them or not? Only thing is the prices are a little on the high side for what you get but then again you are in San Francisco so what would you expect?..lol. Not a bad place for a quick bite to eat.
author: Randy J.

description:
I've been here many times, so many that it's kind of ridiculous that I haven't done a review until now. Anyway, if you come, you must try the following:

- Nachos: seriously amazing, piled high and loaded with salsa, sour cream and guacamole
- Grilled cheese: perfectly made every time (and this is coming from a grilled cheese sandwich fanatic)
- Mediterranean salad (a very recent discovery): this one has small pieces of potato in it, which is different, and the and oil and vinegar dressing is yummy

I've also tried pizzas and some of the other appetizers, but the above are my favorite. Portions of all items are generous. 

As for drinks, well the beer selection has highly improved over time. I used to only get the same sake cocktails every time (sake 5-0 and sake Georgia), but the beer is so good now, it's hard to decide. 

I usually go later at night, but as other people have mentioned, they have a good happy hour, so hit it up sometime if you can.
author: Gloria B.

description: Got the Carmel Blue pizza.  Good, not great.  Decent beers, nice people.  Cool vibe!  Happy hour ends at 6.  A bit early for the city.
author: Mark W.

description:
Pretty awesome place. Went for happy hour with a party of 7. We were easily accommodated at the bar. The bartender came right over and took our orders. Our drinks and food came out very quickly. 

We had 3 orders of the Sangria pitchers. And I must say that by glass #3 we all were feeling pretty good. My friends had ordered the taco salad which was a nice size and very filling. The spinach and artichoke dip was very fresh and hot. 

Great environment.
author: Djuan S.

description: Definitely nothing fancy. Happy they have some decent salad options. The nicks salad is a Cobb salad, plentiful in size. The chicken in the nicks could use some love. Tough and unseasoned.
author: Sean H.

description:
Cool vibe. Great local crowd. Good food. I love this bar!

I had the sake cosmo and it was great! The sangria was ok but it didn't have any fruit. The pizza and the spinach/artichoke dip were both delicious!
author: Karen S.

description:
If you're looking for a place to grab a beer and just chill with your friends without breaking your bank account in the typical SanFran way, this is the place for you. 

Atmosphere is on point: super good vibes, dim lighting and decent food menu. It's not a 4 course meal but what more could you want than bar food with your ice cold beer? 

Not from around here and really enjoyed this place.
author: Lindsey P.

description: Food was delicious atmosphere was ok.. American food - salads, pizza (very tasty), grilled cheese, etc. seat yourself bar with not too many tables or space for parties bigger than 3 .. Wait staff was not terrible but seemed a bit stressed with the amount of people in the bar. Also the one toilet was broken and the staff was yelling at each other about who was going to fix it .. (P.s. It was not fixed by the time we left)
author: Kerri A.

description:
Their happy hour is wonderful, cheap pizza, beer and sangria?! What's not to love??  The other nice thing is their happy hour goes from noon- 6:30pm (except Monday because they open late) so you actually have time to order a drink & food without having to be there extremely early.

Overall I have a hard time swaying from pizza, but they do have other very good food options.

They have a pool table that is slightly awkward because you can't fit a normal size pool stick with the wall, so they have a mini stick you can utilize. This is a fun spot, good atmosphere and always about the right amount of people.
author: Clare R.

description:
I first discovered Fly Bar many moons ago when looking for a place to eat and drink before a show at the Independent and since then my high opinion of Fly Bar has never wavered.  

If you're looking for a twist on the flavored vodka martini, try one of their many saketinis.  They're quite delish and refreshing.  But if that doesn't work for you, there's always the sangria or beer...and do they have a full bar in addition to this? I wouldn't know, I've never ordered anything other than a sake cocktail.  

Happy Hour is also pretty sweet here if you're looking for an early dinner.  Individual pizzas for half off?  Don't mind if I do.  It may be a block away from Little Star, so why come here instead?  Well if you like individual sized, thin crust pizzas with fresh ingredients and good flavors for a much lower price point, then that's why you'd come here.  Also tried the Nick's salad, which is ginormous!  And tasty.  And reasonably priced.  And makes for a full lunch the next day from the leftovers.  

This is a fun place.  They have a good mix of food and drinks and you can sit towards the windows in the front for a brighter experience, or towards the back in the booth or at the tables for a darker (more romantic?) ambiance.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
Ok, I never understood why everyone loves Fly Bar so much...it's dark, hipster, the food is horrible...but then I came during happy hour!

$3 Sangria? And the glass is RIDICULOUSLY large! Ummm yes please! Oh and $6 pizzas? Ok yes I said the food sucked earlier but I'm poor and I will take a $6 cardboard pizza any day!

Also, the bar tender is super cool and all the regular bar people are very friendly and interesting. So OK Fly Bar, you got me, I'll be back....but only between 4:40 - 6:30PM!!
author: Meredith M.

description:
The HH specials are a sweet price. And the food? It could be better. 

HH pizza: ALL $5.95
- Margherita: blandish
- The Funky Chicken: YUM!
- Blanco: YUM!
- Mmm Meat!: YUMMMM!
- Carmel Blue: blandish, but tastes so much better w chili flakes!

Other foods:
- Baked Brie: YUMMM

HH beer: $1 off any beer

HH sangria: $4.95
author: Sharon G.

description: Still love Fly, but goddammit I wish they played better music. (Nobody wants to hear The Weeknd's latest album played straight through on repeat, not even The Weeknd.) For the love of Jeebus, please put a music lover behind the bar, and not some smart aleck kid who thinks songs are just ironic jokes to make your friends snigger. Pandora would be ok, too. I'd compromise on that. This is the hospitality industry, people!
author: Joe V.

description:
Went to Fly last night with a good friend who is visiting from out of town.  Very low-key vibe (no chance of this place feeling like a "scene," I don't think) and friendly cocktail waitress. We stayed for the remaining hours of happy hour (which goes from 12 pm to 6:30 pm and includes $6 pizzas, $3 sangria, $3 sake and $1 off drafts) and enjoyed several Crispin ciders, sake bombs and $6 personal pizzas.  Drinks were cold and pizza was delish (I had the shroom pizza w/ pesto)! All in all, a good and relatively cheap (considering how much we consumed) night.

HOWEVER, it should be noted that FLY does NOT have Sake or Soju cocktails as their website claims they do.  They have beer, wine, sangria and sake.  Dat's it. Minus one star, because I really wanted a sake cocktail and was disappointed.

Other than that, Fly is a perfectly viable and tasty happy hour spot. Just, dudes, please update your website.
author: Jessica M.

description: The pizza is very average. As a matter of fact, I'd pick Dominoe's over this place any day. Service is slow, but atmosphere is interesting and quirky. Overall, good for drinks; not for food. What kind of place doesn't even serve dessert?
author: Charlotte C.

description: I love this place. It's a really nice neighborhood bar with excellent pizza, good service, and good beer list. It can get packed on Friday and Saturday evenings but it's a great place to grab a bite and a drink during the week.
author: Josephine G.

description:
First time in this softly lit little place, and found it to be a great place to grab drinks and and food with friends. I enjoyed their "not full bar" status as it kept the place very hang-out-with-pals/date friendly and the atmosphere was less of a meat market and more of a hip place to eat. 

We ordered the hummus plate, which served four of us with ease for appetizers, a pizza, which was small but again gave us all a taste, and then finished the evening up with the baked brie - another tasty treat. Everything was good. Not grandstand amazing, but certainly decent enough that were it a quieter spot, I'd bring my parents here to try it out.

And they make cocktails from sake. It's different, interesting, and fun. Embracing the difference over here at Fly. 

Oh yes, and the service was really good. Our waitress was easy-going, attentive, and one of the better servers I've had at a place such as this.
author: Alicia O.

description: I like this place.  The ambiance is great, the art on the walls is interesting, and the food is good!  Keep in mind, it's more of a place to drink and eat and hang out in for a while - if you want a quick meal it's probably not the place to go.  The service can be a bit slow.  But as long as you're hanging out for a while, it really doesn't matter.  It's a fun place to be!  If you do want faster service, sit at the bar.  But the food is really good, and I just like the overall feel of the place.  I recommend it!
author: Allison R.

description: Great place to grab a quick drink. Not sure how the night crowd is, but the after work crowd is just ready to sit back and relax. The beer selection is good and parking is easy. Why not stop by?
author: Marlene T.

description:
Great beer selection, friendly bartender, and good food.

I had the The Funky Chicken (Bbq sauce, chicken breast, smoked gouda cheese, red onions and scallions), and an Anchort Steam and Fresh Squeezed IPA.
author: Jeffrey G.

description:
Came in here cuz it was the only bar opened at noon. We ordered 2 beers. Unfortunatly for us, the bartender tells us there was a fire the night before and their water has been shut off so would we mind having our beers in red plastic cups? Well of course not. Until every other person who walked in after us were given their draft beers in a nice cold glass cup. 

Weak.

My 1 star goes to the liquor store across the street.
author: Cena V.

description: This bar/restaurant blew my mind with sweet and savory pizza expertly crafted and served for two. The BBQ chicken was rich and well balanced. The Hawaiian was sweet  as the pineapple beautifully complimented the cheese and ham. Drink specials weren't bad either, and the well positioned televisions allowed for maximum viewage of the giants game.
author: Mike S.

description: The drinks were good and the Funky Chicken pizza was solid. Too dark and loud inside. Hard to hear my friend talk. But, the music they played was really good. Not sure why it was so loud... perhaps bad acoustics?
author: Marc B.

description:
Good food, good friends, fun environment, great drinks, reasonably priced, CLEAN BATHROOMS, and fun bartenders... what more can you ask for =)
With all the choices along Diviz, Fly Bar is a great place to knock back a few and hang out
author: Christian H.

description:
4 stars is for the AMAZING sangria...get it, you have to. 

Mmmm meat pizza was delicious and for 5.95 during happy hour, can hardly beat it! 

I came in midday and it was empty. It looked like a hipster spot but I'm not sure how it is at night. 

I'll be back for the sangria that I still can't stop thinking about.
author: Serennah R.

description: This bar kinda reminds me of Austin a little bit. A lil grungy, but divey. I like it. Interestingly a bit different than the other location in the T-loin. Worth swinging by!
author: Mel G.

description:
I don't usually get mixed drinks so rating bars comes down to service, cleanliness, and sometimes food. That last one is what gives Fly the 4th star.

Their Happy Hours for drinks are more of a smirk than a smile ($1 off drafts) but their pizza ($6 at happy hour) is delicious and probably one of the best happy hour deals around. While not on the specials list  - get the nachos. This was probably the single best plate of nachos I have ever had. Get them and thank me later. 

For the other stuff, the bar is clean and the servers are friendly. Last time the nachos tool way to long to come out but again, they were so worth it, it doesn't matter.
author: Matt W.

description:
$6 pizzas, $3 sake cocktails and $3 sangrias during Happy Hour! Couple that with a fun eclectic hipster crowd and you've got yourself a fun post-work venue. 

Also, the service is fabulous and ambiance is true to what one would expect from a fun and casual SF bar scene. It's a definite must-visit when you're in the NOPA neighborhood.
author: Priya S.

description: Had an okay black forest ham and brie sandwich with a generous side salad. Also had a Poppy Jasper amber. Decent grub and pregame spot adjacent to the Indy.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
If only I was a local, then I could sit here at Fly Bar with my girls every night. Unfortunately for me, I'm not and finding parking in this neighborhood isn't the easiest feat so this is a treat I can retreat to once in awhile. I kept hearing about sake bar this and awesome menu that so of course I had to come and check the place out.

I'm more of a foodie than a drunk so I ransacked the menu as soon as I got greeted and sat. Nachos and pineapple juice for me while I waited for my girlfriend and while I waited, I stared at the weird artwork on the wall. Don't get me wrong, there's a really beautiful painting behind the pool table but the smaller ones looked like someone's child did it. And if someone's child did do it, well then that just makes sense.

The nachos here are fantastic. And yes, nachos are bar food and everyone does bar food but these guys know how to pile on the cheese and make sure it gets baked in good between all the chips. I especially love a place that adds black beans to the mix since there was no chicken option. And shamefully, I ate the whole dish before my friend even got there. But thankfully, she doesn't read Yelp reviews and will never know of my private shame. 

She did arrive (30 minutes later) and promptly dove into the Sake Breeze which consisted of sake, cranberry juice, and pineapple juice. I took a sip and if it weren't for the fact that I get a case of the "asian red, " I would have helped her out with it a little more. It was sweet, balanced and had just a subtle undertone of sake. Darn my "asian red"...

Together we ordered a margherita pizza and hummus plate while we critiqued the odd artwork on the walls and whether it could really be called "artwork." Our hummus plate arrived shortly after the first round of drinks and it certainly did impress us both. The pita was warm and fluffy, the dip creamy and smooth. It was the perfect giant snack for the perfect drink. I can't comment on the margherita pizza however 'cause once the hummus plate was done, so was I. 

Overall, the drinks were great, the food was better and our server Holly did everything she could to ensure we had a great time. This was months ago but I'll be back again for sure when I find myself in the neighborhood.
author: Jessica K.

description: Not a great choice for wine. Got a rose and it was either a crappy wine or badly stored. Sad face.
author: Esther K.

description:
I learned last night that the bathroom at Fly Bar is a pee only bar.  Nevermind that there is a toilet and not a trough.  Nevermind that there is a lock on the door.  If you have to do business other than tinkle, you must run to the Popeye's.  But Fly Bar didn't tell me this.  No, these tacit rules to the potty were communicated through the door by a gentleman too cowardly to say these words to my face.  To you sir, I hope one day you need a spot for your rump and suffer to find one.  Ok, my rant about bar bathrooms and the drunk patrons who lurk outside them is over.

So Fly Bar has terrific sangria and it comes in pitchers for only $20.  The lighting is great.  It seems to be busiest in the early evenings and tapers off post-dinner.  I don't come to the Divis  Corridor often, but Fly Bar is my go to spot for a drink.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
This place was really cute and quaint, and had really good deals during happy hour. The cocktails are delicious, and are made with sake. I ordered the Japanese Chiwawa, which was just the right amount of sweet. 

Because my roommate is vegetarian, we shared the carmel blue and the spinach and artichoke dip. For the prize, the pizza was really big and filling. Both items were a little heavier than I would have liked, but in the end I was really satisfied with my trip to fly bar.
author: Michelle L.

description: Definitely a little pricey. When I fist saw their Happy Hour on Voo (https://tryvoo.com) I thought they were practically giving away their drinks but then I found out their actual prices and realized that it was a justified mark down. Still all in all I enjoyed myself there with some cold drinks, warm food and good company.
author: Peter B.

description:
My wife and I met up with Gill C and her friend Ting (no, not that Ting) last night. It was the Divisadero Art Walk Night and did not quite know what to expect. Gill had warned us that the restaurants and bars would be packed and that seating would be a premium. And she was right.

I arrived first and walked up and down the street bouncing between Madrone and Fly Bar looking to secure a table. But it was my wife who showed up late who was able to snag a nice table with a street view for us.

Fly Bar offers beer, wine and soju only. They do have Duvel which is my favorite Belgian Ale of the moment. To the person who I saw drinking a Pabst at Madrone. Your beer is trendy, but it sucks. Do yourself a favor and drink a good beer. Anyway, enough with my rant. Fly Bar also offers a better than average bar food bites. Pizza, sandwiches, chicken thingies, salads etc. We were a hungry group and sampled a few of these. I had the margherita pizza which I found to be delightful, thin crust with a healthy topping of cheese, tomatoes and basil. My wife went with the hummus appetizer which I did sneak a taste of and loved. Gill and Ting split a spinach dip app that looked of top quality as well.

The bar is crowded and if you aren't careful you may find a strangers elbow resting in your face. But despite all the craziness, the service is good and the servers very friendly.  A nice venue for good conversation.

PS. Where was Alexandra?
author: Rene C.

description: Came here for drinks and appetizers. Got amaaaazing sangria and Brie with bread. Love it love it ;) both were delicious, great setting to hangout with friends, service was fast and I came out pleased! Will definitely come back!
author: Katherine M.

description:
[3.5 Stars]

Your plan for the night:

1. order drinks + food
 - happy hour specials include $3 sangria, $1 off draft beer, and $1 off sake cocktails
- sangria was pungent, and not in a good way, like there was some anaerobes growing in the bottom of the cup....
- sake was naaaastaay and weak, kinda had an after taste similar to the smell of the streets of the TL 
- of course, draft beer is beer [in my opinion the smell of beer is very similar to the smell of bums peeing on themselves, so i avoid it]

2. insert 4 quarters for billiards as you wait for your food
- small pool table in a dark corner in the back with a low hanging light~ totally legit!
- since its in a tight corner, they provide you with a short stick for your convienience =]
- by  the time you are done with your first game, the food comes

3. eat
we came in a party of 3, and ordered 3 happy hour pizza's at $5.95 each
- mmm...MEAT pizza: packed with tons of meat, guys enjoy this pizza ....because it has tons of meat....
- blanco pizza: jack cheese, white white garlic sauce, scallions and sundried tomatoes: leaves you with a feeling that something is missing from the pizza, the sundried tomatoes were a nice kick though
- the funky chicken pizza: basically a bbq chicken pizza - standard and well executed
- the pizza's were drier compared to the sutter location

4. enjoy
- 90's music featuring notorious BIG, wu tang clan, big pun

although the drinks were certainly sub-par for a "bar" the food was pretty good - not as good as the sutter location - but still enjoyable considering i had sushi buffet 4 hrs prior.  however since this location has a pool table, it adds to the experience.  with good company, this place can turn into a 5 star experience easy!  just bring your friends and have a good time!
author: Tina A.

description:
Fly Bar employs the nicest doorman I have ever had the pleasure of showing my ID. Russell commented on Coach and my Colorado licenses because he'd recently been to Denver. After learning of our recent transplantation to the Bay Area he offered up multitudes of suggestion of places for us to visit and even came inside to find us a little later to give us shots of sake. It was an amazingly warm welcome to the city our first night here.

The bar itself is a pretty casual place with only wine, sake and beer, but the selection they do have are definitely upstanding. And that niceness we encountered at the front door was found throughout the entire bar in both patrons and barkeeps. 

There's a pool table in the back if you want to indulge in bar games, but the atmosphere lends itself to great conversations, both with current friends and ones you haven't made yet.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
This place saved my night! I was banking on eating at the Saffron Grill next door but the place was crazy small, zero ambiance, and looked really dirty. So, we decided to not use Yelp this time and just walk around. 

Serendipity does exist! They serve food!! And excellent food at that! Their salads are huge and extremely filling!! Really, no joke! I didn't exactly like my sandwich but I ordered a chicken sandwich and it was kinda dry but despite that I LOVED this place!

Great drink selection and excellent service! We ate at the bar and the bartender gave us some free samples of his favorite cocktails. 

I went here on a Saturday evening. Not too crowded and definitely not empty. Will def be back for the salad!
author: Kathy S.

description: Great bar. I really enjoyed my time here last night. Super chill bar with good music. Seem to have great deals on pitchers/half pitchers of sangria. Beer on tap is $5. Was able to get a table with friends almost immediately. That's not to say the place isn't popular or busy! But it is definitely possible to get pretty quick service at the bar and move around throughout the bar. No dance floor, but some people dancing in their small groups around the bar. Fun night! Definitely recommend it.
author: Chris D.

description: Fly is a good neighborhood bar with generous wine pours, good prices, and pretty standard, yet good bar food. The portion sizes are good, which means nachos and pizzas and perfect for sharing. It's also a great place to grab a drink while you wait for a table at Little Star Pizza or Nopa.
author: Teryll H.

description: Now that I'm leaving this fair city, I've been re-acquainting myself with my SF roots, and I'll tell you what... Fly Bar is still the place it was in the summer of '09 as it is now. Solid food (the hummus plate is surprisingly fantastic), great sangria, and never a dull moment at the pool table. As this part of town turns a new leaf, I'm so stoked to see it continuing to flourish.
author: Ruggy J.

description: Surprisingly crowded on a Tuesday night, but a great selection of beers (with alcohol %s written right next to them!) and $4 sake bombs (with cider!).  Come here to play pool, watch a game, or just hang out and grab a couple drinks with friends.
author: Keith C.

description:
Fun fact: I confused this one with the other Fly Bar. 

I've been here like 10 times and I love it every time. 

Its my favorite bar in the hood. Pizzas are good, fruit to nuts salad, yum.
author: Emily D.

description:
I hate Mondays.

But not Happy Hour Mondays!

The much raved about happy hour at Fly Bar is unbelievable. Happy Hour is from noon - 6:30pm. EVERY DAY. That's 7 days a week. Holy cow. Who wants to start drinking at noon?!?

Their happy hour specials rock: $3 draft beer and sangria.  $4 sake cocktails. Half-off pizzas. I mean, you can literally just have $20 in your wallet and walk out of here with a buzz and your tummy full.

Man, the pizza.  The crust was neither thick nor thin but it held the toppings well. We sampled the Shroom pie (portabello, mozz, pesto sauce) , Funky Chicken (BBQ chicken, red onions) and Margherita (I wasn't expecting real tomato slices but they had a nice salty cheese on top of em so it was okay).

My sangria was refreshing and the glass it's served in is tall enough to quench my thirst. 

A couple of peeps played pool (only 4 quarters needed!) and we had a fun time.  Thanks to everyone who made the trek to this spot, you're all so FLY!
author: Janice C.

description:
With the appearance of dark and sexy from the outside, I had high hopes for Fly Bar, but anything I ordered with bourbon or whisky just fell flat; they were either too watered-down or sugary. My companions' beers were all pretty solid; that's definitely the thing to order in the future. 

Food-wise, the quesadilla and homemade guacamole is tasty as hell. Neighboring tables seem to all indulge in the hummus and pizzas, which looked way too enticing. 

The redeeming part about the bar? Amazing music! They us Pandora to man the playlist and it had has singing along like it's karaoke hour at your local joint.
author: Sharon F.

description:
$3 sangria for happy hour = happy face!

The pizza is good here as well.
author: Jocelyn J.

description:
When stressed, the best cure is good company, good cocktails and and good food. 

With the lack of any bit of social life lately, I was excited to be able to attend a little gathering with other fellow Yelpers here at Fly Bar for Happy Hour this past Monday, organized by my sweet gal pal Janice C. 

Talk about convenient Happy Hour!  This place has serves up 1/2 off on all their pizzas, and $3.00 Draft Beers, Sangria, and Sake Cocktails between the hours of 12pm-ish to 6:30pm 7 Days a week. 

I opted for a Sake Nectar cocktail.  It was just what I needed to calm myself down.  We also ordered a few Pizzas--Margherita, Funky Chicken and the Shroom Pie.

I liked the texture of the crust as it was nice and chewy.  I also liked that the toppings were dispersed well on the pie as well, not overloading with one particular topping. Good compliment to some drinks.  

All in all, I definitely enjoyed the company of some of my favorite fellow Yelp buddies, and thanks again to Janice, for organizing this little get-together! 

Until next time...Happy Hour will be there!
author: Cass J.

description: Fly is my favorite happy hour spot in the neighborhood. $3 Sangria (still served in a pint glass!) And $1 off all draft beers. Pizzas are only $5 and they are damn good! There are lots of regulars and the crowd is quite diverse. Young,  old, black, white, latino, rich, poor, single, couples, and families! Slice of life in here. The bartenders are super friendly and know what all the regulars want as soon as they sit down. Fun, casual atmosphere. Love it!
author: Jena M.

description:
The vibe is good - kind of SF partial divey but fun. I think they could improve their beer selection (especially draft) but it is still ok.
The reason for the review however is the Tuna Melt. Shout out! I ordered it not expecting much since Tuna Melts are almost always underwhelming. The tuna salad is almost ALWAYS lukewarm or even cold somehow even after sitting on a hot grill. Not here. this is certifiably the first place I have EVER been to that had the tuna filling piping hot in the melt! I was stunned! It was quite good and came with a very nice lightly dressed salad also instead of artery clogging fries. Perfect and I'd definitely go back.
author: Matt H.

description:
Happy hour is a little different here as compared to the other one we went to, but it is still good. Only the cheaper set of pizzas are available for $6 which is still good and they don't have house drinks on special, but at least they have Sangria's for $3 which is worth getting excited over. 

The service was quick and good and food still a good size. As a girl the pizza can be easily shared between two, but I know my guy friends have no problem finishing the whole pizza on their own. The decor/ambiance was okay though.
author: Magicka M.

description:
Came here with a very lovely lady date and we had a great time :)

Ambiance was really nice. I kind of felt like I was in a kid's dream or something. There were lots of lights shaped like stars and the cieling was billowy with blankets. It was very dreamy and also quite fun. The strong presence of red everywhere made it kind of sexy... Like a sexy child's dreamy dream. Hmm. Maybe I'll rethink that analogy.

I had the margarita pizza and my friend had the grilled cheese sandwich. We also both got some saketinis, which were AWESOME. The food was great, too! I ate all of it haha, I was hungrier than I thought. We also split a pitcher of Sangria (which I didn't realize would get me as drunk as I was that night, yikes). All in all, it was a great experience. 

The crowd here is pretty chill. Local crowd, lots of plaid, lots of beards, not skeezy at all. It just seems like a cool place to go with a couple friends and grab a nice drink.
author: Jade R.

description:
Waiting on a show to start at The Independent, we swooped in here to get out of the cold.  Immediately found a table by the window.. and the waitress was ON POINT. We had drinks less than 4 minutes of entering the joint.

I wasn't expecting much..in fact, based on my friend's input, I was expecting a lot less than what we got here. 

It's dark, but not too dark.. and there's a big red wall in the back with a mural of a naked woman with a bunch of trumpet players playing. It was pretty cool.

We ordered baked brie and a margherita pizza. Both items were fantastic.

I wasn't feeling the soju drinks much, so my waitress was kind enough to take it back and replace with wine. She was the best waitress I have had in like..years. Always making sure no one was standing in the door/aisle area..always making sure everyone had a place to sit, always there when I needed her.

Music ranged from indie to rap... something about 'Straight Outta Compton' being on and watching city folks walk against violent wind was super entertaining.

Had a great time here, would most definitely recommend if you're in the area and looking for a good place with great art and ambiance.
author: T C.

description: $6 pizza and $3 sangria for happy hour.  Sure I've had better pizzas and better sangria but really the price is sort of amazing.  The pizzas are decent.  Got the meat and the bbq chicken.  Personally perferred the chicken as the meat was a bit spicier.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Two Words.... NICKS SALAD

it is a massive salad with probably 4 boiled and chopped eggs, fresh chicken, ham, turkey, 3 different cheeses, tomatoe and croutons with goat cheese on them.. the trick is to order it tossed and with balsamic (rather than ranch).. all for under 9 dollars! ITS AN AMAZING DEAL

I seriously have never had a better salad in my life, and when I bring friends here and they all agree! I  sound very intense about this but it is that good :D lol

The staff is great there too, always friendly and always make you feel welcome .. Great deal and a great place
author: Jamie R.

description:
After Mini Bar, the three of us walked here hoping to lighten up the mood from the European Pottery Barn talk =)

At this point as well, I was freaking buzzin'! Two glasses of red + the Hanger drink = wow....was feelin' it already. I wasn't going to drink anymore, but of course, my dear sis got me a Pacifico in preparation for Mexico.

The place is huge and but I wasn't feelin' the ambiance and crowd last night. We just went for drinks and I didn't see folks eating. 

Anyway, we'll probably be back again. 

PS: They had a lot of beer selection. If your a beer dude like my bro, this is your spot!
author: Cath M.

description: Great local crowd, always a good time.
author: Quinn S.

description:
I've been to the Fly Bar several times. It's a cool for Beer, Wine, Sake and Soju kind of drinks. The Happy Hour offers a few specials and 1/2 off the pizzas.

I used to take my grandmother here for pints of stella and pizza, I remember how much she loved it. It's been a long time since I've been back, but it was worth it. 

I recently stopped back into to meet my home girl Alexandra N. for a pre-holiday happy hour beverage. I like the Fly Bar, it's an easy, good place to meet folks before a night of fun on the town.
