author: Rebekah T.

description: My boyfriend and I come just for the sangria- it's delicious and strong plus a pitcher(full to the brim) is only $24!
author: Maggie S.

description:
I am so so sorry Fly Bar! Danny and I walked out on our tab after we got distracted with playing pool. Good thing my babe goes there often and could pay it. 

The atmosphere is exactly what I love. Bartenders are awesome. Art and the decor is really cool. I wish I had this bar in Roseville were I live. I will definitely be coming back, for drink and food and paying for it!...and then some ;)

I am craving it the pizza!
author: Skye J.

description: Came here on a quiet Tuesday before a Giants game. Watched some soccer. Drank some beer. My gf had some sangria. Laid back atmosphere. I mean idk what else do people expect?? I thought it was awesome.
author: Steven L.

description:
Pretty nice. pretty nice.
The saketinis werent my favorite.
I had the suckle and its just not so tasty.
Later had one with soymilk-- surprisinly pretty good. tasted like a creamsicle.

Bartender was helpful and cool. Props.

Chill place.
author: Ash R.

description: Megan the bartender was beyond amazing!!! I will be coming back just for her. Happy hour prices are hard to beat!! Pizza was beyond delish and beer selection was excellent. Cheers!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Stumbled in to Fly Bar one recent Sunday for something to eat. It didn't disappoint. I had the La Tortilla salad and my BF had the Greek pizza. Both were delish. Bartender was gracious and friendly even though she was the only person working. She was bartender and waitress and did it all with a smile. 

They have many great beers on tap and clientele always mixed and low key  

Prices seemed fair to me. We will be back.
author: Cindi C.

description: Been going to Fly for 12 years and it has always been a go to good bar with solid food and beers, even through the recent Tech revolution of Douchebaggery in the Hood' it has stayed solid. Sadly, one of their Bartenders who has been there since the beginning has soured way too much. John has become your typical 40+ year old tender who treats alot of people he doesn't know like crap. Maybe he woke up and realized he pissed away the last decade or more pouring beers and taking pizza orders in a dive bar, who knows but  I'm through with Fly. The girls are cool but he needs a change, so go F yourself John and get a real job like the rest of everyone you know.
author: Erin T.

description: Love this bar.. Ordered a bottle of Malbec wine and ordered the hummus and olive tapenade  plate and it was just perfect after Yoga class on a weekday.  Our bartender was really nice and friendly which is a huge plus.  Will definitely come back for Thursday nights after Yoga and possibly on Saturdays.
author: Claudine V.

description:
Sake and Soju drinks are SOOOO worth it!!!! Soju redbull was one of my favs :)

Food...the pizza is not too bad. I've tried the Mediterranean, South Western, Blanco, and the Funky Chicken and if you are a fan of cheese, the BLANCO is the best pizza!!!!

p.s. The stars on the ceiling are SO CUTE! I love the decor!
author: Liz W.

description:
Delicious sake-bombs (like actually tastier than average) and sake/soju cocktails. My friends and I usually 'end up' at Fly Bar pretty frequently. Too bad the DJ was kind of a d-bag to us the last time we were there.

I know DJs don't like taking requests and having to play popular songs but it was a Saturday night at a popular bar. Save the underground experimentation for a weeknight... or at least don't perpetuate soul-draining lies like "I'll play it next!".

Even worse was after my friend and I's Kanye request got shut down I tried to act all cool and request some less mainstream hip hop acts... only to be further shot down with the expressed disapproval of my taste in music. So cruel, Fly Bar. So cruel.
author: Sabrina M.

description: Dirty restroom, porn on tv for 10 mins, nice ambiance, delicious pizzetta, good beer, attentive staff, pool table, short wait.
author: Kaan O.

description: I can't say anything about the food, but I really liked everything else about this bar! The bartenders were nice the few times we came here and the vibe is really laid back. It wasn't too packed (meaning, there weren't enough people for me to get frustrated with everyone in two seconds and want to leave) and the weird art was weird (and cool and fun to look at, obviously). The crowd seemed pleasant and nice--we came here multiple times, and that means something since we weren't in town for long and very well could have explored some more.
author: Kaitlin D.

description: This place is great! Good vibes, ambience, and fast service. Caitlin, the amazing bartender, is why we keep coming back! Stop here for a good beer or some sangria!!
author: Cassandra C.

description: Loved the laid-back atmosphere.  It was nice, relaxed place to just grab a beer.  Not super crowded and not full of crazy drunks.  Would definitely come here again!
author: Ashley K.

description:
Fly bar has the magical combination of dim lighting and loud music that relieves the burden of dull company.  Dranks help too, I guess.  

My middle school self would have died in here - star shaped paper lanterns, DIY canvas turned mirror mosaics, and those tear-drop lanterns that made Starbucks cool back when nobody gave a fuck about local businesses.  The place looks like somebody raided Urban Outfitters circa 2004 and thought, "that's good for this century."  It's all part of Fly Bar's greatest feature: it is NOT pretentious.  

The beers are average price for SF and they only have Saktails, a cheap way for businesses to avoid that whole liquor license thing.  The menu is aiiiight but the real Hootie of the Blowfish is the Caramel Blue pizza: crispy crust, skanky blue cheese, creamy garlic sauce, sweet onions.  Gimme gimme more.
author: Ellen C.

description: Always a good spot in the hood. I thoroughly enjoy their Sangria and the staff is always mellow and helpful. I often meet my girlfriends here for a drink or app to catch up on our weekly gossip. The nachos are bomb as are their pizzas. I'd refrain from heading into this place before there's a show at the Independent. Gets crowdy.
author: Bri R.

description:
This place is dope. I love the small, intimate setting at this location rather than the larger social one in the TL. The bartender here was really pleasant and pretty attentive, he convinced my friend and I to try the Sake mixed drinks despite our hesitation. They were delicious, we each had 3! My mother later joined us and she thought the place was so cool and had a lot of character. She never goes to bars so this was right up her alley because it was a lot nicer, had nibbles and cute atmosphere for conversation and girls night.

We nibbled on the "Chick Stix" with the peanut sauce and it's house made and soooo yummy. That was my mom's favorite part of the night! Definitely going to come here again, great location because it's right near the Independent where we were seeing a show. So nice to chill here instead of standing in the cold waiting!
author: Ariele M.

description: The food and service was awesome! I ate the Margherita pizza and hummus appetizer. It was soooooo good. They have a decent amount of selections for vegetarians like myself! Definitely coming back next time I'm in the city!
author: Kerianne P.

description: Mmm, i love the nice open layout. It feels comfortable to hang out there and not squished into a long narrow bar. The pool table actually has breathing room around it so you can watch the game without being in the players' way every 5 seconds. big plus.
author: Sonya Z.

description:
Came here with some fellow yelpers (Travis S. and Benjamin L.) to grab a bite to eat and catch up.  Travis already described everything... so I'm feeling a little behind.  The quick review is that we got some pizzas, a pitcher of sangria and some spinach & artichoke dip.  It was all good and affordable, but nothing to blow your socks off.  The pizza was super thin crust so you felt a bit healthier eating it. The spinach and artichoke was the biggest disappointment as it came with these flimsy bread things that were very difficult to dip.

The space itself was pretty cool.  Saturday at around 7:30pm it was full but not packed, so we had no trouble getting a table.  The music was blasting so you had to shout some to be heard, but it was still manageable.  Service came with a smile.  

That's all I got.
author: Denis S.

description: they have a nice selection of beers on tap and out of a bottle. It's a good place to start an evening of unwinding. After a long week.
author: Beni R.

description: Great staff, affordable prices, surprisingly delicious food, and always an entertaining crew of regulars at the bar.   The Sangria is the perfect hangover cure and a nice start to some serious day drinking.  The Brie app and the pizzas are always delish.  Staff has always been friendly.  Overall, a great neighborhood spot!
author: Cassidy F.

description: Fly is a great place to get a drink and a fine meal before or after a show at the Independent.  Great location and ambiance, good food and service.
author: Nicole R.

description:
Fly Bar is a great standard that has been around for a while.  If you don't live in the neighborhood but are venturing out to see a show at the Independent I'd highly recommend stopping by here beforehand.  They have a very generous happy hour that usually goes until 6:30.  We just missed it last time we were here but the bill wasn't too bad anyway.  The bartenders are friendly and they always have cool and different art on the walls.

The food here is very good as well which you wouldn't normally expect but the pizzas are great and my fiance had the meatloaf and she loved it.
author: Blake B.

description: Always a good spot for a couple of beers and a snack. If you time it right, they have a good deal on their pizzas during happy hour.  If not, the chicken nachos area always a good choice too.  Great selection of draft beers.
author: Dilly M.

description: Ducked in here to avoid the rain while waiting for a show at The Independent (2 blocks away). Happy hour till 6:30 = a delicious pizza, pretty good chips/guacamole/salsa appetizer, two draft beers and two tall glasses of decent Sangria for $30 total. Fast, friendly service in a good neighborhood. Cool bar vibe too with interesting, talkative patrons. Definitely recommend!
author: Jeremy D.

description:
I feel like I take Fly Bar for granted and I'm really really sorry because, this weekend, I was once again reminded of why this place is awesome.

The boy and I were looking for a low-key spot to grab some dinner. After much deliberation, we decided on Fly Bar. I'm glad we came in when we did because there was ONE table for two open once we arrived. It was pretty busy!

We ordered the Mediterranean salad for starters which came with mixed greens, feta cheese, beets, olives, bits of potato salad, and oil & vinegar dressing. This is probably my favorite of their salads. We also ordered the Blanco pizza - sun-dried tomatoes, artichokes, red onions, scallions, and garlic sauce. Their pizzas are thin and crunchy and a great option for groups since they are the perfect size for sharing. Their bar is beer and wine only!

This is a great date place or a place to grab a low-key dinner, but keep in mind that it can get busy, crowded and loud during HH time!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Wow, it has been YEAAAARS since I've been at Fly.  And, the last time I was there I only had drinks.  They serve food?  I didn't know!  lol

We ordered a whole bunch of food.  Everything looked good.  I got the Margarita pizza and shared the shroom pizza.  Shroom pizza was definitely  better.  Drinks was pretty good but small.  At $5 I get it though. Yes, I would come back....
author: Rosalind S.

description: Admittedly,  we stopped in just to use the bathroom and so I had to get a drink.   It must've been happy hour cause they had 3 dollar sangrias.  The bartender was very sweet and gave my baby daughter a free coke.  Props to the blonde behind the bar.
author: Trach L.

description:
I forgot how much I live this place. Super casual and comfortable and versatile enough to start off a girls night, go on a casual date, happy hour, catch up with a friend, anything!

The pizza is fine, salad great, beer selection great, prices awesome, and bartender super friendly and welcoming. (No liquor license)
author: Nors P.

description: I was staying in San Fran last weekend and tried this since my hotel was right next door. I ordered the Tuna sandwich (I believe it was the O'Charlie?) Anyways, I don't think Tuna sandwiches will ever be the same - it was INCREDIBLE! Who knew feta tasted so well on a tuna sandwich? The bartender was very friendly and also very helpful (took the time to give us directions around SF) I would love to come back and try again when I visit.
author: Kelley S.

description:
************************** 519 ****************************

           My cousin lives right around the corner here, so when I walk her dog, I swing by for a drink or watch a game.  Cheap drinks, always friendly service, decent appetizers and pizza. One of my fav neighborhood spots.
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
Went here tonight for a friends birthday for thei happy hour on Sunday. Great little bar, it was pretty busy for a Sunday too. They had great pizza especially for the $5 I think it costs during happy hour. Great selection of beer, sake cocktails, and sangria!

Normally wouldn't call this place my kind of bar but it is a great spot to meet up with friends and have a great time.
author: Michael C.

description:
Came here on a whim. The rave reviews re: the happy hour seemed encouraging.... So why not.

We ordered the Southwestern and the Carmel Blue (?), and a couple of Sakes. I've had *much* better Sake, was extremely watered down. The server was nice enough - Waited about 45 minutes for the food, and then they informed us that they sent our pizzas to the "wrong table". Ummmm wtf? Thanks for the news, I guess. 30 mins later, we got out food.

Food was great though. Excellent pizza. Really could have done without the 1 hour wait, though. Still, if they promise to not take so damn long next time, I'd go back for some more of that Carmel Blue cheese (or w/e) that was delicious.
author: Meg P.

description:
Happy Hour~

$3 for Drafts, Sake Cocktails & 1/2 off pizzas. Yummilicious!!

I got the Sake Nectar: Sake, pineapple juice, orange juice. Mmmmm. I like to sip my drinks, so one lasted me throughout happy hour.

Spinach and artichoke dip. Ohlala. Piping hot!! It was so good that we didn't care about getting our fingers burn. We ate like savages!

Pizzas: Funky Chicken, Mmmm...Meat & Blanco. Maybe I'm becoming a guy. But I liked those meat pizzas waaaaay more. BBQ sauce and chicken. Tons of sausage and cheese. MmmMmmMmm. I can care less about the Blanco (artichoke w/ sun-dried tomatoes).

It's a small place. And it filled up pretty fast on Friday. Be prepared to squeeze and rub elbows with other people. And of course watch the windows fog up like a sauna room.
author: Marti L.

description:
Came with Marti L., Jimmy N., plus others for Friday happy hour.  Mind you, none of us live or work anywhere near this 'hood.  We call it new restaurant Fridays because we're duper adventurous!

1/2 price pizzas, $3 beer/sangria/sake cocktails during happy hour.  Awesome!

The drinks:
Sake Nectar
Japanese Chiwawa x2
Sake Breeze
Sake Georgia
Sangria
Hef
Black velvet x2
Snakebite

The food:
Spinach and artichoke dip served with French baguette.  Too little bread for the excellent dip!

Funky Chicken pizza - bbq sauce, chicken breast, smoked gouda, red onions and scallions.  Not being a big fan of bbq sauce, I still managed to snag a slice or two.

Mmmmm...meat pizza - tomato sauce, sausage, pepperoni, prosciutto, green peppers and mozzarella.  Um, there was priosciutto in here?  Maybe I was intoxicated so I didn't realize?

Blanco pizza - white garlic sauce with jack cheese, sun dried tomatoes, artichokes, red onions and scallions.  Love in a pie.  Love!

Yay!  I'm a fan.  And we shall return!
author: Jenny L.

description: Super close to my place so I chill there a lot. Awesome sangria, pizza and salads. They don't do cocktails but apparently their beer selection is spot on.
author: Julia K.

description: More like 4.5 stars. If you don't want pizza for some reason, there's an abundance of truly unique salads and sandwiches. Get the bacon vinaigrette salad - it's full of warm, gooey tomatoes at the bottom. Great place to relax, superb drink prices. Go here if you're heading to The Independent for a show.
author: C S.

description:
Fly Bar would have to f-up really bad to get anything less than five stars for two reasons: 

1) There one of the few bars in NOPA to do last call when last call is supposed to be - 2 am 

2) There one of the ONLY bars in NOPA (actually not just bars but ANY business for that matter) that takes plastic! I don't get this whole thing with businesses (mostly locally owned businesses) NOT taking credit cards. Are they afraid of losing there indie cred or something? *stepping off soapbox* 

That stuff aside this place is just a good place to grab drinks. They have an extensive beer selection, and although I'm not really into soju drinks, if that's your thing they have many to choose from. The crowd is hard to explain, but every time I've been here it's the same weird hard-to-describe crowd that's hanging out. It's hipster, but not really. It's collegy, but it still feels like an older crowd. There's guys that didn't get the memo that the Ashton Kutcher, trucker-hat wearing fad isn't cool anymore and girls wearing heels and designer brands. It's a weird collection of people, but somehow it all works. 

The place is spacious and has has a lot of seating. The bartenders are friendly and pretty quick with drink orders. I've never had the food, but I've heard the burgers are really good. I think I've covered everything...
author: George A.

description:
I'm trying to wrap my mind around why everyone is being so generous with this place. I guess I came on an off night, but wow. Appetizer took at least 25-30 minutes to come out (it was the baked brie app. How hard could that be? Throw some cheese in the oven and bake it for a few minutes). Entrees came out roughly 30-40 minutes later (2 pizzas and a salad. We're not asking you to bake an apple pie). I mean REALLY. 

And the food was just ok, nothing to write home about. Certainly not worth waiting that long. And there's not even a full bar! Ok, I'm done whining.
author: Steven S.

description: I left a pair of nice Ray Bans here and returned a week later with little hope of retrieving them, but they had held onto them!   I wasn't drinking tonight, but I will be back with friends to thank them.  Class act in my book.
author: Michael W.

description:
The place is small and kind of funky. 

The sake cocktails are pretty good, and pretty cheap.

You come here for the food though. So good and so random at a bar. 

They have a pool table, but it's kind of cramped and I've never really seen it free.

It's been a long time since I've gone here for happy hour, but I remember it being a good deal.
author: Brittany P.

description:
Fly bar..... with a name with bar in it, you'd assume they'd have a full bar, right?  Wrong..... only BEER and WINE are served. 

The food here is surprisingly good.  We got the MMMMM....MEAT pizza and FOGHORN LEGHORN sandwich.

The Foghorn Leghorn sandwich consisted of roasted chicken, bacon, roasted tomatoes, provolone on a baguette.  Comes with a side salad (mixed greens + frisee lettuce) with a delicious house vinaigrette - a healthy touch for bar food.

The MMM.... MEAT pizza was pretty good:  Generous portions of meat:  sausage, pepperoni, prociutto, green bell peppers, tomato and mozzarella cheese. 

Overall, a pretty chill place with a relaxed atomosphere.  Service could've been a bit more attentive, because we had to flag down the waitress a couple times to refill our waters and eventually ask for the bill.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Simple, unpretentious bar with a decent beer selection and tasty food. The chicken-to-cheese ratio in the quesadilla was perfect. Weeknight vibe was the right amount of fun and low-key. It's a little dark in the tables in the back and not too noisy to have a conversation. Great neighborhood spot, I'll definitely be back.
author: Leah R.

description:
Miss Natasha R. took me here for some happy hour drinks while we were waiting on a couple of spots to open up at a nearby nail salon. One sangria turned into 3 plus two pizzas. 

This happy hour rocks! $3 sangrias (large glasses) are a great start to a fun night out in the city. We ordered the portobello mushroom pizza with pesto and a margeritha pizza. Both were too die for, although the mushroom one was slightly favored. At $5.50 ($9 regular), this is one of the cheapest happy hours since one pizza per person is plenty. 

Cute ambiance with chairs at the bar and some intimate tables throughout the rest of the place. Billiards table presents a mellow, fun activity if you're in a group. Bar tenders are friendly and efficient. 

I'll insist that we are going back here the next time I crash at Natasha R.'s for girls night out!
author: Anna R.

description:
Cool bar in my 'hood.' Used to be somewhat of a regular, but haven't been in awhile (well, OK maybe because I took an ex there for one of our first dates). Clearly, I need to get over it and head over to Fly, no?! 

I always have a great time at Fly. Good beer, wine, and soju selection. Music is always jammin' (whether the resident DJ is there or not). The vibe is pretty cool, although there were a few times where it seemed to be amateur night and all about  the students and youngins. 

You can't go wrong with the reasonably priced-food (from the apps to the salads to the sammies). I am a cheesy gal, so one of my fav apps is the baked brie. It's served warm, and spreads so smoothly on the baguette. The garlic isn't overpowering either. Oh, and as a cheese lover, I heart the grilled cheese sammie. Hello, it's on sourdough, my most fav bread! Oh, and it's somewhat healthy since there's tomato! Ok, so if you want the real healthy stuff, go for the salads, with super fresh and crisp lettuce, and are ginormous! My fav is the fruit to nuts. 

Time for me to fly over to FLY (hopefully, soon!)
author: Gill C.

description: Excellent bartenders, fun people, pool table, killer sangria, always an enjoyable time i make my way out  here. This used to be my neighborhood bar so it feels like a small peace of home. Perfect area for hopping around for food and drink.
author: Anthoney P.

description:
I havent been here for a while...I used to be a semi-regular here when I would come in on a Wednesay day, where the girl would always play a ton of Wu Tang.  Came here last Wed and it was just your average weird day scene.
Good bar overall though.
author: Matt O.

description: Got the buzzkill and the michelado - both were extremely tarty. Almost like someone poured tart acid into the drinks. Server was nice and welcoming but the drinks were no good. Let's just leave it at - I had a Zantac in my pocket and used it.
author: Cody Y.

description:
There is a large chunk of brie cheese you can have delivered to your table. It is accompanied by the perfect amount of bread. Get it, you will be pleased.

They also have sake cocktails, which won't even get a twelve-year-old drunk, but taste pretty great.   I did see some twelve-year-olds in there, which I thought was weird, but technically the place is also a restaurant.  

Minus one star for the twelve-year-olds!
author: Juliette F.

description:
This place is an excellent location for happy hour!! 6 of us met up and ordered 8 pizzas at half off and roughly 4 drinks each. As I watched the men inhale slice after slice of pizza I was extremely apprehensive on how much damage this HH would do to the wallet but it turned out to be only $19 each!! Soooooo worth it!! I tried 3 different cocktails - Japanese Chiwawa, the pear one and one surprise one that the waitress brought. They were good! Although, admittedly, not that strong. No problem, couple glasses of Stella later I was allllllll good!

The pizzas we ordered were Shroom Pie, Mmm..Meat, Jimmy Greek, the chicken one and the pineapple one. By far our favorites were Shroom Pie and Mmm...Meat!! I think that those two have the most creative fun to say names as well =).

Also, the good thing is if you get to comfortable and end up staying past happy hour (4:30-6:30) beers are only $4 as opposed to the $3 happy hour price and it gives you an excuse to try the rest of the menu as well! We loaded up on the brie and roasted garlic and it was mMmm MmMm good!!
author: Christina L.

description:
We headed to Fly Bar before a concert at the Independent. While the concert was a little bit of a disappointment, Fly Bar was not!

I enjoyed a couple glasses of delicious sangria and was thrilled that a large glass was just $4. A lot of the beers were also only $4-$5! They also had soju cocktails and a couple with soy milk as an ingredient... interesting! Everyone who ordered food loved their pizza's, sandwiches, salads, etc. My bf ordered the Mediterranean salad and it was huge and great! It included fresh greens, beets, spicy peppers, green peppers, feta, tomatoes, etc. It was too big for him to eat on his own but perfect for me to steal several bites of! Even better, it was only about $8 (less than Mixt Greens!)

The bar was busy but we were able to combine tables to seat about 10 of us. Good times, good food, and cheap drinks! Yippee!
author: Meghan P.

description: Vying for Misha's favorite bar on Divis status with the slightly superior Page, Fly Bar is just always playing the hip hop from the 90's that I want to hear. I feel like 20 somethings are all in that boat and it's surprising more bars don't cater to it.
author: Misha T.

description:
Fly Bar has really Fun (and at times random) music that took me back and sake drink combos that intrigued and then got me a little buzzed.

Something I haven't heard for a while and helped set the mood:
http://youtube.com/watch?v=rhZVq-bZMHQ
The nigori punch: somewhat sweet and unfiltered sake combined with a couple tropical juices.  The flavor and consistency reminded me of Kern's guava juice.  But then the alcohol slowly crept in and told me this kind of juice isn't meant for kids.

Something I haven't heard for a long while and got me curious about what they would be playing next:
http://youtube.com/watch?v=rhZVq-bZMHQ
The sake nectar: a more flavorful and fresher pineapple and/or orange juice would have really rounded out this cocktail.  Instead, the combination of flavors really never married well.

Overall, it is a nice place to sit back and relax.
The warm colored walls and cool decor work well to create a nice feel.
And Yeah, I will be back to try their food and a couple more drinks.  I also want to see if they play a little Soft Cell.
author: Dan B.

description:
A Tribute to two of my favorite things...the Fly Bar and U2...you can't go wrong loving either....

"A man will rise 
A man will fall 
From the sheer face of love 
Like a FLY on a wall 
It's no secret at all."

Shhh...the locals would love to keep The Fly Bar a secret...It is a wonderful place.  13 years later, it's better than ever. It can get busy on the weekends...but during the week it's great!
author: Jackie M.

description:
It's been over a year since my first review for Fly bar and shame on me--after my initial dismal experience, I have been back on a regular basis. 

I love coming here mainly for the warm service by their bartenders, their Pizzettas (pizzas with salad on top), and  their heaping glasses of Malbec. 

The crowd is usually diverse and chill. It's always a good time...
author: Mimi T.

description:
What a wonderful place to stumble into! Yes, it's dark in there. And yes, the music is loud. But the food is absolutely wonderful and the staff are... ...just charming. Be brave and order the nachos. And yes, order it WITH the grilled chicken. It tastes good enough to make a militant vegetarian cry and return to the ranks of carnivorous sanity...

Karin en Jasper: het wachtwoord is V.I.P. 2. Wat hadden jullie anders gedacht?!
author: Zeneca R.

description:
3.25

Good for happy hour until 6:30pm but I think the pizzas taste better at the other location on sutter although parking here is definitely easier. Pizzas are $6 and $1 off draft beers, sangria, and sake cocktails. Theres a decent variety of pizzas although I thought they were a little undercooked this time. They also have a pool table which cost $1 in quarters, however the table and balls are a bit small and the walls get in the way. Either way its a decent place for happy hour but theres better ones out there.
author: Robert Y.

description:
Fly Bar is the kind of relaxed neighborhood bar you wander into after dinner thinking you'll have just one drink and then head home to bed on time. 

Things start off reasonably enough - you order nigori (unfiltered) sake and make polite conversation with those around you. Then your wild and saucy New York co-worker demands that everyone do sake bombs and before you know it. . .

Thank you Fly Bar for a ridiculously fun Tuesday night!
author: Miriam W.

description:
This is a beer/wine bar only. No hard liquor. Six of us came here "late" at night on a Saturday.

A few things that disappointed:

1) Only ONE bathroom. Literally.
2) Beer and wine only.
3) My sauvignon blanc cost $8 and was smaller than a regular glass of wine.

A few things to come back for:

1) Great art on the wall and pool table.
2) Ambiance / decor / music all very nice (date like)
3) Friendly waitstaff and not overly crowded.

So, I would come back for happy hour, a date, or as a way to start my night out with friends.. But I wouldn't come here expecting to boooooze.
author: Roxane W.

description:
I know I'm going against the grain of fellow reviews here but this was not a hot experience for me.  The first stop on a last minute catch-up night.

It took too long for us to even get service as we stood at the bar while the bartender was getting drinks for others patrons???...oh no!! (SMH) she was choppin it up w/ other bartenders and friends on the other end of the bar!!!  Hate bad customer service!

We finally ordered our drinks and took a seat at one of the many empty tables (slow night...so another reason for the irritation at no service) by the window and started our catch up.  Not sure why it took so long but finally received our drinks which were left at the bar without a nod, signal...anything. hmppph!  The Pink Ginger Soju I had was eh, but drinkable.  

But, loved the decor of the place. Starry night lights, wall art, pool table in the back...I'm gonna give the benefit of the doubt and say based on others reviews, we just came on a REALLY off night.  I'll probably give it one more try...maybe order some food also.  Or maybe I'll try the Sutter location first...
author: Ninja H.

description:
Popped in a couple nights ago while bar hopping for the boyfrond's 25th. We came on a friends suggestion, as we'd never been there before. 

The decor is super fun! They are a beer and wine only bar (they do serve saki and serve saki cocktails.) There was a pool table I remember seeing, but it was completely occupied- but fun!

The service was great. The bartender was patient, polite, and a cutie!

We weren't there long, but I'd try this place again.
author: Savannah P.

description:
After my date and I met up with some people we have not seen in over five years at Solstice, we decided to head out to Fly after one drink.  The number one reason?  Because I have not been to Fly and I wanted to write a Yelp review about it :-)!

There was a very nice crowd (college students, business men, couples, etc.) at 12:20am, but my date and I still managed to find a table.  I really liked the drink menu written on a big chalkboard at the bar.  Atmosphere is  pleasant -- I loved the art prints on the wall.  I did however, found it odd that I was the only Asian woman there...

We enjoyed a half pitcher of Sangria as we psychoanalyze people.  I loved the Sangria, but it was a bit weak according to my date.  This bar is swimming with flirty men looking for flirty women ;-)!
author: Celeste M.

description: Always a great place to come for a quick drink or two. Good selection of wine and beer. When feeling a little frisky I recommend the sake bombs! Hot sake and pear cider = delicious! Love it! Staff are pretty great and just friendly good people.
author: Michelle D.

description:
known as the 'perfect data spot'  - it really is....

Yes - only beer and wine, but the SANGRIA - awesome stuff

And masked behind all of the nervous and giggly first daters or the just met that night make out-ers, there is actually very very good food.

I highly recommend the MEATLOAF SANDWICH !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Notables: Foghorn Leghorn and the Thai pizzette
author: Walker C.

description:
Ok....

You don't have a full bar.

AND you have a limited menu?

I mean... extremely limited.

There have been very few times I've walked into a place, sat down, ordered a drink, looked at the menu, and immediately wanted to leave.  My poor bestie had to convince me to at least finish our drinks.  I was starving, too.  Which should tell you how unimpressive the menu was.  I didn't even want to try anything!

Poor, poor service.  We walked in and couldn't really tell if we were supposed to seat ourselves and look for a menu or if someone was eventually going to direct us.  The bartender pretty much ignored us, so we figured we'd just grab our own seats.

I freakin HATE soju cocktails.  Gross.
author: Lauren R.

description:
I'm being very generous on my rating for Fly Bar. 

Service was good, sangria was great, Saki cocktails were ok (interesting), and nachos were ok . The crowd was chill and cool--lighting was dull and dim. I came to Fly Bar with high expectations from the reviews on Yelp and I left feeling I would probably come back if I had to, but I wouldn't jump through hoops to do so. 

Because the service and beverages were good I give Fly Bar an OK. 

Although, I got FOOD POISONING from the nachos, because of the great reviews from Yelp I'm assuming it was a freak of nature and something out of the norm for this place. However, what I was most irritated with was when I called the following day (practically on my death bed) to give them heads up to check their food, the weekend manager didn't seem interested, and asked if I had the flu instead. I think we all know the difference between a flu and food poisoning without going into details. He never asked my name or number and only brushed me off with an apology already tarnished by doubt. Not cool buddy. I was reluctant on Yelping about this, but because of the nonchalant attitude of the severity of this issue, I assume they wouldn't care if I did so.
author: Angelique M.

description: Half of pitcher = 12 dollars. This is a great way to end the night. It's the perfect amount of wine and sweetness. Yummy.
author: Eve C.

description:
Fantastic bar that is chill enough to appeal to its neighbors as well as draw a more diverse crowd on Friday and Saturday night. 

No hard liquor served, but great sake and soju cocktails that are positively deeelish. 

Food is pretty rockin too - especially considering it's a bar! Chicken and Goat Cheese Quesadilla is bomb diggity. And pizzas are super cheapo if you get there before 6:30. (I know waaaay too much about this place. I feel a little pathetic now.)

4 stars because cocktail service isn't great. Much better service at the bar in my experience. And Russ is oh-so-dreamy!
author: Lindsay S.

description: Cool chill bar to meet up or start the night
author: Jamel I.

description:
Came here because candybar down the street was closed on halloween! We down a bit thinking that we could find another place.. and sure enough we ran into Fly Bar. 

Didnt have any expectations for the place because when I walked in it seemed like a normal bar food place.. kinda smelled like musty beer. 

It turned out to be really fun! They have pitchers of sangria, which was pretty good.. not the strongest.. but just as good as Cha Cha Cha's so I can't complain. 

They also had pretty cheap (~$9) pizzas which came out quickly and super fresh and really delicious. I had the blue cheese pizza. You can definitely share with someone,  especially if you are eating it as a snack with a drink.  

They also have a pool table and interesting murals and art on the walls.  Hidden treasure in the Western Addition!
author: Sirina K.

description: Great place for a catch-up with a friend! Cute ambiance and great beer selection.
author: Megan G.

description:
This place looks seedy on the outside but on the insides, its probably just the same. This place has the BEST appetizers, the cheapest cocktails/drinks, and a casual vibe. I'm giving this a 4 because they do not have a full bar. I guess they are known for their SAKE and SOJU drinks. 

Try the nachos (they are indeed the best), and the pizzas. Great happy hour place. Parking is tough. Crowded at times. Friendly service. Cheap drinks. Good food.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Directions for going to Fly Bar:

1.  Find yourself a seat or bar stool.
2  Kindly ask the waitress for a Tuna Melt with bacon and a side of ranch!
3.  Indulge.
4.  Post on Yelp, best damn Tuna Melt ever. (yeah its capitalized for a reason, this Tuna Melt has authority!)
author: Kristin Marie S.

description:
happy. hour. 

$6 pizzas, $3 draft beers. 

order jimmy the greek! delicious.
author: Eliza D.

description: Half pitcher of Sangria to start. Let's drink y'all!!!
author: QueenIce D.

description: I live around the corner, and frequent Fly Bar for Happy Hour, sangria, and nachos pretty often. I've never felt the need to write a review for this place until I was there last night. A couple of us sat at a table towards the back for food and drinks, and had the most amazing service from JP! Considering this is a bar, and you definitely don't go there expecting top of the line service, we were completely blown away at how nice and attentive he was! Definitely recommend this place for a low key bar to chill and grab drinks.
author: Alexandra D.

description:
Nice lighting, good crowd, friendly and attentive staff. Jose is the man.

Funky rotating art collection. 

Takes credit cards. 

3 blocks from my house.

A quesadilla and Down Town Brown really hit the spot.
author: Dylan ..

description: Tasty pitcher of sangria for $20 and great atmosphere. Haven't eaten yet here since I've been concentrating on drinking, but I'll be back.
author: Lauren C.

description:
While visiting SF last week we stumbled upon flybar and could not have been more satisfied with the food, the atmosphere the service and the price! 
We were in for happy hour and had an appetizer (spinach artichoke dip) two beers and two small pizzas. 
This will be my newest go to while in SF!!!!
Absolutely the best pizza I've ever had. I'm seriously going to end up drunk and calling to tell them I'm miss the pizza!!!
author: Peter R.

description:
When someone suggests that we go somewhere "divey"... I always counter with going here instead. And I win. Oh, I play to win, people. ;)

I'm *almost sad* that I didn't move down the block from this place. Fun happy hour "neighborhood bar" hangout atmosphere. But it gives me an excuse to visit my beloved NOPA and exercise my parking karma to the limit. So yeah, I dig this spot. Menu has always been outstandingly cheap by my standard. A charming happy hour goes on here. Crowd is usually very eclectic and fun. Great meet up spot for you and your friends for drinks... and ALWAYS meet new people too (sometimes you're shoulder-to-shoulder and you can't help but be a little social!) Have the quesadilla & sangria: for a hell-to-the-yah experience. Woo!
author: Diana F.

description:
I think I've underestimated this bar, being that it's right down the street from me and that when I go out I'd like to feel as if I'm actually, like, GOING somewhere. My roommates and I used to drop by fairly often, back in our youthful 21 year-old days (like, last year), but lately the most action Fly has been getting from us is a visit to its bathroom while we're buzzing and waiting for a cab on the corner of Divis and Fulton.

However, last night chillin' with my new friend, the music was too loud at Club Waziema and Madrone was charging a cover, so I suggested we head over to Fly, the neighborhood default. Of course being on that certain stretch of Divis, by default hard liquor was unavailable. We ordered the sangria, which is stroooong. Chatting under the favorable volume of Ella Fitzgerald and JT, sipping our drinks in a cozy booth below the dim lighting of the star lamps dotting the ceiling, I realized hey, this place is pretty cool. Sexy, even. I guess I just tend to forget because it's so close to home.

To kill time while your bladder explodes waiting in line for the one stall, unisex, toilet seat cover-less bathroom (minus a star), stare very closely at the artwork of the girl in the outhouse--tripped me out the first time I realized it was a painting, not a photograph! Or maybe I just don't have the eye for that kinda thing, though from now I certainly won't take the neighborhood default for granted. Fly is bringing sexy back... yeah!
author: Kate V.

description:
My gay friend Nick was in town, and being gay and newly single, he naturally wanted to take me out, get me loaded, and see if he could convert me.  This is a game we often play and I enjoy very much, because he never wins, but yet never seems to quit.  

He texts me around 6, asking since I had must moved, I gave him directions to my place so we could meet up.  I explain the 5, 21, and 71 buses will go right there.  He responds to say "I'm sorry, you must have me confused with Ms. Rosa Parks, God rest her soul.   I'll be taking a taxi".   Actually, he ended up taking the N and walking through the Haight, which led to his funny complaints about how it was much worse than walking through the Tenderloin, because the TL bums only smell like pee, and Haight bums actually manage to smell like poo.  I countered by saying it could just be dog shit drifting over from the panhandle, but had to admit the Haight really does top them all when it comes to nastiness.  The TL bums can always head down to the fountain on Market to shower off, but over here, we just have to wait for the rain.  And it had been a pretty dry month overall...

Anyway, I was too lazy to head in to the Castro and none of use felt like dealing with the Haight, so we decided to explore NOPA.  Fly Bar was the second of three stops, and overall, easily our favorite.   The interior decor is pleasant and semi-romantic, but also hip, and the bartender was very attentive and wore a very short jean skirt.  And yes, the bartender was a girl, much to Nick's dismay.  Although he likes handsome boys and is bored with fairies and queens.   We all liked the beer selection, and while no food was sampled, it certainly looked and smelled good.   The only problem is there was no booze, and after looking at the sad look on my friend's face, I agreed to hit the Castro with him.  Being the complete asshole that he is, he took me to Moby Dick.   Thankfully, I had already relieved my bladder at Fly Bar.

So there you have it, approval from a straight guy, a straight girl, and a guy that was married to a woman for 5 years, but turned out to be Gay.  Nice showing, Fly Bar.  I'll be back.
author: John H.

description:
Happy hour. Perhaps my favorite phrase in the English language. And Fly Bar does it right.  Great deals on food (tasty food that gets to you quick) and drinks.  
I dont know about the mixed drinks since I had beer but lots of people had yummy-looking colorful concoctions in front of them...maybe next time I may try their sangria or something.  We shared a pizza and a sandwich and the chips and dip. The pizza and the sandwich were good, typical san francisco bar food but tasty. The guacamole and the salsa left a little something to be desired though, sort of bland, not terribly fresh and not enough for the huge plate of chips...but oh well, its a bar and it was good enough. I had fun, I would go back and do it again.
author: Nilu r.

description: Great place in a great location right by the Independent. The only thing that I didn't like was the kitchen closing early. Cool music, Giants games and an eclectic crowd. Some pretty good beer on tap. The nachos looked great, but we couldn't order due to the time.
author: Chris S.

description: Came here a lil while back with bf & friends. The pizza that we ordered was okay. Got the chiwawa drink which was good but looked plain. Love the star lights & the artwork in the bathroom. Cool place to hangout with friends.
author: Amy C.

description: My neighborhood bar: Great chill ambiance, strong & attentive service, solid mixed drinks, cheap sangria, and a pool table which frequently is available. Hard to go wrong!
author: Miles S.

description:
I wasn't there for a long period of time, but noticed right away their pretty clandestine selection of beer that appeal to all tastebuds, fair amount of cushy seating and happens to not be insanely noisy so you can hold a conversation. 

Let's just call this a preliminary trail/review to be concluded later..
author: Alita M.

description: I like this bar.  The drinks are nice and they surprisingly have tasty pizza.  The crowd is diverse and the atmosphere is welcoming.  I'd happily return if in the neighborhood.
author: Jade F.

description: The Sangria alone made this place fantastic in my book, but the atmosphere and bartenders helped make this place even better.  The ONLY reason I give it 4 stars is because there wasn't a full bar.  A full bar would make this place one of my absolute favorites in the city.  Despite that, this place is great for hanging out with friends or for winding down the night... I just really wish I could have had an Old Fashioned or Rye Sour here because it probably would have blown my mind.
author: Eric L.

description:
Mild conflict of interest:
Best time to come here is for Happy Hour (3-7)
($5.95 Pizzas, $2.75 Pints)

However, due to the poor lighting, darkly painted walls, and general  dankness, this is not a good afternoon bar. 

The pizza is totally respectable, especially for $6.
Service is usually slow, but friendly.

Beer and wine only, pool table in back, good music playing... a perfect place to start an evening, or just to frequent on a quiet night.
author: Phil P.

description: My fiancée and I stopped in here for a drink after walking for too long. We sat by the window and I propped my tired feet up and enjoyed their great happy hour. What made our visit even better is that we got to see many pride festival goers in their festival outfits. I'm used to costumed party goers and to pride festivals, I live in Montrose, pride central for Houston, Texas. But wow, the costumes and body parts that I saw were sensational! This definitely added to my experience, but I enjoyed the bar itself, especially the window seating.
author: Maria J.

description:
Okay, new review: so it's not "that" bad a place. the quiet chill takes some getting used to, but once you coalesce with the ambiance in this dimly lit but creatively decorated neighborhood lounge, and the crimson sangria by the pitcher, which, though not the best in the world but surprisingly strong and cheap, starts to well-up inside you, you start to enjoy it.  And I had great company.  That can make all the difference in the world. (one more star)

(old review)
I know this is a yelp favorite but I have to be honest, the soju cocktails just don't cut it.  Maybe a fun spot for sake bombing, I don't know.  Nice people, convenient location, and the feel of the booths and the bar are so comfortable.  All you could want from a neighborhood bar....except no liquor license...I'm just not a sake-tini kind of guy I guess....too bad.  Even just a good rum and coke would make this place 4 stars easy, a great mojito, martini, vodka redbull (hard to screw up but trust me, it's been done) a definite 5.  Solution....Go-go gadget flask.
author: Mike V.

description:
Still love the Fly. Will forever love the Fly. Just got Jimmy the Greek Pizza, Although it was also salty, it ruled!!! So worth $5. And you can easily come in here early and find an empty pool table.

The service is nothing spectacular, but maybe they'll work on that. Or not.
author: Rachel G.

description:
I have only been once and I liked it, the drink menu was really yummy!! The night I went kind of had a college kid feel, but it also felt like the crowd kept changing on the hour and I liked that.  The bar also has a pool table, so if your into that this is a good bar for it.

Great yummy mix drinks, go check it out!
author: T C.

description:
I wound up here while biking around looking for a place to watch the NBA finals game after work, since it was the only bar close by that served food.  I came alone as usual, story of my life.  Loneliness aside, I was pretty impressed.

The happy hour specials are awesome.  $6 pizzas and specials on drafts and signature cocktails.  I wasn't crazy about the carmel blue pizza, but some of the others looked great.  I had a Scrimshaw and a whiskey sour as well.  The beer selection is a little lacking, but they have a large full bar, interesting decor, and the service was still good.  I'll definitely be coming back here, hopefully with a hot date next time.

Oh, and it's not really a sports bar - they only have one TV, but I didn't mind at all.
author: Paul W.

description:
Eh...

It's not Fly Bar's fault that I wasn't served any alcohol (I had just finished a run, and didn't have my ID on me) but the slow service certainly is.  The tuna sandwich was also not more than passable.

At the end of the day Fly Bar is not horrible, but with so many terrific bars yet to be explored in SF, I doubt that it is one I will be coming back to.
author: Sam D.

description: Small plates in place of standardfare bar food?  Sold.
author: Kristen S.

description:
A lovely space to sit down, catch up and enjoy the company of friends new and old alike... the atomsphere is laid back, slightly funky, with a hint of ecclectica. Nice. However, as a foodie, my life is very much centered on "thing you can ingest." 

Athough the eats at fly bar are a step above the average bar food, it's still afterall, bar food... it's sad, but true.
author: Charlie L.

description:
Fly Bar manages to be cool without being pretentious. The bartenders and waitstaff are friendly. Seating can be hard to find when it's busy, but it's actually a pretty good-sized bar, and an employee will more than likely offer to help you find a place to park yourself while you wait.

Sure, it's beer and wine only, but with an extensive list of sake cocktails, and BOMB sangria at incredibly reasonable prices (I think it's $4 per glass...), you won't miss the hard stuff at all.
author: Kristen B.

description:
one of the whitest damn bars i've ever been to, yet strangely blasting gangsta rap. "just what is this place trying to prove?" i wondered, as i looked at the star lights that looked like they were recently purchased from pier 1 imports. 

they didn't have blue moon, i got hef instead. some burly dude nearly kicked down the bathroom door two minutes after i went in. there was practically no one in the bar, so i figure he must've waited politely in his seat in the empty bar until he saw me go in.

also, i saw a girl who looked exactly like philip seymour hoffman. welp
author: Katie M.

description: Love the nachos, quesadilla, and tuna melt.  Wish they had fries, though.  Nice beer selection and pool table, though.
author: Ryan S.

description: It smelled like garbage the whole time we sat at the bar, and after our beers were empty the bartender never asked if we wanted a refill, or even came back near our end of the bar. Too many other great bars to waste time on this one.
author: Laura M.

description:
Ended up at the Fly Bar after trying to go to Nopa tonight but failed. We were too hungry to wait. The menu at Fly Bar is short and simple, some starters, salads, pizzas, and sandwiches. The selection is relatively small but the food was good.

The atmosphere here was not prosaic by any means. However, the lack of light was soporific and it made it hard to read the menu. 

Ordered a shrooms pizza, sandwich, and hummus/ pita starter. All of it was delicious. Pizza was not too oily, and they were generous with the pesto. 

Parking took forever... even for a Tuesday night.
author: Angela T.

description:
I only had the happy hour $5 margarita here, but it was amazing. Maybe it's because I love when margaritas are sour and strong, but it had the perfect sour kick and the salt topped it off. My friends oven-cooked pizzas also looked really tasty too.

The tables were all wobbly which was annoying though, but I'd come back.
author: Chuck N.

description:
I think Toby said it best...

Mm hmm hmm hmm hmm I love this bar! 
(just in case you're unfamiliar http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-Fulz4ytZ54)

Fly Bar rocks my socks off. Delicious food & cocktails, always the right mix of people, friendly servers and SEATING! I love this place.
author: Chrissy L.

description:
This is a good place to stop before going to a show at the Independent; just popped in her recently before the Tricky show. 

Newcastle and Guinness works for me. The hummus plate and nachos are really good. 

I will be back to sample more.

It would be nice if there was more than one bathroom though. {~;
author: Ken L.

description:
Place to be for happy hour, which is everyday from 3-6:30pm.

I went on a Sunday with a group of friends, and I was surprised it wasn't packed. Shoot, who cares, at least we'd get our food and drinks right away. Our server was real cool. She gave us recommendations, and was just plain nice. I hope I get her again. 

Shot out to the waitress @ Fly Bar!

The pizza's amazing. It's all flat crust and real crunchy, just how I like it.
The sangria, beer, and cocktails were amazing. 

Pros: Great menu during happy hour, pool table, tv's to watch from, and cool decor all over, and even on the ceilings. 

Cons: It was a little too dim, and I was sitting on top of ducktape, that covered a huge gap in the booth we were sitting it.

Hit up Fly Bar for GREAT pizza, and good drink specials.
author: Darryl D.

description:
Last review for this place was written almost 2 years ago...and I still love it.  As I get older I want to party less and just find places to have a good drink (or 2-8) with friends without pretense or posing.

This is what I love about Fly Bar.  Sure, there are some hipster-y types that come here.  But the hipsters in this area know to leave their attitude at the door (unlike the Mission ones) and it's a great environment to have a good drink (decent food as well) and good conversation.  

Definitely a contrast to the new Fly Bar on Sutter.  Different neighborhood, VERY different vibe.  I prefer my low key, Western Addition Fly Bar.  Don't ever change.  I love you just the way you are.
author: Melanie N.

description:
After scouring Divisadero on a Friday night with no luck in finding a bar we liked, stepped into Fly bar. First indication it was worth staying: the music! The bartender was playing some decent stuff! (for whatever reason i cannot quite remember, but i know some faint, violent femmes and cure were played....)

Beer selection was good and i think all the beers we ordered were only $4! Guess it's a beer and wine place and i did not try the sangria although it looked amazing!

There were tables to sit and a pool table in back. I liked the vibe, the bartenders and the location. Will definitely come back for sangria and food!!
author: Susanna B.

description:
Okay, let's be serious. Is Fly Bar anyone's favorite bar?

The music was not so good and a bit too loud. The star lights were kinda cool... and the crowd was a mash-up of 30-somethings either groping each other in a booth or getting rowdy at the pool table. The sangria was fairly sweet, there's no hard liquor here, and while this isn't a god-awful mess of an establishment, it definitely isn't highly memorable. 

I went there once on a Thursday night, felt mediocre, and left early. The end.
author: Ashley M.

description:
$3 sangria...$3 sangria that is fabulous...$3 sangria that will help you celebrate the end of a day or bemoan the end of a relationship...$3 sangria makes me a very happy woman!

**(price applies only to happy hour...so go then!)
author: Clara F.

description: This location is pretty chill for the most part. I like to come here to BS with friends. It doesn't get too packed and there aren't many douchey people there. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff. Needs a good cleaning, though.
author: Michael S.

description:
Beer and wine bars are the best.  Chill crowd, cool art and a pool table.  


Always a good place to get the night started or to have a quiet night on the town.
author: Andrew Christian C.

description:
When I'm in the NoPa neighborhood, this is my go-to spot. I love the vibe of this place and always choose to come here before concerts at the Independent. 

The parking in this area isn't the best, but if you're here on a week day (with the exception of Thursday or Friday night), you may be able to find some parking. In my experience, if I get here around 6:00pm or earlier, I can find a spot without any trouble. 

Fly Bar is a fairly small place so don't be surprised if you have to wait for a table during busy hours. Although this is the case, I think the wait is worth it. They have beer and sangria (YUM). I'm not sure about hard alcohol, though. The food is actually really good. I would recommend trying one of their many pizzas. 

They do have one pool table in the back but I always find that people are using it so it's not a good option to come here if you're looking to strictly play pool.

All in all, definitely a place you should check out!
author: Christie R.

description:
I really like the ambiance in here: dark lighting; pretty mosaic art; good music, yet sports on the tv; people dining; people just getting drinks at the bar; people playing pool near the back... I just dig it.

Their pizzas and salads are very highly recommended. Let me warn you that the salads are HUGE - one pizza and one salad is plenty for two (and a cheap meal!)
author: annie b.

description: Great place for many reasons: the 'shroom pie is DELICIOUS, they have a great selection of beer, they have sake bombs "for yer face hole", and the service is absolutely wonderful.  Every time I go there I see there are a lot of locals who stop by, very laid back environment and the servers and bartenders are very attentive. I do, however, have to say Caitlin is amazing. I walk in after work on weekdays and she immediately asks if I want a beer.. or sake bomb. Red chair, great. Sake Bombs... I don't like any other sake bombs unless I have them here. All the servers make great suggestions if I can't decide and I've noticed they really know their regular patrons. Names, dranks, foods... pool table, television and a huge ass mirror. Yes to all of it.
author: Jaden M.

description: My wife and I live on the Central Coast and make it a point to see a concert at least 3 times a year in The City.  We always make time to grab a bite to eat and a drink at happy hour before the show.  Fly is exactly what we love about the city.  Edgy, moody, simple eats and drinks.  The music is always great and the service is just perfect for us.
author: Kevin D.

description:
It's a decadent pleasure indeed to go to the Fly Bar on a weekday afternoon, and enjoy a couple of Hefeweizens and a delicious meat pizza. There's a good, comfortable, friendly vibe, and some English Premiership football on the TV. Close to the ideal afternoon...

And the tab for the afternoon? -- just under $12.00. (Happy hour runs till ~6 PM.) Amazing!
author: donal c.

description: Love this spot. Fantastic happy hour specials, funky chicken pizza and sangria are the best! Friendly environment and staff. Sake bomb's are also amazing!
author: Splifbunny G.

description: Great local bar. Has a divey, welcoming feel to it. The bartenders were super nice and it was packed on a Saturday night. Their drinks are good too - lots of good cocktails to choose from. Sangria was a bit watery though. Oh and their thai chicken pizza salad was SO good!
author: Tiffany S.

description:
I've been to HOW many shows at the Independent, and finally hit up Fly Bar beforehand only last week? What the hell is wrong with me?

No, seriously. This place is great. It's got enough dive in it to provide some character and make for a laid-back vibe, but leaves out any dirty or stinky side effects that usually come with a true dive bar. 

Eats range from snacks to meals (my pizza margherita would be described as "yum"), beer/wine selection is solid, and those sake cocktails look quite enticing. Our waitress was super sweet, friendly, and helpful.

With Fly Bar and Bean Bag in such close proximity, it makes very little sense to buy overpriced drinks in plastic cups at the Indy anymore.
author: Anna G.

description:
My short and sweet review:

Great beers, great art and a very chill atmosphere. This place brings in a great variety of people and the seating is decent. Watch out any day around 9-10pm for crowds. 

Bartenders had great recommendations for various beers (which is all I drank there). 

Watch out for the "cash only" policy. 

THE SCOOP: If you're looking to catch up with a friend, or have more a of a chill evening, Fly Bar is a good place to grab a drink or two.
author: Tom A.

description:
I really like Fly Bar. I don't know how much I like it for an actual bar experience... I've never been here at night. 

It's a couple blocks from my best friend's house so we ended up at Fly Bar for one of the World Cup games... that was interesting. It got pretty crowded but we had prime seating right in front of the only tv in the establishment. I guess it's not really that kind of place... but it worked out!

The other day we went for lunch. It was perfect. I was looking for a sandwich/salad combo and the food there is suprisingly good and not greasy for a bar. I definitely like Fly Bar as a chill place to eat... it's not really a Friday night kind of bar for me though...
author: Abbey S.

description: My good friend and I came in after NOPA told us it would take 45 minutes to get a table (while there were some "reserved" free seats in the dining area. With early wake-up times that wasn't going to work so we took a walk and happened upon this place.) We had drinks and the spinach and artichoke dip. The food was good. The environment was fun. Some guys were playing pool at the far end. We got seated right away. The service was great. This is my type of place. We were in a rush tonight, but I would check this place out again for an unpretentious evening.
author: Jolene S.

description:
Went and had a light dinner with Benjamin L and Denis S last night, so you'll really be able to get a sense this place - yelpers galore!

Ambiance - pretty chill, mostly an after work crowd even until 8ish (a pretty reasonable Happy Hour probably brings this group in). We walked right up to a table at 7:30, it was full but not terribly crowded. 

Food - Very basic stuff - pizza, salads, and sandwiches. Everything was tasty, though nothing was out of this world fantastic. We ordered a BBQ chicken and a Hawaiian pizza (though they both had different names) and a spinach/artichoke appetizer. It was enough for three. 

Drinks - Good beer menu, full bar, and excellent (Americanized) sangria. We split a generously sized pitcher and it was enough for us all. 

Value - We each walked out for under $20 having ordered an appetizer, two pizzas, and a pitcher of sangria. You really can't beat that - and we came after Happy Hour. 

Bottom line - Would return, would recommend to friends.
author: Travis S.

description:
I like Fly Bar.  I don't love it, but I like it.  It's got some nice things about it, and I'll allude to those, but you'll have to dig it out of cynicism.

So, I totally get the fact that it's expensive to get a full liquor license, but you can't call yourself a bar if you can't serve me something over 40 proof. I know some of you will say, "but they've got Soju cocktails" and S*** like that, but that's just wrong.  I lived in Korea, I know what's up with Soju, and Soju cocktails are all wrong.  You drink soju straight-up (one shot!) and growl afterward like a real Korean does.  They do have a nice selection of beers on tap and a happy hour to stay competitive.  Good job.

I live two blocks away and don't own a TV.  So, this is where I go sometimes when I'm in the mood to see the Warriors lose.  But dang, that TV is meant for the bartenders only and I'm gonna have to start using Yelp for chiropractor reviews.  

What's good to eat? Chicken Nachos.

Waitstaff is generally prompt, nice, conversant, and professional. I don't have anything negative to say about them... wow.
author: Alex P.

description: Excellent random discovery.  Trying to eat a light dinner before using groupon for dessert at a nearby but not worth naming spot.   LOVED my pizza which was so yum and my hubby loved his club sandwich !  Happy Hour prices on Sangria were great (3$) and so was the sangria !! YUM !!! Check it out !! Many great deals and great food !!!!
author: Adenna S.

description:
I have been coming to Fly Bar since I moved back to San Francisco in August 2008. This bar/restaurant is one of the friendliest and most accessible bars along Divisadero in the NOPA neighborhood. It's never too crowded and you can almost always get a table. 

The best time to go, however, is during Happy Hour, which operates daily from 3:30-6:30 pm. Pizzas are offered at half price. I always get the Carmel Blue pizza, a perfect blend of Gorgonzola and Mozzarella cheese with caramelized onions on a light garlic and olive oil sauce.  I'm salivating as I think about it... For an extra bonus, I add prosciutto for an extra $1.... heaven. 

I also highly recommend the la tortilla salad and the chicken & goat cheese quesadilla. Really though, I have never ordered anything from the menu that I didn't love.

The atmosphere at Fly Bar is extremely relaxing. The bar acts as a gallery for local artists and it always switching up the artwork and installations hanging on the walls. I have yet to buy a piece, but I have my eye on a piece from the current installation of wax and watercolor art. Fabulous. There is also a pool table in the back of the bar, and people are always willing to team up or start a tournament. 

I only have one problem with the bar, but it's a big enough problem to take one star down from the rating: there is no hard alcohol. Fly Bar only serves Beer (both draft and bottled), sake, and soku (a very sweet Japanese vodka) drinks. So, if you are looking for a vodka tonic or a jack and coke, this bar isn't for you.
author: Mallory P.

description:
4 stars for happy hour, 3 for not.

Be sure to get here before 6:30 for awesome deals. ANY day of the week. Nice! $3 glasses of sangria. Not necessarily the tastiest I've ever had (this may be biased after spending a long weekend in Barcelona), but still pretty solid. Not syrupy sweet, although I wouldn't mind even a bit less sugar. This is a massive glass though, especially considering the price. 

Service is great - friendly but not over the top - but not always super fast. I kinda like taking my time though. Chill vibe which is always appreciated.

Carmel blue pizza for $4.50 (half off during happy hour) is tasty. I probably wouldn't get it at the normal $9, but it's always nice to have cheap noshing options. The caramelized onions were delish, and I'm always a sucker for gorgonzola. A tad on the greasy side, but what do you expect from a white sauce pizza.
author: Monica C.

description:
Great place to hang out.  Its beer and wine with good music that is at pretty much the perfect volume (loud enough to hear, but quiet enough to hear your friends' conversation).  The place is hip with out being snoodie or so hip you feel that you should have biked there on your fixed speed while wearing your skinny jeans and retro 80s t-shirt.

Its in a good location, not too far from little star pizza and not to far from the independent; making it an ideal place for post food hanging out or pre-show drinks.
author: Stephen C.

description:
Fantastic happy hour prices. Try their pizza (actual food vs. bar food!). Sangria is just okay, but again happy hour prices!  They don't have liquor, just beer, sangria and soju cocktails.  I kinda like the soju cocktails myself.  

The service is good, there's a pool table, a TV for sports watchers (kept on mute....I think that's smart in a non-sports bar), and if you're lucky you'll catch a David Byrne/Davie Bowie look alike at the bar.  Just watch him sit alone and oogle at all the ladies.  He's there almost every time I'm there, so there's a good chance you'll see him!  

The place could use a deep clean, and I don't love the shared bathroom.  (It's just not fair to have ladies sitting on a seat that some dude just....well, you know.)
author: Mara C.

description:
FlyBar is the place to catch happy hour for sure, but get there early because seats go fast. Another great Divisadero spot with $3 drafts, sangria and sake, but this place it top notch. Drinks are great, food is great, and the staff is super friendly.

We went on a Wednesday night just before happy hour was over and ordered nachos and beer. We arrived to a full house and luckily got 2 of the last seats at the bar because a couple people had just left. Staff was super attentive and made sure we had menus and drinks asap. Served with smiles all around and several people checked in to make sure we were doing ok. A+ guys!

Our nachos seemed to take longer than normal at most places, and the chicken was buried at the bottom of the plate. At first we thought we got the wrong order because we could even see any chicken on the plate. They were tasty for sure, but I'm a fan of nachos with all the fixings mixed up so I can have some on every chip!

We had several beers on tap and were lucky enough to catch the Poppy Jasper Amber Ale, a local favorite! We also partook in the sangria - thanks Kristina - and it was excellent!

If you're on Divisadero, definitely stop by FlyBar and have a drink, it will be a memorable experience for sure.
author: Darren M.

description: Nice local NoPa bar. Some good beer selection, decent tunes.  On this particular night the TVs had Ghostbusters.  However, the sangria is suspect, tasted more like grape kool aid.  Cost wise, 2 drafts of beer + sangria cost $13, cheap!
author: John M.

description:
Nothing fancy just great simple food. pizza, salad and OMG Great Nachos and Sangria. This is usually the p[lace we go before a concert. You can drink and eat for cheap. The sake drinks are kind of interesting. I like the 5.0.
Cool pool table in the back.
author: Thierry H.

description:
Going to err on the side of favor here. This is really a 3 1/2 star place. 

Bar hopping before a show at the independent and this place was our last stop. Pretty crowded even at 7:30 on a Friday but I think it was mostly people waiting for tables to eat. Didn't seem to have a system for the tables though as a near argument broke out over the next available seats. 

Pretty dull place over all but the staff were super nice and awesome and they have a pretty good selection of beer on tap despite the "Vis" (see prior reviews for explanation) being a mostly cocktail based area of SF. Great bottle cap artwork on the walls too!

Going to try and go back with the hope that maybe it was just a bad Friday in the area because of the economy or market plunge or something?
author: Tony C.

description:
Fly Bar had an excellent drink menu ranging from soju and sake cocktails to beer and wine. I was quite indecisive, but chose the sake and pear martini in the end. It was sweet and yummy!

For food, we ordered the Funky (BBQ) Chicken Pizza, artichoke dip, and chicken skewers. Everything tasted gourmet and was perfect to share. 

Thanks to my friends Vy and Sean for treating me!
author: Cynthia L.

description: Fly Bar is a neighborhood eatery. Their sandwiches aren't bad. Their salads are simple. Their beer and wine selection is plain, but fairly local. It's all rather reasonably priced. They get pretty busy, which usually turns me off, but since I can walk down the street to them, I hit them up at off hours and grab a beer and a round of pool and am quite content.
author: Shannon F.

description:
This isn't a neighborhood I visit very often; it's not walking distance from my house, so I get nervous, but after spending all day walking around the park and the Academy of Science, a friend and I decided to grab a pizza and a beer.

Shiner Bock and Lone Star what a great sight for a girl who started her drinking days in Texas. Ordered a Shiner and a Shroom Pie (portabello, pesto, and jack cheese). He ordered a Mmmm Meat, you guys can figure that one out. They were done super fast and just the right size. We were both satisfied, and there was one slice to spare. I didn't check the prices of the pizzas or the beers but our tab combined was only $18, pretty awesome.

Liked the crowd, mostly regulars, a few ppl on their way to work or just having an afternoon snack.
author: melissa c.

description: I love this arty little bar.  Their big salads are delicous and have a good selection of beers on tap.
author: Jenn D.

description: Love love love this place. Happy the Divis location is close enough to home. Sangria is awesome, and I really enjoy the hip yet laid back atmosphere. Such a fan.
author: Bridget B.

description:
This is an OK place. The staff deserves 5 stars for sure, but it is a little over priced I thought. We had the bleu cheese pizza (which I wasn't that keen on but my girlfriend LOVED) and the chicken skewers (which I thought were well seasoned but dry). 

Lots of great beer on tap.
author: Jay C.

description:
UPDATE: Service is good. Food is good. Beer is good. But still no liquor but I'm still bumping you up four stars. 

....chicken and goat cheese quesadillas are yummy!! Hummus plate is also plentiful and yummy. Pizza happy hour is also a great deal. This place is more a restaurant to me than a bar so I primarily come here for food.
author: David C.

description: Cool decor, interesting menu options, but my group made the wrong choice to come here for lunch after being told there was an hour long wait at Nopa. I got the Southwestern (?) pizza, since it sounded like a Chipotle burrito bowl on a pizza, and it was just okay. Maybe I don't like this flavor combo as much as I thought...Cheap though!
author: Melody L.

description:
Cool bar with a great happy hour! $3 beers and $4.50 for tasty 9-inch pizzas made me a happy camper while waiting for friends to meet me for the evening's festivities; I almost didn't want to leave. A coin-op pool table fills the stage-like area at the back, though I suspect they could move it for an occasional band or DJ set-up. The dark decor matched the medieval-ish artwork, creating a cool atmosphere - it'd be a neat place for a date.

Note: On this Friday night, nearly all the seating was filled by 5:30pm, so plan accordingly.
author: Bill B.

description:
Average gastropub.

They have a good selection of microbrews both on tap and in bottles.

The menu's pizza-heavy, with some sandwiches and salads thrown in. The food isn't bad, but nothing really notable, either.
author: Patrick Z.

description:
There's something authentic about Fly Bar. Maybe it's the laid back atmosphere that let's you choose the bar-counter, a table to munch at, or sporadic small round tables for drinking and chatting with friends. It could also be the wacky decor starting with the seemingly restaurant like entrance to the lounge like back (complete with an elevated pool table). 

I truly think San Francisco has mastered the art of the "restaurant-bar" scene. Everywhere in the city there are places you can pop in for tapas style snacks, a full dinner, or a well mixed cocktail. The major plus in SF is you don't have to worry about grody bar food like fries and burgers, you can get great food and great drinks all in one place. 

Fly bar was loud, the crowd was friendly and the Sangria ($20/large pitcher) was good! When I'm"m in a more laid back mood you may find  me at Fly Bar a litter more often (with Sangria in hand).
author: Theresa T.

description:
Right, I need to bring it back up to at least one more star because no matter how useless I may think the new girl is, Russ & Beth still work here and they are the best. Seriously, the best. The other girls are great too, don't get me wrong. I even have hope for the new girl. But I have a special place in my heart (and my wallet) for servers who recognize me and my order. That is solid service. And it should be recognized.

Also the art changed recently and now it is this faux 13th century stuff. And it's really awesome. If I had gads of money to spend on one, I would totally do it.
author: Alexis B.

description: This bar is fly. I especially like how diverse, for one reason or another, the people are that frequent Fly Bar. It is the perfect size bar too...not too big not too small. Check out the paintings on the wall too!When you want to take friends to a bar and you can't decide on a place that will make everyone happy, go to Fly Bar.
author: Craig B.

description:
Dr. X and I have something in common - We both want me to be happy.  

In order for me to be happy, I need you to not hit my face or call me stupid.  I also need regular mini-vacations, which (since my people aren't snow people) unfortunately require wearing a bikini in public.  Normal people can put on a swimsuit and laugh about it all the way to the wave pool, but since my personality sucks, I need the body of a Victoria's Secret Model to feel comfortable poolside.  

The way I see it, there are only two things stopping me from looking like a VSM:  
1) 35 pounds of fat on my ass
2) genetics.

Even with a family history of heart disease and using pliers to zip your pants, I've been watching what I eat and exercising, which is slllooowwwlly helping me slim down to the trophy hottie that the Boy deserves.

We were looking for some appetizers to split for dinner that weren't too fried and wouldn't stick on my butt like the hand of a guy eager to escape his stale marriage.  Already in the neighborhood, I suggested we pop in here and give their chow a shot.  Not bad, Fly Bar.

We split the quesadilla and some goat cheese/bread.  Both dishes were very tasty.  As planned, I nibbled like a supermodel, but decided not to purge afterwards because I don't do that anymore.

I recommend Fly Bar for a quiet place to enjoy the company of your sweetheart and share some tasty morsels in a cozy setting.  Our server was pleasant, and our experience was a solid 3 Stars.

I think I'm already looking like one of the V.Secret Angels - okay, Heidi Klum when she was 8 months pregnant, but we're getting closer here.
author: Janney B.

description:
