I've stumbled in here a couple times and for some reason I like it.   Maybe it's just the bathroom with the cool mural and broken glass ceiling that I like.   

No liquor, but I'm never disappointed with beer, wine, or sake...Soju can suck it.
author: Scott W.

description:
Fly bar is another local hangout that I can be found in at least once a week. If good draft beer, easy going patrons and a friendly staff aren't enough to draw you in, try the half price pizzas from 3:30-6:30 daily. 

Their was a year of my life where I pretty much lived on the Book 'em Dano and North Coast Brewery's excellent Blue Star wheat beer. Alas, I am not nearly as broke and Blue Star is no longer on draft. Even if you are not hungry the Fly is a fun place for a relatively mellow weekend night. What I like about the place is that I know I will never get in too much trouble because they don't serve whiskey. Fly is a good place to watch a game, get some good grub and put back some pints (er, rather 19oz. glasses).
author: Evan O.

description:
This place is way too expensive for what they serve. The pizzas are mediocre quality but the prices are high.

The drinks are pricey as well. I think they do a pretty good happy hour here, but I've never been around the location during that time.

The soju cocktails are WEAK. I had four over the course of 3 hours and didn't feel a buzz. Unless you'd describe "buzz" as feeling like you could use an insulin shot for the diabetic coma you'll slip into after drinking a koolaid cocktail with a splash of sugar.

If you like beer and live in the western addition, this is an option for you.
author: Montgomery L.

description:
I used to live in the western addition and found this a nice local spot. Sometimes there are floozies, sometimes not. Never went there looking for girls... just went there for what it was: a laid back place... good music (tribe called quest... all day), "neat" art. 

So I live in North Beach now and went back there for a friend's birthday. I go to buy him and a few friends a drink. As I am preparing to pay (I am a very nervous person) I start crinkling my 20 dollar bill. 

The bartender looks at my 20 behind a light, calls his manager over and they both accuse my 20 of being a counterfeit. They hold up my 20 against the other 9 20s I have in my pocket and show me how mine doesn't have a watermark... but unfortunately it does. They realize they are complete morons but continue with the charade.

We're not going to give you your bill back. We're gonna call the cops. "FUCK YOU GUYS, I'M gonna call the cops" I bark back. "How stupid are you retard? And look at your dumbass manager! how drunk are you buddy?!"

These girls next to me convince me that it's not worth my time, I pay with another 20. Leave no tip. Use my "counterfeit" 20 dollar bill later and no one says shit.

Very unprofessional. Very insulting. I've never been dealt with like that. 

Unfortunately I didn't finish my rant about being from malibu, my $2k bracelet, or the remainder of the cash in my wallet. it wasn't worth it... but then again, who doesn't counterfeit 20s when they're wearing more than either the bartender or manager are going to pull in that month?

Pathetic and Petty. The place is nice. Those 2 should be fired.
author: Sam D.

description: Consistently yummy food.  Love the Fruit to Nuts & Nick's Salad.  All the pizzas are great too - love the Jimmy the Greek.  Cheap & good.
author: Mac M.

description:
Underrated. 

Small, yet superb selection of beer, goblets of delicious sangria,  satisfying pizzas, substantial salads, with a good, nicely lit relaxed atmosphere to top it all off. 

The place for a chill night for a small price. 

However, don't be ambushed by  those sake-tini cups of crap, they are trap. 

Yet, you got to appreciate Fly bar, it's just simply underrated.
author: Daniella B.

description:
Usually I start a review with after a big bike ride blah, blah...well this time it was climbing. I've never been climbing before and it's awesome! But that's another review. 

So I went climbing at Planet Granite in Belmont, then out for a bite and a beer with a friend. I looked at my watch and thought, if I leave now I can make it home in time to pop into a new bar in the 'hood. Finished the beer, said my good byes and rolled hard.

1am....unload the car, pop out the door and down the street to the Fly Bar. I'm a regular at the Page, but like I said, I was feeling adventurous, plus I wanted a new place to Yelp about.

Fly Bar is a cool spot. It was pretty low key when I rolled in. I kinda expected it to be a bit more lively on a Thursday. Any who, I like the look of the place, the bartender was way down to earth and I felt totally relaxed in there. 

No hard booze, but a good selection of beer and Sake. I had a local SF beer, Speakeasy Prohibition Ale, which is actually my new default beer. I've never been into the soju cocktail thing, but then again I've never tried them much. So since it's local I may give it a whirl. I also noticed they have sangria...which I'm a total sucker for even though it's sweet....my excuse, it's the Latin blood. Sangria calls to me. 

I'll be back, maybe I'll pop in there tonite as it's close and I'm gotta turn in early for a.....you guessed it...a big bike ride. Damn it, I thought i was gonna do one review without talking about a bike ride....oh well everybody's got their vices ;-)
author: isaias J.

description: I came here for happy hour with my buddy Nic yesterday.  It's a chill spot! I've been wanting to try it after passing by lots of times and seeing the good reviews. I liked the lighting and art, very mellow with some Lil' Wayne bumping in the background. We started off with $3 sangrias and ordered the Mmm...Meat pizza ($5.95). Be sure to order a pizza asap because it takes about 20-30 minutes to come out since the guy is making it from scratch. We had sake with pear juice (yum!) next then the Poppy Jasper Amber Ale (tasted like Anchor Steam!). I will be back again for happy hour!
author: Kaila Y.

description:
Four words: Six hour happy hour. 

From Noon to 6, you can get any 10" pizza half off and a $3 beer. I went in for lunch and spent seven bucks and came out full. Doesn't happen often in this city. They have a great menu and a greater selection of beer (Speakeasy on tap) and if you're in the NoPa area looking for a good lunch under ten bucks, heck, under eight bucks, then this is the spot.
author: Casimir F.

description:
For some reason, I always end up here with company of the male persuasion.  Sometimes that company is good, sometimes, well, not so much.   What does that have to do with the bar itself?  Nothing.  I just wanted to have a little sharing moment.

Fly's salads & pizzas make me happy, mostly because of the copious amounts of meat and cheese in both.  I 'specially like sharing a pitcher of sangria at a window seat on a nice day and watching the masses walk by on Divisadero.  There are good beers on tap, and a pool table in the back - really, all the ingredients of a go-to neighborhood bar.
author: Jess T.

description:
Happy Hour Review, peeps

Half Priced pizzas, $1 off draught, nice beer selection, friendly service, tasty sangria.
author: Max A.

description:
Great happy hour: cheap and tasty sangria (among others), and the pizzas are half off. Basically, a great place for my gal pal and I to chow down and get tanked for less than $30 after work. Sold.

PS- have you had the nachos? delicious!
author: Victoria A.

description:
I can now add Fly Bar to the long list of my neighborhood spots which have so much potential but just fall short. I walked into Fly at 2:30 today for a pre-Superbowl beer and a pizza. There were roughly 20 people in the establishment and not a single person was talking. I'm not joking - I thought I walked into a library. At least 4 people were reading books. I almost walked out on principle. 

Aside from the pizzas, I really don't like anything about this place. The strange, ubiquitous chubby children artwork creeps me out. The black ceiling and deep purple walls with long velvet curtains make me feel as if I'm trapped in some bizarre Goth dungeon. I want to be happy when I eat and socialize. I'd rather not dine in places where the interior designer cultivated the 'slit your wrists' aura. 

That said, the pizzas really are remarkable (minus The Southwestern - bland and no avocado, what a joke). The Pesto pizza is unreal. The Blue Caramel rocks as well. The half price pizza happy hour special (which exists on the weekend as well) is stellar. Yes, I just said 'stellar.' Deal with it.
author: Tom C.

description:
Where do I begin?

The food: 
The salads and nachos here are awesome, but I usually get the Cheese, Cheese, Cheese pizza and add pepperoni. Come during happy hour and it is only $5. Dare I say that though it is a totally different style of pizza, it is just about as good as Nizario's. Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm!

Drinks: 
Good beers on tap and I like that they only serve sake, a good change of pace.

The people:
Everyone is chill. Mixed crowd. Not really a college scene. A good place to go with a small group of friends. Not too big cause tables can be hard to get. 

The service:
I have had everything from awesome to ok. Even when things are just ok, I can't complain. It's usually cause they are busy, and hey, just cause everyone wants another beer or some good food, you can't get mad at the waitress (look at me making excuses for mediocre service when I am usually the first to get mad).
author: Lee M.

description:
I like this place! It serves a distinct purpose and it's cool with that.

Chill bar with beer & wine (I'm over the soju "alcohol") and great prices. The food looked and smelled good but we didn't get to it. Next time!
author: Shal J.

description:
Love this place!

I would give it a five except that there have been a few times, at night, when I have gone here and it has been too crowded to move and I've had to leave. I like this place the most for happy hour.

During happy hour they have pizzas for 50% off, making them about $5 each. These aren't crappy pizzas either. They are gourmet pizzas with things like goat cheese and pesto.

If you want a mellow experience, some beer, and some cheap, awesome pizza then I definitely recommend hitting up Fly Bar.
author: Jackie G.

description: I've never felt so cultured sitting at a bar. Adorned with local art and star-shaped lanterns, with indie-ish rock buzzing in the background, Fly Bar is the perfect spot to hit for drinks and finger food before heading to a show at the Independent. Their brioche with baked brie is warm and comforting, and they offer a myriad of imported beers and fruity sake cocktails to suit any mood. Plus, their bartenders are super gregarious.
author: Jen L.

description: Great neighborhood location, and would I would give it 4 stars if they had a full bar...but I still love Fly Bar.  The staff is uber friendly and you can chill at the bar or you can play pool in the back.  They also serve food pretty late.  I've only had the nachos but would be down to try other stuff...in regards to the nachos, they were tasty and a very large portion that could easily feed 4-5 people.
author: Jessica B.

description:
This is THE haunt for girl's night.  Its a cozy little bar on Van Ness that has great beer, wine and sake mixed drinks.  Their salads are varied and delicious and its a great place to gab with the girls.

I would give five stars for food and drink alone but saving one.  The only con is that some of the waitresses take their sweet time and service lags because of it.  Not a problem if you stay awhile like we do but can be annoying.
author: Cat A.

description: Another reason to love Divisadero.  Came here during the Divis Art Walk and they had $3 sangria all night.  Pretty strong stuff, and they give you a huge glass.  The place is sweet, pool table in the back, comfy booths, dim lighting.  I'm definitely coming back for happy hour... 1/2-off pizzas then!
author: William S.

description: I love fly bar! The atmosphere is laid back and the staff is friendly. The food is also pretty good. I occasionally get a little sad that I can't ever get a cocktail but their beer and wine selection is good at least! :)
author: Kris M.

description:
Happy hour offers a great deal! It's like getting pizza at a nice place (think Dopo or Pizzaiolo) at the the cost of a take out (think Fat Slice or Blondie). I recommend the Blanco pizza if you like artichoke, peppers and garlic. 

Don't know if it was out of the norm, but the night we went, there were definitely more men than women. It was like Alaska.
author: Mary R.

description: I always have such good experiences at Fly Bar. It's comfy and relaxed and not at all pretentious. The lighting is low, the food is fresh (love the Mediterranean salad & the tuna sandwiches & the nachos), the sangria goes down smooth and they frequently play Beck. Beck makes me wiggle.
author: Ania W.

description:
Sake, Pizza, Great Atmosphere. It's all here at Fly Bar.

This place is great for a first date (grab one of the two tops in the corner by the window early, when there are no sports on), hanging out with friends, or even stopping in for a quick drink by yourself. The bar tenders have always been nice, and pretty attentive to the crowd. You may have to wait in line for the bathroom though, so beware if you have a small bladder! Other than that, this is a great bar to check out.

PS: No Liquor.
author: James E.

description:
It took me 5 years to overcome my initial feelings of this place and adopt it as the cozy, friendly, neighborhood haunt it is. This is one of the places I can 'roll on in' to, pretty much always get a table, be treated with respect, and generally enjoy myself ( i.e., talk to the person I'm with).

 It would be a much different story if there were a full bar. That said, this is a good place to grab some cheap eats and a pint at the start of an evening.
author: Jabe N.

description:
My favorite reason to come here is to have some beers and a little food before seeing a show at The Independent, which is just down the street.

The place has a cool vibe and is a great place to have a couple happy hour beers with your friends.
If it gets a little too crowded I'm out of there!  It's too noisy and cramped.  I enjoy this place for the occasional pre-show libation and snack, but not a staple in my bar repertoire.
The pizzas are good and the beer is cold!
Enjoy!~
author: Matt P.

description: Chill bar with a nice bartender and lots of food options
author: Christopher R.

description:
As far as my one happy hour experience goes, this place was pretty awesome.

Perks of happy hour include, a great selection of cheap draughts (19oz),  fairly quick/reliable service even when the place is packed, 6 HOURS LONG! (12:30 - 6:30), 4 dollars-ish pizzas that were incredible, pretty good music, and plenty of seating.

A lot of times when you order a pizza with pesto, it's overdone and too oily.  I ordered the Greek pizza (artichokes, red onions, olives, and feta), and the pesto was perfect.  Where else can you great pizza and a beer for under 8 dollars.?  

Based on happy hour experience I would give it five stars...HOWEVER...no liquor.  Only beer, wine, and soju cocktails.  But with their large selection, you'll hardly notice.
author: Joe E.

description:
Happy hour here is excellent.  Before 6.30pm the pizzas are half price, so they are all about $4-$4.50.  They are "individual" size but they are enough for one hungry person (me). 

Having spent a few nights here I remain confused by the music selection.  Seemed to be entirely filled with the type of hipsters who only listen to indie bands that are so under the radar, they don't even exist yet - but they were playing Snoop, Tribe Called Quest, Mos Def and other 90s rap.  

Anyway they have a good beer selection too - try the Poppy Jasper Amber Ale, and the Soju cocktails were excellent as well.  A solid 4* bar.
author: George S.

description:
I have been going to fly bar for years. they don't even serve alcohol - just sake drinks, beer., and sangria.  however, that doesn't keep it's devoted patrons away, and they ARE devoted. you will find a bunch of the same folks sitting at the bar year in and year out.  And the great part about Fly, unlike Madrone down the street, is that it doesn't get the Marina infiltration. At least not most nights.

dark little intimate bar, full of hipsters, pretty loud on thursdays and fridays, but in a good, energizing way. there's always good people watching, a pool table in the back, great food - and if you get there for happy hour, the pizzas are half off.  

especially cool is that some of daniel price's art still hangs on the walls.  sad that it's not all still there, but nice that a couple of key portraits remain. the murals in fly and solstice are his as well.
author: k. w.

description: This is your classic neighborhood bar. Great drinks fun people and amazing music on at night. They do serve food but don't have liquor license so drinks are with Sake!
author: Subhash J.

description:
I love Fly Bar - great food, amazing salads, cool music, funky hipster vibe, and cheap drinks!  Also for a local bar, their selection of both bottled & draught beers is awesome.

Only a few things I would change to make this place a perfect 5:
1) Serve food later (c'mon, kitchen closes at 10pm when neighboring restaurant are all open till 1am?!)
2) Extend the happy hour past 6:30 so I can partake!
3) add some hard-A to the menu. I ain't down with that Soju non-sense.

Other than that, I looove me some BarFly on a weeknight when I have nothing better to do and don't want to spend too much $$.
author: Ashley W.

description: I love this place and maybe it's because it's so close to my house and/or because their happy hour is amazing! I love their sangria and for happy hour it's just $3.00! Even outside of happy hour this is a great place to come with friends-share a pitcher of sangria, try one of their great soju cocktails, stare at their awesome lighting, play some pool and maybe even ordr some appetizers as well.
author: Natalie M.

description:
We were also defectors from Little Star's not-so-little-list.  I wonder how much of their business this place gets...

I liked the high draped ceilings here, though the uber 80s mix tape played overhead was a little loud at first.  The front door seemed to say "keep me open" to people as they left, brrr.  It was not full, not empty, though as we ate it definitely filled up.

Good beer list, good beer prices.  Food is definitely what I would call cafe, lots of salads, sandwiches, and pizzas.  Sadly, I did not see fries on the menu, everything came with greens.  Way to make people be healthy!  But, it would have been a nice option, as they go so much better with beer.

However, they did save us from a rainy and hungry Sunday night.
author: Aimee B.

description:
I stopped by here yesterday on my way home from getting my foot cast...Needless to say, not in the best of moods....My foot hurt, I was pissed off because cute shoe season JUST started AND I needed something in my stomach so I could take a pain pill....Not to mention a drink!
Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! for being there in my time of need! I had a enormous salad with walnuts, apples, and chicken...YUM! and a great big glass of sangria...Ok...TWO great big glasses of sangria...Ahhhh....Also the bartender was sweet as pie and helped sooth my cranky mood....I left there feeling like a new girl and went shoe shopping....After all, I still have one good foot!
author: Lara D.

description:
I really like Fly Ba nowr.I haven't been there on a weekend for a bit since I moved out of the neighborhood, but the other weekend my bffffffff Erin and I went there for brunch on Easter.

I had this goat cheese and something else chicken quesa that went off in my mouth something proper...and a mimosa. Fantabulousness . The staff were funny .I was happy to be there to celebrate Jesus' resurrection although what do I know about that shit since I'm a jew
author: Lauren V.

description:
I went to Fly Bar for the first time last night on the recommendation of a co-worker.  It was a very pleasant experience.  Nice decor, good beers and excellent food.  Not so loud that I couldn't catch up with my friend who had just flown in from New York.

Minus one star because our waitress was completely overwhelmed and thus not very attentive.  Not that it's necessarily her fault, but it did cause some confusion.
author: Casey S.

description:
Great bar if you live in the neighborhood.  Never too crowded and the place is nice enough.  Dark, moderately swank, and only locals.

Drawbacks are there is only one restroom and beer is a little over priced for a dive bar.  No hard liquor but interesting sake mixed drinks which are pretty cheap.  Go here with friends and do not expect to pick up on anyone.
author: Ryder M.

description:
To those of you that know my history in this place, you might be surprised that I am giving it any stars at all. To fill the rest of you in, I have been kicked out of here way too  many times. This being the last stop on the way home after drunken days and nights out, I always end up here at my best...or to be precise...at my very very very very worst. I have lived in the area for 7 years so I have had a significant time span to make a fool of myself multiple times here. I haven't dared go back after the last incident a year ago. Maybe it's time again?

I constantly clown this place because of my history with it but it is unjustified in every way. They have great food at great prices and great cocktails and a great beer selection. It is a great happy hour spot. If I'm not mistaken the pizza (which are really good) are only $6 during happy hour. A total steal! The people are a mixed bag. You will see some true locals, some transplanted locals and a small but steady stream of Lower Pac Heights folks come on in. 

The seating doesn't really lend itself towards group mingling and the seats are kind uncomfortable. It is however a great place to come with one or two friends to get some drinks. It's a good starting point to the evening but not a destination spot.

Come here.  You might find me here but most likely not. I am just building up the cojones to get back in there. A year break is legitimate right?
author: Steve H.

description:
After watching my school lose the football national championship at Zeke's, my friends ushered me to Fly Bar to lift my mood. Walking into dark Fly Bar, I stepped back to let my friends head to the bar first. Unbeknown to me, the entrance has a slight ramp with a small ledge on the sides. As I stepped back, I ended up tripping over the ledge, flying through the air and landing square on some unlucky guy's table, hurtling his beer through the air. The glass broke into a million pieces and I felt everyone's eyes on me sprawled over the table in my Ohio State sweatshirt.

I literally could hear the crickets. 

Props to this bar for not kicking me out after wreaking havoc on their establishment. I ended up grabbing a cold beer and mourning my team by the window with my friends. The atmosphere of this place is great and I'll definitely return- hopefully this time without the embarrassing spill.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Redux:

Ok, so I'm a softy...  Server Number 88 was gracious enough to reply to my rant and apologized. No worries and we appreciate the apology. Everybody deserves a second chance. 

Thanks number 88. 

--------

Dear Bar Fly Server Number 88,

I know I don't wear skinny jeans, rock an ironic tee-shirt, wear a stripped hoodie, carry a messenger bag or ride a messenger bike, but that surely doesn't mean I/we should get bad service and stink-eye. Or does it? 

I really enjoy the food and drink at the Fly Bar, it's one of my favorite places in the city to roll. But my recent trip, with friends, was truly a great big disappointment because of your horrible food serving skills and "I'm too hip to be working at a bar/restaurant" attitude. Had it it not been for the tasty pizza, the fresh tasting salad, the great selection of beers and sangria I would have left only two-stars. 

Sincerely, 
Bummed Me
author: Chris G.

description:
So i was on a quest to grab some drinks at a place i had never been to before.  Fly was the answer.  I absolutely love the decor.  It had these lit up stars hanging up from the ceiling by the pool table, and the music that was played was a mix of hip hop and maybe some kind of loungy jazzesque stuff.  The bartender was really friendly. 

The bonus was that it was happy hour.  They do 1/2 price pizzas and discount beers and sake cocktails.  So after 3 pizzas, a couple beers for a friend and me, the total was $28.  What a deal.  

Another bonus was that this place isnt a fidi type of bar with people in power suits.   Come as you are.
author: Terence P.

description: Just came here with a couple of my favorite girls for the first time last night.  We got here literally just in time for happy hour (6:25PM, it ends at 6:30) and we each ordered 1 Sake cocktail and 1pizza: Margherita, Shroom Pie and Funky Chicken pizzas with Nigori Punch, Sakerita and a Sake Suckle.  The drinks were yummay and the pizza was good too! Everything arrived in a pretty timely manner.  Our server was friendly and the bar was cute with random pieces of art all over the walls.  They also got a pool table in the back, but we didn't have time for a game.  Street parking only of course since it's in the city, but we lucked out and swooped a spot right when we pulled up in front of the place.  We all enjoyed our visit to Fly Bar and will probably come back soon!
author: Dijonne M.

description:
1 point off - because the lack of hard alcohol is a bummer, and soju tastes like weak lighter fluid.  Still, my old neighborhood bar remains a favorite of mine.

Still, the atmosphere is usually cool, the crowd pretty diverse, and the beers on tap good.  If you show up before the kitchen closes, the food is pretty decent as well.
author: Adam B.

description:
Any place where I can walk in by myself, get a drink, get in on playing pool (and win) is a good time in my book.

So, I guess this rating is based on the friendliness of the crowd.  I like bars where you can feel comfortable grabbing a quick cocktail by yourself.
author: soy y.

description: So this was the only bar on Divisidero that had an open table on Saturday night, so we were going to drink there even if it sucked, but it was actually fun. They have tasty beers and mixed drinks, and the art on the wall is funky cool. They stop serving food early... like 10? The only really annoying part was not being able to start a tab, and having to pay for every drink individually. I guess it was worth it though because we had to leave very suddenly (don't ask!)
author: Marisa F.

description: Nice stuff. Good and cheap food and drinks. Fast service.
author: Iaroslav K.

description: Good bar for Soju cocktails.  Cool people.  A good place to get drunk.  Good beer selection.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
We came just in time for happy hour and ordered 3 pizzas and several drinks.  The sake cocktails aren't bad, but to be honest I like my hard liquor cocktails better.  The waitress was really nice, and even though the place was packed she was still quite attentive.  I was amazed that she even managed to keep our bill straight considering several people in our party came and went.  Our bill was actually just that our bill not random people's drinks.  

I'd definitely come back for happy hour.  I feel like the pizzas at full prize are just a little pricey; they're not that big.  Plus with Little Star up the street it's hard to chose here over there for pizza.
author: Joann C.

description: I am going to keep this short and sweet. I went here after going to Candy bar for a few drinks. Since Candy bar didn't have any real food besides desserts we wandered to Fly bar. We walked in to a decent crowded place and found a seat. We ordered 3 beers and their awesome plate of nachos. The nachos had a giant pile of chips and a good heaping of guacamole, sour cream, and salsa. The total for 3 good beers and nachos. $19!!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Low key easy place to meet up with friends.  Food is good and the beer is cold. The pizzas in particular are pretty amazing.

The fact that there is a single bathroom sometimes is a drag.  

Happy hour is awesome...$3 beers, half price pizzas.  I'll think I'll head there now, as a matter of fact...
author: Todd S.

description:
For a neighborhood bar, the nachos were damn good.  So was the IPA microbrew.  So good, I got another one.  The music is pretty good too, a hallmark of an excellent hangout.

The place has a nice, chill vibe, and the crowd seemed cool.
author: Arthur L.

description:
For me, Fly bar has always been a place I can reliably go to and have fun. Living just around the corner especially helps. :)  
The beer selection is pretty decent, but there is not too much selection for mixed drinks. The sangria is KILLER. I reccomend it for large groups--it will knock you out and remind you the next morning. 
The vibe varies, but if you're there on a weekend, it's going to be crowded with many young and old just hanging out having a good time. They have changing art work which I think is pretty rad.
I recently tried the food there, and I'd have to say it is up there for 'bar food' The pizzas are great, and if you just want something light, get the hummous plate. 

All in all, a guaranteed good place for standard bar.
author: Ruchita P.

description: The atmosphere is pretty cool there with a diverse crowd.  Its not a place to watch the game with one tv in a corner.  I like all the artwork and the prices are decent.  The only reason its not four stars is that there is only one bathroom and the line can get long.
author: Jason D.

description: An awesome feel at home neighborhood bar and lounge. Great vibe and good appetizers as well.
author: Dishar R.

description: Fly Bar is great. Cheap beer and food. Almost all the food was under $10, and tasted amazing! The wait staff was quick and friendly. Definitely going back.
author: Steph M.

description:
UPDATE 10.03.05: You know what? This is a pretty fly bar. The service is super friendly (they let us get some of their fantastic specialty pizza just as the kitchen was closing) and the atmosphere is super chill. And was it just this past weekend, or were there some good looking folks in here? And let us not forget how good their sangria is. My only complaint still is that it's a little small, but hey, what isn't in SF, right?

I want this to be a really, well, fly bar... But I've only been there once and haven't had the urge to go back. It seems like a cool place, albeit small and hard to find a seat. The decor is cool and the beer was cold and cheap, just nothing to really draw me back there. Strange.
author: Michael E.

description: OOOkay.  So it's 5pm, you're hungry and thirsty and you're strapped for cash.  It's a sunny afternoon and you're craving pizza.  So what do you do?  Head on over to the Fly Bar for 1/2 price pizzas ($4) and $3 pints, and grab a table by the big sunny window.  You won't find vodka and tequila here, but they make some pretty awesome sake cocktails.  There's also a pool table, tvs with sports and some pretty interesting art.  My personal favorite place to be on a late afternoon...partly because it's in my neighborhood. :)
author: Sarah S.

description:
Affordable cocktails, nice decor, cool artwork (love the mural in back) and a laid-back atmosphere...what's not to like?

NOTE: I went here (for the first time) on a weeknight, and have no idea if this place changes on weekends...for all I know the cocktails are expensive, the decor sucks, they cover up the mural in back and the atmosphere is annoying and frenetic. I'll have to go back again and see...
author: Art D.

description:
I must admit I'm biased, because I met my honey here on our first blind date. And it's walking distance from my house.

That being said, this place has good music, great sangria, and this fabulous taco-ish salad that rocks my universe. 

I don't like it when sake is masqueraded to me as a "cocktail," but at least this place states it clearly on the bar menu that you are ordering a "sake cocktail," unlike some places that pretend you're getting a real drink and then make you a soju-politan or a sake-tini or some nonsense.

I do not appreciate.

But the Fly keeps it real, so I still love them. Be friendly to the guy in the fedora at the end of the bar.
author: Vandana M.

description:
Giving three stars for the timebeing since I didn't feel like the place was super duper, but it wasn't horrible either. Middle of the ground. Fair enough?

Went to the Fly Bar on a Thursday night with my friend--she says the bar is a good place, so I trust her word. We went around 9:30, and it was a little crowded...service was quick though, and the bartender was generous despite the crowded atmosphere. 

Ordered two drinks, and they were pretty good. I wanted to order some food as well, but I wasn't aware of their menu. 

I will probably go back another time since my friend lives near the bar. Will probably increase the rating if my next experience is stellar.
author: Helene K.

description: Great spot for some happy hour beers, with some great pizzas to snack on.  Nacho platter is a good value and very tasty as well.  Definitely in the heavy rotation for me.
author: Victor B.

description: Great happy hour. Was there last Friday night and enjoyed a pitcher of inexpensive sangria and $5 personal pizza. Get there early because it's busy and may be hard to snag a table. After Fly Bar, check out Candybar down the street for dessert and more drinks!
author: Carrie S.

description:
Hipster, casual atmosphere, fresh salads, decent happy hour, great music, friendly service, and nice selection of beers.

Excellent spot for a drink or bite at all hours of the day.
author: jodes l.

description:
I never have actually eaten here, but I do like to imbibe here.

Randomly in the last three weeks I've been there twice.  It's a good place to just relax and chat with friends since the music isn't too loud and all.

If you get a seat by the window it's nice to watch people especially since the 24 Divis stops right in front...
author: Gene X.

description:
Common, any place that has half off pizzas during happy hour has to be a great place.  Personally, the NACHOS (w/chicken) are the best around! However, not a good choice if  you want more than one beer.  Enough to feed 2 people.
They have a pool table in the back with a midget stick.   for them tight spots in the corner ;0)  Not a serious spot to play pool but one that's fun if you don't take it seriously.  

The staff is great, friendly, and the crowd is mixed with all kinds of people.  The weekends get pretty packed at night so don't expect to find a seat.
author: Jamal G.

description:
Great nachos- one star.
Sangria that comes in pint glasses- one star.
Interesting art on the walls- one star.
Delicious pizza- one star.
Minus a star for the smell of tuna wafting from the table next to mine- I'm a huge fan of tuna melts, but not at midnight on a Friday.
author: Noelle Q.

description: My favorite bar in the town. Super chill place and inexpensive to hang out with friends. If there was an option i will probably live here.
author: Kishor K.

description: Hands down the best Tuna Melt w/ Bacon.  Don't forget to ask for it "with bacon".  It is mind-numbing.
author: Jennifer F.

description: I love the happy hours at Fly bar. The dollar off beers are good and the $5 pizzas are even better.
author: Lou T.

description: Fly Bar is my favorite casual food place. The sandwiches are so good. The tuna salad is the best i've ever had. The pizzas are good too; try the shroom pie. And the sandwiches come with a mixed baby greens salad which is simple but the best i've had. The bar does not have liquor. I hate soju cocktails and i think they are sorry excuses for drinks... soju cocktails are so bad that they make me angry. Needless to say, they serve soju cocktails here. Not that their soju cocktails are any worse than anywhere else; i just hate soju cocktails because i want real liquor. BUT they have the best sangria, and that totally makes up for the lack of liquor. Sangria and sandwiches for the win. Fly bar rules. The decor is cool too.
author: Geoff B.

description:
It was my first time going to Fly Bar today after all the Bay to Breakers festivities.  The atmosphere is quaint with crafty colored stars hanging from the ceiling and interesting murals on the walls.  They had some art displayed but it wasn't all that great.  The crowd was your late 20's early 30's.  Pretty refreshing if you ask me... or maybe I'm just being a hard ass since I was sick and tired of all the frat-like early 20 somethings running reckless in the streets post B2B.  Who knows?  

Anyway... my friend and I had their BBQ chicken pizza and their green mix salad.  It hit the spot after walking around NOPA for hours.  The selection of beer that they had wasn't so bad either.  A variety.  

I'd definitely go there for a drink or two or three etc... again.
author: Melissa M.

description:
My friends and I ended up here this evening, while trying to escape the Haight Street Fair craziness. It was a good walk, not too far but far enough that we were sat right away. And we made it in time for happy hour! Yay for 3 dolla beers and half price pizza. I had the Funky BBQ Chicken pizza, which was good, although the bbq sauce was a little too sweet. My friends had the fruits to nuts salad with apples, walnuts and chicken. Our waitress seemed pissed off in general--at one point she was muttering to herself and shaking her head about some other customers. My friend told her we wanted another round and then people changed their drinks from before which resulted in a haughty "That's not another round!" 

The crowd consisted of yuppies, hipsters and other drunk people who probably drifted over from the street fair. A drunk guy sitting at the table next to us who dropped an almost full glass a beer, which of course resulted in a loud "Party Foul!" from the bar.

All in all a decent neighborhood spot, with surprisingly good food.
author: Yiming R.

description:
Happy Hour is so happy here. Half price pizzas and cheap sangria from 3-6pm all week long. 
Drinks are inexpensive ($4 for most beers, sangria pitchers), staff are cool and friendly, crowd is boisterous and not too snobby.
author: Elsa E.

description: I have always had mixed experiences with the people who work here, but it is still one of my favorite happy hour places. The food is good an cheap and we always seem to be able to find a place to sit. They also have good beer on tap, can't complain!
author: Pam J.

description:
I popped in here on a rather lazy Sunday afternoon and had a great time with happy hour beers and a surprisingly delicious plate of Nachos.  For a small little corner bar, they've got some really tasty stuff on their menu.  It's a very comfortable, friendly space and the waitress was super nice to us as we were all just kinda hanging out and chatting.  For a place I just happened upon during a walk, it was a nice experience. 

I've been told it can get pretty busy on certain nights, but I can't imagine a crowd making it any less a nice place to enjoy a drink. If a place serves booze, it's kinda hard for me to be displeased.
author: Andy A.

description:
One of the best bars in SF. Great food! (Meatloaf Sandwich, Hummus, Pizzetta) Always a great mix of people. 

Good ol Fly!
author: Colleen M.

description:
Great music, fabulous drinks and cozy atmosphere. Perfect for hanging out with friends, chatting and just having a good time. 

There's a pool table in the back of the room and there are big star lanterns hanging from the ceiling. My friend and I found a table in the back and hung out while listening to fab music. 

The drinks are unique - mixed with soju or sake and they're only $5! I hear if you make it to happy hour, you can get personal pizzas for $3.50. Gotta come back soon and check it out!!!
author: Gladys C.

description:
This place is sweet. Considering its location, it was a good crowd. Drinks were good and the bar tenders were on top of it. Which to me as a customer is fantastic. The walls have some funky but good drawings, they also have some funky but kewl glass display decorating the walls.

I would recommend their ginger soju drink. Also try their cosmo with soju. Its very yummmy.
author: Amlan S.

description:
Didn't come here for the food, a walk in on Happy Hour..and was pleasantly surprised by the sake cocktails! I had the Sake Nectar, a blend of sake, pineapple and orange juice.  I don't normally like sake unless i'm doing some sake bombs in a sushi joint. But these little suckers were tasty and packed a punch! Mine definitely snuck up on me and the 2nd cocktail was just as delicious. I hear good things about the soju cocktails as well, but since i don't like soju anything, i haven't tried it..yet. Had some chips and salsa to go with it, the bill was under $40 for 4 of us. 

The interior is dark, smelly and the bathroom lines ridiculous, but you have good company, good conversation, good drinks..everything's allll good =)
author: Lulu C.

description:
If I'm not mistaken, they recently changed the "Fly" sign above this place and I am not a fan.  Somehow it has morphed into looking like an actual fly - was this intentional?  I dunno, but those spindly letters certainly remind me of dirty fly legs - ew!
Besides all of that, I do enjoy this place, especially at happy hour.  The music is fun and eclectic and you can't beat a half price pizza after a hard day's work.
author: Ky W.

description:
Another reason why I wish I lived in this neighborhood.  I remember as a 19-year-old, dating a 27-year-old (ooh...scandalous at the time.)  He took me to fly bar then, and I remember totally falling in love with this bar.  It wasn't for another 8 years later, I was on another date with another boy (with a more adequate age gap) that I realized this was the place I had long missed.  
Great food, very nice atmosphere with a pool table in the back.  Awesome artwork on the wal.  Super awesome beer selection too, goes well with any pizza on the menu.  The only complaint i would have is that, the tables are too close together.  But, it's a sneaky excuse to play footsie!
author: Wendy H.

description:
I love this place. Especially during happy hour. Tasty pizzas at half price. Big beers for $3!! And happy hours are even in effect during the weekend. 

The menu selection isn't overly inspiring. Some of the pizzas are more interesting than others...I really like the caramelized onion and blue cheese pizza. They also have a decent selection of salads and sandwiches, but nothing out of the ordinary. 

The sake cocktails are fun. There's a pretty extensive menu of sake drinks. Very fruity. Their beer selection is pretty decent as well.
author: Margo M.

description:
Really love the Apple cider sake bomb... but other than that...this place has kinda been an: in (quick sake bomb) & out (to the Independent or lion's den)
The staff is friendly...the crowd just isn't that fun...definitely more loungie than it should be considering there is a pool table.
But honestly  the Apple Cider Sake Bomb is on my top ten favorite drinks in the city (that is if you are looking to get a little messed up )
author: Whitney K.

description:
can't comment on the nightlife.  I just went there for a quick meal with a friend during the day.  the service was really good, it was definitely a very chill place to hang out.  I really liked the intimate booths.  the hummus was pretty tasty as was the grilled cheese sandwich, i'm not a big grilled cheese fan, but this was definitely yummy.
will definitely have to check back on the nightlife here...
author: Christina L.

description:
Fly Bar is chill and I loved living close by.  It's the perfect spot to hang if you've got a long wait at Kathmandu Cafe or Little Star.  The soju cocktails are tasty and better yet they're cheap.  Plus, you can usually squeeze in a game of pool with little to no wait. 

I also find it a fly place to have lunch.  Pardon the terrible pun.  The menu is pretty simple, but that means there isn't much to screw up so you can count on a reasonable and delicious meal.
author: Dubs W.

description:
*** read update at the bottom.

I started to read the other reviews on this place and I had to stop. So much whining. Goodness gracious. I'm rolling my eyes. Anyway...

The interior is dark and feels like a padded cell. There is a revolving art show on the walls of local artists. There is one pool table cramped in the back. There is a good selection of beers on tap although to see PBR was a shock. The food is larger portions and I would classify it as neveau pub fare.

I had the meatloaf sandwich this last time. It was called the "Ain't Yo Mama's Meatloaf Sandwich" and for good reason. This was actually better than your mama's meatloaf. Well, my mama's meatloaf at least. I don't know what your mama's meatloaf tastes like. And much love to my mama but this meatloaf was better.

I've had the nachos before and other pizzas like the Marguerite. Everything is generously proportioned and fairly priced. Fly doesn't have a hard liqueur license so all the drinks are mixed with sake or soju.

Now here's the kicker. I work for the Solstice/Fly/Brick empire and although I rarely go into Fly I still got great service... at 6:00PM. The price was right too (wink, wink).

***Update Feb 9 2008; Over the Christmas break Fly got a little face lift. It's a little roomier with a newly designed bar. New beers include Anderson Valley's Brother David's Double and Speakeasy's Hunter's Point Porter. I ate the Foghorn Leghorn sandwich and it was suggested to me that next time I get it on ciabatta with a side of bbq sauce.
author: Hunter G.

description:
The sandwiches are simple, but ultra-tasty- I'd suggest a Smokin' BLT or the tuna. Drinks are good too- they serve SOJU! :-) Soju is a smoooooth korean alcohol similar to vodka.
Atmosphere & artwork make this place stellar- the paintings were great to zone out with between talking & eating.
author: MG H.

description: Met a friend who just moved in around the corner. Neither of us had been there, and decided it looked intriguing enough. We went about 8pm, so the crowd was still pretty mixed with drinkers and eaters and drinkers/eaters. I had what was basically a cobb salad called something else and I really liked it.. the salad was fresh greens, and came with chicken-- that, with my stella draft, I was set. Pretty cheap, fun dark loungy atmosphere, no annoying people to complain about and an overall good night at a place I need to get back to.
author: M B.

description: Great ambiance and great staff. Pizzas are tasty. Too bad they don't have a liquor license!
author: Amjad S.

description: Went back to check it out for happy hour and now I get it! The sangria was damn tasty and paired with the BBQ Chicken Pizza... wow YUM! Happy to say that I am now a fan of the fly!
author: Margot K.

description: I really only like this place before 5pm, with a decent happy hour on pizzas. I love their downtown brown beer and the low key factor. Most of the bartenders are great and it's never crowded during the day. Love the local art and the pool table is chill if you aren't fighting off people to play. Great local neighborhood hangout. I am not a liquor person, so the beer/wine only thing is perfect for me.
author: Courtney s.

description:
I really enjoy this place, then again, I have always had good company while there. Although it is low key, it seems to attract quite a "before going out crowd" on the weekends. During the week it remains decently packed as people come for the salads, pizza and drinks. I have only sampled the drinks, but have heard through the yelpvine that the entrees are quite good. 
Bathed in a red glow with murals on all sides, you will feel hip, artsy and cool even if you are not ;-) when having a sake drink here. The Georgia Peach sake-tail was good times.  Peach, sake, and a mix of soy milk was just what the doctor ordered. The screw driver, with orange and soy was also tasty. The beer list is better than average, but I would come for the sake.
author: Mitchell W.

description:
I really like Fly Bar. It was a welcome change from the absolutely jam-packed Madrone down the street. I immediately like the decor of the place-really unique artworks and cool color scheme. There are these cool mirrors of all shapes and sizes above the bar. I've been on weekday night and it was very relaxing and comfy. I recently went on a Sat night; it was pretty crowded, but not elbow-to-elbow proximity and my friend and I snagged stools at the bar right away. The bartender was an interesting fellow and gave us his attention pretty soon. I have to agree the array of cocktail selection was dizzying. I ended up picking the Mangorita, a soju cocktail with mango, lime, cranberry, and some other fruity combination. Man it was really good and refreshing. And it was only $5! Excellent deal. 

Unfortunately I was close to maxing out my drink limit prior to coming so I couldn't finish my Mangorita. Plus the bartender was screaming "last call" at the top of his lungs at 1:24 am, and continued to do so every 5 minutes after that to get people to finish their drinks, close tabs, and get the hell out. He did it in a playful manner, of course. Otherwise I'd be like, "dude, chill out, I still got till 2 am to finish this fabulous cocktail." If I lived or worked closer to Fly I would come more often and try the happy hour specials yelpers have been raving about. This place could also be great for an Independent pre-concert drink.  But if you're just looking for a good neighborhood bar with good drinks, decent service, and interesting people, Fly's your place.
author: Linda L.

description: Probably my closest bar with a local hangout feel to it. Best seats next to the bar. Only wine & beer served that I guess keeps the atmosphere low key, no dancing on tables here. Pretty smart looking crowd and service with a smile. I'll try to remember to taste their food next time.
author: Jari S.

description: Went there around 8:30 on a Tuesday night and didn't have a problem with finding a seat.  The ambiance is pretty nice: dark walls, red lights, cool looking star ornaments over the pool table, intimate setting, the are for sale was neat.  Besides that, this place serves the same standard beers on tap that every other bar serves.  BUT, they do  have a pretty good selection for beers that come in a botte.  I didn't try their food but my comrades around me chowed down like there was no tomorrow.  Fly Bar is a good place to go to for a third date or to meet up with peeps and then head out to the next place.
author: Maegan S.

description:
This place was a pleasant surprise - It looks like a regular neighborhood bar from the outside, but the inside is artfully decorated and the staff is really nice.  Their menu is surprisingly diverse and creative, and they have a good beer selection.  Reasonably priced, and great for hanging out on a Sunday afternoon to have lunch and watch the game.

Update:  As a first impression, when I didn't live in the neighborhood, the above review was accurate.  After visiting more frequently and, eventually, living in the neighborhood, my opinion has changed slightly.  The food is overpriced and it's usually way too crowded to sit down and eat, anyway.  For drinks, I'd always choose the nearby 821 over Fly.  My new assessment is that this place is "eh".
author: Katie K.

description:
I've never really been into Sake... extra points for making drinks like Sea Breeze or whatever with Sake that taste like nice tropical juice! And points for having a happy hour that includes half off pizzas!

If you go, try the Chick Stix with peanut sauce. They're pretty damn good for "bar food" and it comes with salad on the side. Its a good appetizer for sharing.

I don't know that I'd frequent this place and I have never gone during a busy time, like later in the night or on the weekend. Since its a block from my house, its easy.
author: Jackie O.

description:
I love fly bar Pizza's on Happy Hour!  $4 dollar kick ass pizza's and $3 beers.  The funky chicken and the southwestern are my top faves so far.

The place is what it is, not trying to impress anyone with fake thrill and frills.  The one down side is that they only have a beer and wine license. But they still seem to do pretty well regardless.  

All kinds of people show up at this bar which is great.  You get the Pacific Heights people from up the hill, the lower Haighters, and the folk from Western addition.  Great for people watching!
author: Sweet Mother of Mary O.

description:
Really wanted to like Fly Bar.  There are some good and bad.

Pros: 
-A good value, esp during happy hour.  
-Drinks are inexpensive-but on the weaker side.  Think Kool Aid! 
-Happy hour pizzas are cheap and well above average. 
-Pool Table.

Cons:
-No Liquor.
-It's amazing that a place can only have one restroom for both sexes.
-Out of the entire bar, 2 of 4 of the staff were incredibly rude.  There are some other reviews suggesting the same.  Probably not a regular problem but one that is not rare.
-Understand megan w.'s review about 48 licenses (it's expensive too) however other places in the adjcent hood have them, and I don't believe a soju cocktail or a cheap pizza makes up for this deficiency, especially in a city like San Francisco where other options abound.  

Overall could have been a good spot to visit once in awhile but the service was a huge turn off.  Not everyone will have similar experiences.  But in a city with a multitiude of options Fly Bar does not pass my test.
author: Yong K.

description:
Went here a couple of times with friends. They have pool in the back which I think is a dollar or a dollar fifty to play. They ONLY serve soju/sake cocktails and beer. Oh...and a pitcher of sangria if that's what you like. Kinda hard to order at the bar cause it was so crowded and at most they have 2 bartenders so it gets a little out of control.

Place is good to relax and have a few drinks with friends but...soju/sake cocktails don't really do it for me like regular alcoholic beverages or just flavored soju (which they don't have...only cocktails) so...not really my kinda place. BUT of soju/sake cocktails and beer are what make YOU happy...then this is where you should be.
author: Tiff L.

description:
I have been coming to this place from the beginning
and I think it is alright if you get there early during happy hour
But if you go when it is packed it can be the most awkward place
ever. 
The most  attractive thing about the Fly is the Happy Hour and the down to earth hostesses that work there. Also the sangria mmmmm!
they used to have the red and the white sangria that was the shhhhh!!!

Yet if you cannot find a seat this place can go from 2 stars to no stars
and feel pretty sickening. Just go for the happy hour early and you will enjoy yourself tremendously.

In addition:
I went there recently and it seems like the prices have went up but the quality has gone way down.
author: Dwayne A.

description:
I don't have much to say... other than I had been here a few times prior. I had no flippin idea the Nachos were so crese'fresh. Plus, very reasonable prices. 

Let me attempt to put it another way. I liked the staff and scene so much, my to-go la totrilla salad's chips ALMOST lost their crispiness.

Mega props!
author: Jason A.

description: Focus seems to be on the sake and soju drinks which goes along with my tastes.  They have a pizza special and I think a sake special too in the early eves.  I like the high ceilings, it makes you feel like you have some room to spread.  Comfortable, casual and a bit more "grown-up" than some of the other bars in the area that seem to encourage more PBR sales (though the PBR bars are just fine too when I'm in that mood!)
author: Dizzy L.

description:
Fly Bar is amazing! Great decor, great ambiance, great beers, great staff, great vibe... 

OH and the pizzettas are totally amazing! I just moved to NY and I miss Fly Bar oh so much...

If you go.. get a Big Daddy IPA and an Italian pizzetta.... you won't be disappointed!
author: Leslie B.

description: Fly Bar has all the makings of the perfect neighborhood bar. Fantastic happy hour - half off pizzas and $3 pints. Great staff - super friendly. Good food - pizzas, salads, sandwiches and apps. TV for games (but not the total focus of the bar). Pool table.
author: Gretchen S.

description: Good drinks and a nice happy hour. Food was eh. The hummus is decent but avoid the pizza. We ordered the margherita and it did not resemble anything near what a margherita should be :| There was no fresh mozzarella or even fresh tasting mozzarella! I guess it was worth the $4.50 on happy hour but otherwise no way. Sangria was tasty, they have lots of beer on tap and the saki drinks are well made. I'll come for happy hour and drinks but eat elsewhere.
author: Cori W.

description: Wine, beer and soju cocktails. It's good. People seem to love it. But I guess I'm indifferent since I'm always craving whisky.
author: Alex H.

description:
Summary:  laid back, nice atmosphere, cheap drinks, decent pizzas

Best is going here for the happy hours beer and 1/2 price pizza specials from 4-6pm.
author: d f.

description:
I usually make it to the Fly Bar at night, so I miss the happy hour, but the later prices are still really decent for the quality.  What kinds of quality you ask?  Quality food, quality service, quality beers, soju, and sake-- oh my!  No hard alcohol license here, but you won't even notice (unless you're a vodka boozehound).  

There's dim lighting great for intimate dates, mesmorizing paintings on the wall that are changed out periodically (this place could second as an art gallery) on dark red walls that adorn their very own drawings, and a television usually airing sports (I'm not a fan, but if you are- there ya go) unpretentiously above the crowd.  Comfy booths await your tushy if you get there in time to nab one-- this place fills up pretty quick and doesn't tend to die down until last call.  You can sit at the bar or at tables along the wall as well.  In the back of the bar there's a pool table- a slight minus is that it's a bit askew.  So, if you suck at pool like me you can at least blame it on the pool table being uneven.

The music is always great here and a different genre every time I go in.  Last night was a lot of soul and funk, which suited my mood quite well as I tore into some Funky Chicken pizza (bbq, chicken, gouda, red onions, and scallions) and a side of Spinach & Artichoke dip.  Mmm mmm, good.  I seriously can say that I've tried over half the menu and everything is mahvelously delicious.  I would also recommend the hummus plate, grilled cheese sandwich, and goat cheese & chicken quesadilla.  Wash that down with a guinness if you have room left over...

Now, I may be a bit biased b/c this is so conveniently located by my house, but even if/when I move away from the NOPA I will still return to this place frequently. 

Oh snap, it's so FLY.
author: Amber B.

description:
Great neighborhood hangout.  The bar tender Russ is really chill.  Happy hour from noon- 6:30 PM featuring $3 19oz beers, 11 on tap i beleive, as well as $3 sake cocktails and 1/2 off pizzas.

Crowded on friday and saturday night, but the service is excellent, and You'll never have a problem getting a drink (might not get to sit though.)

Pool table in back, though in rough shape.

Keep in mind, no hard liquior, which doesn't bother me at all.
author: Luke G.

description:
Great spot to chill and meet some friendly, diverse people. Well maintained pool table. Bar service is usually pretty quick. NOPA is just a better place to chill than the marina/nob hill because you get potheads and trendy flourecent orange New Balances, which i will take any day over blow and red sox hats.
I also heard that this is a great spot to meet young USF girls, but don't tell my lady that.  Ohh and they play Outkast and Wu Tang to keep the party rolling. 
Minus one start because sometimes i need a shot of tequila and soju just wont do.
author: Sean K.

description:
They get 4 stars for their art work. Its tough to call a place a bar when they don't have any hard booze. The beer and wine are all good but sometimes people want shots of hard liquor at a bar and this place doesn't have them. I've not eater here somaybe thats part of the reason some people go there. The food on other peoples plates looked good.

The art work in the main room is cool, very facial and "wordY".
I would recomend checking out the bathroom ceiling and the art in there as well. Cool broken mirror affect that someone is paying dearly for with lots of bad luck. Speaking of mirrors they have a sudo collection of mirrors above the bar.

If they had a big blinking neon sign that said they had sake it would be cool because I seem to discover that option after ordering a beer.
author: Andrew W.

description:
I give Fly 4.5 stars.  Ah, if it was only a little bit larger.

Fly is a great neighborhood bar that has good beers on tap, and does cheap happy hours. I just moved to the neighborhood, though I used to frequent this place back when I lived in the 'Loin, and through all these years, this place has been a steady and reliable stand-by for me.  

Whether you're "pre-gaming" it before a show at the Independent, or looking to meet someone for a casual date, Fly is a good - neutral - place to just hang.  

I miss the old chalk-board and am still getting used to all the new decor though.

Good food (the Foghorn Leghorn and Chicken nachos are my favorites) and the service has always been friendly.
author: A.D. A.

description: You know you've found a cool bar when you spy cute boys reading Hemingway.
author: Cinnamon F.

description:
A fan I am!

This place a great. Could get a little crowded though.
We had a party of 5 in a table for four. We wanted the Happy Hour so we squeezed. Awesome!

Sake cocktails, all pretty awesome! But there's not that much difference in taste between each one. Just more or less alcohol content.

Second drink. I think I'll just stick with a snakebite. To my surprise, the waitress brought over a glass that looks nothing like a snakebite so I said...

M: I'm sorry but this isn't the snakebite I ordered.
W: Yes it is, Stella with Cider.
M: Really?? I always thought it was Guinness and Cider.
W: Yeah, that's what I thought too but someone told me this was it. Try it, if you don't like it, I'll change it.

And I did like it! I learned something new! Wow!
Sh said the Guinness and Cider was called Black Velvet. I don't know if she's correct or not but if somebody knows, let me know so I know for the future.

For food we ordered a variety of 1/2 priced pizza including Blanco, The Funky Chicken, and Mmm...Meat. All good but nothing special with the mm..meat. The blanco was my favorite. Maybe because I'm a sucker for sun-dried tomatoes.

The table next to us order the spinach and artichoke dip and it looked SOO good we had to get that too. They even serve it hot! Great! And it was good.

Maybe a new favorite happy hour place? I don't know...need a few more test runs.
author: Jimmy N.

description: I am so lucky to have this bar as  my neighborhood watering hole! Everything about this place is GREAT. Especially their salands. Try the salad...my fav is Fruit to Nuts.
author: Elana U.

description:
I give Fly Bar the rare 5 star review.    It's friendly (although too crowded with hipsters on the weekend), it's got a great beer selection, it's got a pool table, it's got cool artwork, it's got loads of really cute girls, and it's got very good food - Funky Chicken!

This is the best bar in DivCo (not to be confused with NoPa, which starts two blocks west)
author: Nick A.

description:
This is a great bar to have in the neighborhood.  It's in a great location, serves food until 10, and has good beers on tap. You can get a table earlier in the evening and it's crowded after 10.  

I end up here a lot.
author: Jason C.

description:
Stopped in for a takeout pizza today and was very impressed. Plenty of options to choose from - I went with the southwestern, featuring corn and black beans, and thought it was super tasty. For $10 the size was spot on (8 small slices), and I give kudos to the bartender for offering tomato sauce when I asked for no cheese - had she not said anything, I would have had no idea it didn't come with it. I really appreciated that.

The pies are half off during happy hour (3:30 - 6:30 if I remember correctly), making a delicious deal even better.
author: Jason B.

description: Dear Bartender, Give me your playlist. From, Neighborhood Customer
author: L M.

description: Happy hour is amazing! The pizza here is to die for. I would recommend the sake bombs too. They have pear cider and cold sake, sooo yummy!! Love coming here for a beer and pizza during the day, or some sake bombs and a few games of pool during the night! The crowd is never too rowdy, the lights are usually dimmed so this can set the mood for a romantic night out or a mellow time with friends. They don't have a full liquor license but they can make great drinks with their sake, and they have a good selection of beer on tap. I would not necessarily suggest the Sangria, a bit too sweet and syrupy for my taste. Other than that, bartenders are fun and upbeat. Always a good time at Fly Bar!
author: Marguerite m.

description: A casual neighborhood bar with a slightly classier lounge feel.  A decent selection of beers, and pretty good food too.  I recommend the chicken and goat cheese quesadillas!  The salads are perfect for sharing, as they're all bloody huge! The staff are a little spacey, but they get the job done.
author: Jesse R.

description:
The perfect local watering hole...I love this place!  The beer is always great & the Sake drinks aren't bad either.  Try the "Poppy Jasper," if you like smooth- Pale's.  
The folks that work there are all super sweet & helpful...& if you're lucky you might meet "The Mayor." He always has his top hat on ;)
author: Hana L.

description: I can't believe I've never reviewed this place. I live a couple blocks away and so I've been here many times over the years. If I'm getting out of work on time and don't have a clue on what to have for dinner I just go to Fly and have two Guinness and a pizza for $11. The music is always good, the staff is always friendly and there is always sports on the TV.
author: Corey V.

description:
I am biased. I admit it.  I had the best first date EVER here so I can only think of nice things about the FLY.  

Food was great, drinks were good, and the most beautiful woman EVER was sitting at the table with me.  What else could you need?  Oh yeah, she seduced me that night!  YAY!
author: Matt C.

description: I've been here a handful of times and always been impressed. It's got a hip, yet relaxed atmosphere. The menu is decent, and the drinks are good.  Definitely worth a visit if you are in the neighborhood.
author: lena m.

description:
The other night, my boyfriend said, "How are you gonna write a review of the Fly Bar? You just sat in the booth and tried not to fall asleep. Nothing even happened there."

Oh, sweet, sweet, simple man... You are so wrong. Not only am I going to write a review of the Fly Bar, I'm going to dedicate my 200TH REVIEW to it. And here goes...

I've never liked the Fly Bar. Hence why I was totally zoned out on my most recent visit. For some reason, people think entering it makes them "fly" and there are always stupid girls bumping and grinding around the bar like the fly girls, only they are NOT as fabulous as J. Lo and their booties are NOT as scrumptious. 

There's a two-inch step up to the tables immediately to the right of the door, which has caused me to almost fall on my ass WHILE SOBER so many times in that bar... There's just NO REASON FOR THE STEP TO EXIST. No reason. And NO REASON I need to fall down while sober. I mean, I've faceplanted PLENTY of times in this city. But I PREFER to have a good excuse:

-- My big angry Irish friend and I were celebrating Christmas with a vodka-drinking contest at Murio's Trophy Room (we are classy shit!).

-- It was my roommate's 30th birthday and I HAD to out-drink her. And the doorman. And all the metal dudes hitting on us. At Annie's Social Club.

Etc, etc. 

I can recover from such spills just fine. Sober spills -- fxxx that. NOT fly.

Weekend nights here are crowded and service is slow. Also not fly. In general, this is just another bar that's not made for me. Which is fine. I am who I am. I'm a lush, I like cheap booze, chill crowds, good music (meaning the music that I LIKE -- duh), unpretentious people and unpretentious surroundings. I like things the way they are where I come from -- Detroit. The Fly Bar doesn't fit that bill, and that's okay. For the most part, I just avoid it and places like it and everyone stays happy.

But I was there last weekend. The company I was with likes it, and I'm not that big of a brat, okay?

(Even though Waziema is right down the street! Right down the street!)

And I've decided, for my 200th review, that I'm going to give it three stars instead of two. Because had I not gone there on Friday night, I wouldn't have seen, as I was approaching, Starla D. and amir a. standing outside smoking cigarettes. And I wouldn't have been forced to make nice with Amir after a little tiff we had. 

Briefly, it went something like this...

Amir and I were going to mock meat restaurants to eat about once a week for a while there trying a different one as often as possible and we really wanted to try Layonna Vege on Clement but the time we tried it was closed and then the next time he asked me to go I said I couldn't because it was the night before I was moving (hello!) and then I find out the next week via this yelp review -- http://www.yelp.com/biz/WDHpY_FcUAJjUm-YQW2xrw#hrid:xa089lzcfcZFsGrgs5ebww -- that he had gone there with other people and I was hurt okay? and I sent him a compliment that basically said "fxxx you our ritual is DONE" because come on! you guys couldn't have gone to a different restaurant? you couldn't have waited until AFTER I was settled or something? sheesh but oh well and I really wasn't THAT mad but I just wanted him to know that I was really enjoying our little ritual because I love Amir and I was a little bummed about that and then I don't hear from him for like THREE WEEKS I mean I even got an ROTD and he didn't even compliment me WTF? THESE THINGS MATTER! so I email him "amir you can't be mad at me because I said I was mad at you that's lame come on let's just get over this speak to me damnit" or something like that and he just emailed me back "what are you wearing" WTF? so I email him back "jeans a tank top and a bandage on my new tattoo sexy shit" or something and then another week goes by no word from  him and I email him again "SERIOUSLY are you never going to speak to me again?" and he emails me back "what are you talking about! I asked you what you were wearing!" or something and then I see him at my roommate's birthday at Inner Mission Tavern and he looks all depressy and I don't talk to him because I think things are still weird and then the next time I see him is at Fly Bar and Starla is like "you guys talk! please!" and we do and Amir  is like "I was afraid of you!" or something and I'm like "WTF! this is so dumb! I love you! can we just be friends now! AND WHY ARE YOU SMOKING YOU SHOULD QUIT BECAUSE I'M QUITTING AND QUITTING SUCKS AND MISERY LOVES COMPANY!"

And all this was relived/resolved/happened outside the Fly Bar. And the bouncer was very entertained by our drama. He seemed like a cool dude.

Extra star, The End.
author: Lisa T.

description: As one one my new neighborhood hangouts, I'm a big fan of Fly. There's something of a hipster Cheers feel to the bar, since you always run into someone you know here. They serve some solid food, great pizzas for sharing, and they pour a nice Guinness, and also carry Poppy Jasper (one of my favorite beers of all time, next to Racer 5 IPA). If I had to file a complaint, it's just that they don't serve hard liquor, but you find a way to get by anyhow. My friend Michelle just started doing some curation for them as well, so if you see some stunning art on the walls, that's her influence. Fly's a great spot to meet if you're on the way to a show at the Independent, or even before or after dinner at Little Star, but it's also just a great place to meet up and share good times and bad with old and new friends.
author: Nish N.

description: Fly Bar is great (for both food and drink!); however, their sangria causes one to vomit in one's sleep, and thus should be avoided at all costs.
author: Alexandra P.

description:
Fly Bar is amazing. I once ate the caramelized onion pizza three days in a row. Cheap and great food, always a fun crowd, good service, a pool table... what else are you looking for?

Well, maybe hard liquors, but who needs whisky when you have Shiner?
author: Taylor F.

description:
eh. marginally fun.  at least it's big-ish and has a pool table...apparently they serve up pizza and live music but they certainly did not have that last friday.

saving grace equals the big tables and the liquor store across the street (we may or may not have had to sneak in jaegermeister and redbull).

WHATS WITH BARS THAT ONLY SERVE SHOJU. yuck.
author: Brooke M.

description: I'd never hang here at night but for an off-hour snack - why can't you get a sit-down meal btwn 3pm and 5pm anywhere? - I say "oui" to bar of the flies.  I had some grub worthy items - tho $7.25 for a grilled cheese is just crazy talk - served by a no nonsense, gum snappin' dame who was running the entire show solo and doing a fine job of it too (an extra star for her).  Also, I liked the music - anyplace that plays George Michael followed by Johnny Cash makes me all glowy inside.
author: Mokirobinson M.

description: A creative way to save a buck or $10,000 on a liquor license.  Beer, wine (?), sake and soju are all you get here, but they mix it up creatively.  Being a sake fan, I didn't so much mind, but I suppose when you're craving a cocktail, this isn't the best place to come.  The dcor was kind of dive-bar meets Urban Outfitters - hanging paper stars and a pool table - that kind of thing.  My saketini was dry and delicious, and I sipped from the other fruity offerings which were all delightful.  I might pop in were I in the neighborhood again, but unless you're with a sake fan, it's not so much a destination bar.   They also serve food, it seems - didn't try any.
author: Sam P.

description: A neighborhood place I desperately wish wasn't in mine.  Every weekend, at 2:00am, drunken revelers spill out onto the sidewalk and stagger their way up Fulton in search of cars they shouldn't be driving, laughing and shouting and waking up everyone within earshot - and trust me, sound travels far at that hour.  Revenge, as they say, can be oh-so-sweet . . . in the form of a bucket of ice cold water that hits its mark with perfect precision. I may not have cured them of drinking too much, but I've sobered them up for now, and the  next time they leave Fly, they'll probably still be obnoxiously loud, but I'm certain they'll stay off MY side of the street.
author: Gourmet G.

description: I went here with a friend & the only seats available were out this large study hall like table in the front of the bar. The seats weren't particular comfortable, but worse of all was the fact you were inappropriately close to numerous other groups who were eating & having conversations you were so awkwardly close you couldn't not here them. The atmosphere was trying to be intimate, but the setup in the area didn't allow for it. Try having a seated meal, the drinks were good.
author: Cara J.

description:
Ahhhhh Fly Bar.

It's hard to find decent bar food in SF, especially coming from the east coast.   Fly Bar is my go-to place.   My favorite happy hour ($3 drinks and 1/2 price pizzas till 6:30).  Plus the food is fantastic. 

The crowd is decidedly mixed and I mean that in the best way possible.  Locals, hipsters, yuppies, college kids; they all mix here.  It's exactly what San Francisco should be.

Great beer selection, lots of sake drinks, tasty sangria.  Attentive and nice staff.  Great neighborhood.
author: Kris E.

description: Great place to grab $3 happy hour beers. Bartender was very friendly. On a Friday afternoon the bar has a mainly men clientele-perfect for single ladies.
author: Melinda Q.

description: We were visiting from Sacramento to go see a show at the Independent.  We were looking for somewhere fun to eat with alcohol and great food and we found that at Fly Bar. The atmosphere was fun and young. In our group, we tried 3 different pizzas: Carmel Blue, Schroom Pie and Jimmy the Greek.  By far, all of us in our group like the Carmel Blue the best.  We saw other patrons eating their salad.  The salads looked very large and fresh.  We look forward to trying those the next time we are in the area.
author: Temperance H.

description: I love this place...I recently went there with a coworker to get a drink after work and I was surprised by how great the food is.  I had never ordered anything besides a YUMMY sake infused cocktail and I am dying to go back for the Pizzetta.  This is a great neighborhood bar that is always hopping with attractive locals.
author: Mary S.

description: My man and I had two pizzas and four sangrias for dinner.   When the bill arrived, $23, we thought there must be a mistake.  Turns out we got there at the tail end of happy hour so the pizzas were half off and the drinks were c.h.e.a.p.  When was the last time you paid $23 for dinner in San Francisco?!   Including drinks!  The pizzas were amazing (blanco was probably 3.5 stars, but the Carmel with Gorgonzola was definitely 5 star.)  The sangria was delicious.  Our waitress was delightful. We really liked the music they were playing, and the place is just really cute.  You cannot beat this deal in the city.  It really is as good as it gets.
author: Gaping F.

description: Best bar food in the city, cool vibe and awesome selection of beer and cocktails.
author: Ben M.

description: Lots of Fran Drescher voiced Lindsey Lohans running around. Lots of Justin Timberlake's. A couple of Keanu's circa Bill & Ted. If this is yer thang... do it. Otherwise, nothing to see or do here. Plenty of better options in terms of bars and barfoody places in NOPA & Haight that'll better serve you. "Cha...I'm SO sure."
author: Johnny C.

description: Should actually be called Maggot. Just a bunch of worms squirming around in a dim cowpie. I'm not sure what the person who called it a "neighborhood" bar meant exactly, but I don't know many people who live in that hood that go there. It's mostly slimey meet market types lookin for a cheap, roudy lay. The food ain't good, the drinks ain't good, the service ain't good. So many better choices.
author: sockanooni s.

description: I dig the happy hour deals.  Sake and pear juice cocktail with a margherita pizza for under $10? I'm down.  And I don't dig the crowds--get there before 4:30 if you want to avoid that.
author: Robyn E.
