description: The first time I went to the fly bar it was my 21st birthday. That was 4 years ago and the bar looked totally different. There were large curtains and there weren't mirrors everywhere. I think. I got very very intoxicated while there so I guess my first impression isn't totally reliable. However, I've been back here many times since and the decor was what I remember that night until recently when I went back after about a year away. The drinks are the same, and the food is pretty good. I ate their pizza on my birthday. I still like it but the space seems more open which some people may enjoy but I like feeling closed in and cozy. I'll still frequent this bar, but I wish they'd bring back the red lighting and curtains.
author: Monica C.

description:
things i like about fly bar begin with their happy hour and pizzas. ok, those are really the only two reasons i ever find myself here, but i am by no means stating i wouldn't go here for a few beers and a pool game with pals. i mean, they do have purple felt on that table..

fly bar does pizza pretty damn well. half price pizzas taste even better. and pair that with a snakebite and you've got yourself a recipe for one happy jeremiah. it's also a good idea to order a couple of pizzas amongst friends and share slices. sharing really is caring.

this place has a tendency to get packed and there's only one bathroom. but it's one of those big bathrooms you can fit four people in at once, a perfect situation for a few quick bumps before getting back to talking that girl up at the bar. they also put sports on the television for those sunday afternoons when you want to know if the patriots were caught cheating again. the ambiance is of the darker, more relaxing sort.

p.s. i do not condone drug use in or around bars, alcohol, or small children.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: A nice little bar and restaurant with a good vibe. Coming from L.A. I immediately expected a lot of too cool for school 'tude but everyone is really warm and friendly. Chalk another one up for SF. It's beer and wine only so I recommend the sangria or one of the great beers they have on tap. My only gripe is that it is on the small side and seating space gets taken up quickly. Standing around isn't so bad and the music is good. Definitely a fan.
author: Allistair J.

description: This is my local watering hole. Downtown Brown and Watermelon Wheat on tap: is there anything more I need? Pair that with a Nick's Salad (BOMB!) and great service from some staff that I feel are close friends, you have yourself a great bar. And if you're one of those douche bags coming in for Jager Bombs, go to the marina. This ain't your spot, buddy!
author: Joe G.

description: Love it.. they have great happy hours.. you get pizza and drink for half price.. perfect when you are doing your laundry.. and having late lunch here... it also great at night...friendly staff.. good crowd.
author: Shradha K.

description: Good pizzas and happy hour! A friendly staff and good customers. I'm a local to this bar and enjoy it most on weekdays and early on weekends because it can get very crowded and loud on a Fri/sat night. But then again, I'm one of those people who likes a bar where I can get a seat and talk to my neighbor, not scream. :p So it really depends what your looking for on the weekends. :D
author: Amber I.

description:
One pool table. So-so sake martinus and Soju drinks, which tasted like watered-down rail vodka mixers. Average service, at best. Stella from the tap tasted a little flat. The music selection was definately not fitting with a Saturday night crowd, we heard Snoop Dogg's "Gin 'n Juice" twice, along with some other rap selections. I don't dislike rap, but somehow it just felt out of place on this night. At the very least, ditch the trendy red lighting and earth-toned curtains and hip paintings/trinkets that decorate the walls if you're going to fill the jukebox with background-quality fodder like the stuff I heard Saturday night. 

I did, however, enjoy the plethora of beautiful and sexy women who were here, most of which in small pairs or groups, no men in sight. One extra star for the fact it was NOT a sausage fest. 

I might swing by another time, perhaps during happy hour, to give it another shot as it's within stumbling distance from my apt.
author: Alex G.

description:
Um... Just got made fun of by the waitress.  Yeah,  I heard you talking quietly to the other waitress.  Guess ordering 2 pitchers of sangria and 3 entrees and having some fun doesn't prevent us from getting snickered at by a mean curly-haired waitress.  Used to be one of my favorite places (even going so far as telling people to go there for the yummy pizzetas). 
At least be civilized enough to talk about us further than a foot away.  Just rude.
author: J P.

description: Not your typical bar food. Prices are good and the food is above average. Nice cozy atmosphere and the regulars make it an interesting place if you're open to meeting new people. Recommended.
author: keith h.

description: i work across the street, and not only is the food awesome (i can't say much about the crowd as i just get stuff to go, but lay off people, hipsters are EVERYWHERE these days) but the staff is made up of some of the nicest people in san francisco. Also: the fly does not call itself an "art lounge" which automatically makes it one million times cooler than madrones.
author: mark s.

description: yay for casual and friendly.  I didn't have to pre-intoxicate myself to walk into this bar because there is NO ATTITUDE.  our server was a real sweetie and kept me schnockered all night.  She gave me some kind of sweet, milky-looking sake that she called N----? anyway, apparently it is unfiltered sake.  i wish they had a hard-liquor license, though.
author: Madelena M.

description: Always a fun, chill vibe! Beer and wine bar which is my type of place. Happy hour ends at 630 but cant beat a $1 off a pint if you get off early. Have been here early for beer and late night for dancing and well a beer! Very social atmosphere with pool in the back. Unisex bathroom. Accepts cards. Bistro tables and bar seating. Serves food.
author: Amber S.

description: Pool table, good food, great beers on tap.  Come before 6:30 and you will: a) get a table without waiting, and b) get $3 beers and half price pizzas.  The sangria is good too, but I find it needs more fruit most of the time (I guess maybe that's a good thing...too much wine-marinated fruit can be lethal!)
author: Michelle L.

description:
Okay - Gotta say that the cocktails are tasty, the food decent and cheap and nice bartenders.  

HOWEVER, the waitress there nearly ruined not only my whole experience with the establishment, but my birthday as well.  I called ahead of time to let them know that about 30-40 people would be coming in and out of the bar for birthday drinks, etc.  I wasn't sure how they wanted to handle a group that size, but said it would be informal, people coming in for drinks at their leisure.  The woman on the phone asked if people would be eating and I told her that some likely would while others would just be there for drinks.  She said that would be fine and that she could let us use half of the back tables.  She further took my name and phone number and said that she would be talking with the bar manager and if they needed to discuss anything further, they would call me.  

When my birthday evening came and people started to arrive, apparently the waitress was dismayed as she said she was expecting 10 people.  I was a bit confused as I clearly said 30-40 and wanted to warn them that a larger party was expected.  After she refused to come to the table to take drink orders, and people started going to the bar to get drinks, she complained to one of my guests that people weren't ordering from her.  I tried to encourage people to order from her, at which time she cornered me (in front of NUMEROUS people) to say that she was in fact the one who talked to me on the phone and that the whole event was not going as we had discussed.  She complained that people wanted separate checks and asked how I proposed that people pay for their drinks.  I asked her how she normally had people pay for drinks at the bar and she said "CASH!" to which I said "okay."  Anyhow, after that she refused to serve me, so anytime someone at a table wanted to get service from her, I had to get up and leave.  Another guest had a long conversation with the bartender about the whole scenario and all I know is that drinks were kept in my hand for the rest of the evening.

So, while the bitchy waitress just about ruined the entire evening, the bartenders managed to salvage things making it into a funny anecdote rather than a bit of a tragedy.

Moral of the story - the place is okay if you sit at the bar.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Another one of my favorite bars in town -- everything on the Divis corridor in the Panhandle seems to nail it as far as drinks/crowd/atmosphere go. Just had a really fun happy hour here with a big group of friends - good selection of beers and Soju cocktails, and good bar food menu as well. Several big booths are located in the back if you roll in with a big crowd, and there's a pool table too if that's your thing.
author: Chris B.

description:
Fly Bar is an incredible spot to stop by for Happy Hour, Night Out, Food or Just Getting Plain Ole Drunk!

Driven by Fly Bar countless times, as it is on a major street. Well finally I could cross this off the list "places I want to go because I drive by them on a weekly basis". Long list name I know!

Got one of the tables in front of the bar, can be cramped for a party of four and people sitting next to you. Front door has a habit of not staying open and not shutting completely so on a cold night, sit far away.

Love the interior, dimly lit with dark red interior. Could be color blind? Fun shuffle board in the back and the wait staff is very friendly. Cannot say the same for the bar, as I never ordered a drink there.

Score places high on my list as they had Speak Easy on tap, two kinds. Everyone seemed to love the Sake drinks, which were some incredible mixtures of stuff I would not drink, not when even paired with alchol, like SOY MILK! But they really did pull it off when I sampled all their crazily named Sake drinks with even more interesting ingredients. 

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food, to many times have I been to bars and lounges expecting microwave quality food.  Food was great, thin crust pizzas with an assortment of great toppings and the chips and guacamole were better than some restaurants.

Fly bar is a funs top on a night of debauchery or a great place to hole up and escape the insanity that is turning left on Divis.
author: David B.

description:
i really really want to like fly bar.  they play a fun mix of 80's - current music; have a good happy hour deal (even if it ends at SIX PM!  that's really a "happy afternoon" special and some of us work in the afternoon from time to time); have plenty of seating for drinks and food; serve good food choices; have a kind of cool, arty interior...  but there's nothing about it that has ever seemed outstanding or particularly memorable.  it isn't really set up for, and doesn't seem to draw a very mingle-y crowd, which is unfortunate.  also, the service is very hit or miss.  last night was definitely a miss.  

three stars for solid effort.
author: Kirsten F.

description: Fly is where you go when you deserve to have a grilled cheese for dinner with salad and wine. (But when you don't deserve it, go to Sparky's instead, because it comes with fries AND they have $1.50 beers.)
author: Stumbalina b.

description: Always really crowded, but they do have some decent beers on tap. Decent music too, but its the chatter from the crowd is usually louder than the music...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Before this became a Marina style bar in the lower Haight, it used to be a semi run down pizza place. I checked the bar out regardless one evening with a friend who lived around Alamo Square and complained about people parking their SUVs and jeeps in his hood on weekend evenings all the time. Let's put it this way: we liked the pizza place better.
author: Roland A.

description: I thought when I moved a couple blocks away this was a quiet neighborhoodie bar but was I wrong.  Everyday of the week this place is usually crowded.  The food is great, my favorite the Southwest pizza.  Their happy hour is half off on pizza, which is great!  The crowd is cool and the bar great.  Highly recommended.
author: Jessica C.

description: Soju is Solame. The food is cool, the happy hour menu is kinda small, but priced well, I never seem to get to the pool table.... I DO however like the artwork back there. The crowd CAN be interesting, but it isn't always, so if you like to people-watch don't count on it.  Oh, and the tuna sammitch was damn near a mayonnaise sammitch, and even though I've got island blood (and we love mayonnaise! and spam musubi too, so that should tell you we're culinary geniuses! ) it was a huge turn-off.
author: Lolo G.

description: I didn't eat here, but the vibe is cool. Lots of tables filled with diners and saw hummus and pizzas on a lot of the tables. We came after dessert and dinner to shoot pool, for one dollar and I beat my boyfriend at it as well! Enough said, I like this place!
author: Natalie S.

description: Great happy hour, (3-6:30) $3 beers, sake drinks, 1/2 price pizzas.  I had 4 drinks and a pizza for under $20!  The drinks are interesting cocktails made with sake because they don't serve hard alcohol.  Our table was trying one of each.  Pizza was very good.  I had the BBQ chicken one.  Great place to hang out on a weekend afternoon or before a show at the Independent.  Try the sake bomb (sake in a glass of cider) our waitress even did one with us.  Fun times!
author: Sarah M.

description: Back in the day (4 years ago or so when I was out on Divi) I used to come here. I'm not a big Soju fan nor do I like saki outside of a festive sushi fest. However I got to give them props for having both Big Daddy and Prohibition Ale on tap!!! And at $3 a pint during happy hour how can you wrong (this just gave you all an extra star--it saved yo' ass! for mediocre-dom)? I also dig the pudgy kid artwork and the fact they have a pool table. Oh yeah, the food's not too shabby either (but not high on the alcohol absorption factor).
author: Veronica G.

description: This place just doesn't have a good feel to it. I used to live only a block away, so I gave it a few tries, but no. There is really nothing I like about this place. Except for that one time, a few weeks ago, when I saw that sweet bar fight that no one did anything about. Nothing like watching some dude get repeatedly pounded in the head with a pint glass while you sip your brew. Beer and wine only, and full of snobs and UFC fighters.
author: Crystal R.

description: We came here with another couple for happy hour - barely making it on time. The three of them had beers and I slammed down a saketini and a sangria. We all complimented our drinks with the personal pizzas. Although I enjoyed the drinks and the food, we ended up in the dump spot - the one by the kitchen walkway - which apparently is the spot you're seated at in any restaurant when the servers never  want to see you again. That being said, it was a nice place in substitution of our original plans but it wasn't spectacular enough for me to frequent.
author: Selina L.

description:
Yelp is about the overall dining experience, right? I am only giving 2 stars because my salad was really good.  The pizza was OK, nothing fabulous.  But our WAITRESS....could not have been more surly.  We arrived with 3 friends from out of town hoping to show them a good time.  We were seated right away and given menus, those 2 things composing the best of the service we received that night.  
After we got our drinks---P.S. the sangria is CRAP in a GLASS--we were essentially ignored until our food came.  We were on a time schedule (nothing outlandish or demanding, mind you), and waited politely for our bill to arrive for 20 minutes after we had finished eating and our plates were cleared (not by our original waitress).  After discovering that we might not see her unless we made the effort to track her down ourselves, I decided to be the bill-getter of the party.
I found our server up at the bar, leaning against it, very casually chatting up a guy and batting her eyelashes at him.  I asked for the bill and she was totally INCENSED that I had interrupted them.  To prove her point and be a complete bitch, she looked right at our table as she continued to chat and laugh and throw her head back as though her gigolo for the night was the most entertaining person in the world.  This lasted about another 10 minutes, at which point we were ready to hit our last resort--- the "hog-and-jog".  Perhaps she read our minds because just as we had decided collectively to leave (waiting 35+ minutes for a bill should never happen), she materialized with our bill. 
As someone who has been a server many years of her life, I know a tip is a PRIVILEGE, not a RIGHT.  We declined to tip this waitress (something I haven't done in 7 years) for her hostile, inappropriate attitude, after which, she chased us down the front sidewalk demanding something be left for her.  She had zero class, zero dignity, and no clue.  I'd be embarrased for myself if I was stiffed and would never make an ass out of myself trying to chase down an unearned tip!!  I'd try it again if I could be reassured this person was no longer an employee, but til then...
NEVER AGAIN!!!
author: Lea N.

description: Pretty good food, comfy tables along the side, service was good. Also open during the dreaded 2-5pm hours when I'm hungry and everything is closed!
author: Sarcastic T.

description:
I was introduced to fly about 3 years ago... it was during that time that i feel in love with the nachos... the baked freshy goodness of jalapeno cheese atop a mound of chips with some beans, guacamole and sour cream .. all mushed together to provide you with a great mixture of flavors! After coming here many times and only eating nachos, i decided to venture out into something a lil more cheaper, pizza... as these lil flavorful bites are great and also qualify for the happy hour prices.. so thats def a big plus. 
the maritinis are also happy hour prices and are great to sip on with some pizza or antother item from their menu. 
another plus about this place is happy hour is Mnonday thru sundays.. which is a big plus if you happen to drink on weekends like most of us do and want to save a lil bit of money b4 hitting the bars or clubs on weekend nites! 
i would and have recommended this place to a few friends and from the ones that i have taken there, they all love it and would go bak for more. 
also another note: for some reason.. the Fly on Divisdero tastes alot better than the new one that opened off of Sutter St.... although i dont want to bash it completely.. cuse it does have alot more room, and a small game room where you and some friends can get in a few rounds while downing some beers...
author: Spookee X.

description: I always come here while I'm waiting for a table at Little Star Pizza.  I like their sangria and the bartenders are attentive.  People are usually casual and easygoing here-- no "scene" yet it's not stinky or dirty.
author: Kari L.

description: I usually just get beer here, but I hear the sake drinks are pretty good.  This place has been ripped on in the past for being host to some preppy-types, but there must have been a truce as you'll find all kinds of people here (hipsters, hippies, yuppies, Marina-kids, norms, etc.) and the atmosphere and art is great.
author: Chris M.

description:
i used to work til late on friday and early in the morning on saturday at a group home across the street from alamo square park. i'd sleep there, rather than trek across the bay and back on bart, which was always annoying and creepy late at night. but sometimes it was really too annoying and creepy to sleep in a group home after working there for ten hours and knowing that i'd have to work twelve more hours the next day.

and so...

enter john w. sheaffer l. and michael m., my friday night coworker drinking buddies. always. and most of the time some other people were there.

next, enter fly bar, before we abandoned it for club wazeima, which serves real booze.

but fly gets a good rating because it's ambient (or something), and because i have about a million good memories from this place, those friday nights.
author: Irene S.

description:
it seems that fly bar has been around forever. it was there long before western addition became the new mission with its own set of hipsters. nowadays there are trendier and fancier places in western addition. however, fly continues to stand tall and proud as if he knows that he's the one who put western addition on the map. a true pioneer doesn't care for trend and such. fly is no exception to this rule. fly hasn't tried to reinvent itself as another hipster hangout. as matter of fact, i don't think it has changed at all. i wholeheartedly appreciate and respect such nonconformity...

fly is definitely quieter now that there are madrone and 821 within stone throwing distance. this is a good thing. the drinks are still cheap and the vibe is decidedly laid back unless you're shooting pool. the fly pool hustlers who often get hustled themselves tend to get aggressive at times which can get annoying. nevertheless, fly is a great neighborhood bar.
author: frisco j.

description: I wish there were more neighborhood bars like the Fly. It has a little bit of everything - food, pool, drinks, music and a TV for those ESPN highlights.  I tend to grab a salad or a pizza and a pint or two.
author: Raymond M.

description: This is a nice little funky neighborhood bar with a fun atmosphere. I've always had a good time here. When I go, I usually get pitchers of sangria. Be forewarned though, as others have stated there's no liquor here. They do have tons of sake and soju cocktails plus beer and wine.
author: Kimi W.

description:
I've been coming to this restaurant/bar longer than most of the staff has worked there! And long before most of you hip kids discovered it!
Let's just say there was a time before "pizzettas" were on the menu. 
But since day one for me, circa 2000, I have been a weekly regular!
I am never disappointed. Everyone that's worked there over the years has always been awesome! The food is always consistently great. 
As is the atmosphere, it is always good! It's really is just a cool place a block from my home. 
If your coming from a different hood for a show at the Independent that night this isn't the place for you! This is  the kind of bar where you go have some dinner than hang out for the night and drink! It's that laid back. Don't expect to be in and out, that's what the chains are for. This is the kind of place to just relax. 
Did I mention how awesome the staff is! If you treat them good they will treat you good! It's a busy enough place they can pick and choose their customers that they're nice to. SO BE NICE TO THEM!!! 

Oh and for those of you that don't know-
 Wikipedia-"The term "bar" is derived from the specialized counter on which drinks are served and is a synecdoche applied to the whole of the drinking establishment."
They serve a lot of drinks from a "bar" and have alcohol, but no liquor. Let me tell you I have gotten trashed here many times!
author: O. S.

description: Before heading over to the Independent, we stopped here for dinner & drinks.  After gorging ourselves on Nachos (gooooood nachos), we couldn't really finish our dinners, but what we did finish of them they were really good.  My friend had the spinach salad, and raved about it.  I had the Foghorn Leghorn Chicken sandwich, which was great, and it came with a salad on the side instead of fries or chips which was a nice change of pace.  Drinks were good, I had two Soju drinks which were very yummy, and we ordered a half pitcher of Sangria, which was also good.  Great place for chilling before a show at the Independent.
author: Jenna H.

description: Best service in town! I love the at-home atmosphere, cheap yet tasty treats, great sake cocktails, and always good tunes!
author: Lindsey S.

description: Fly Bar is an always-crowded, never pretentious Divisidero Street hang out for attractive upper 20 and 30 somethings. They have refreshing Ace pear cider on tap and the food is delicious whether eaten at the bar or taken to go. I have the mediterreanean salad with roasted chicken for $11. I wish it came with bread because I'm a dipper but who needs carbs anyway? One star off because there is no place to stand without being in someone's way which makes it really awkward when the bar is crowded. Perfect for a Sunday afternoon if you live in the neighborhood. Get some drinks here and then head to the panhandle to tan in the sun.
author: Jessica M.

description: Food was ok (pizza/salads/etc) - not too expensive, but noting special either. The crowd was chill (I love the area, very cool people) and the bar was large enough to hold people, small enough to feel comfy. The drinks were a bit disappointing... only soju?! Unless you plan to drink beer, you might find yourself disappointed in the selection.
author: linda t.

description: What's not to like?? $3 draft beer and half price pizzas from 3.30 - 6.30. The music is always great and even when crowded the staff is good about getting drinks/food out. Parking can be a real pain in the ass in this area but the good news is Tsunami sushi and Cafe Abir are across the street. So once you do get your spot you've got a couple other great options without having to move again.
author: Robert K.

description: I am only giving 3 stars because they dont serve booze and every time Ive tried to play pool the people using it as a table have been less than pleased with me.The food is good but nothing amazing. I tried the Thai pizza last time I was there and was not impressed. However the brie quesadilla is tasty. The staff are awesome, very friendly and attentive. The sangria is the best but beware of the pitchers....tasty but make for a rough morning.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: I live right by this bar, it's a great local haunt.  I have only really been here on "off" hours, but these seem to be the best hours.  I had a salad and a beer here the other Saturday at like 3 pm.  The bar was empty except for a few locals and by the end of my beer we were all chatting it up.  Also has great special on Sunday afternoons, the food is actually pretty good!
author: Claire C.

description: Sakitinis! Good munchies at a great price during happy hour. When I went, the pizzas were half price and the articoke dip is a perfect compliment to any alcoholic beverage.
author: Judy L.

description: I was drunk when I got here, and it was still wonderful. I plopped myself down with a group of boys, flirted with this one boy for a while--and then ended up making out with his friend. How does that happen? Fly. That's how it happens.
author: Krystha B.

description: Some of the tastiest bar food I've tried in San Francisco. Their pizzas and sandwiches are particularly noteworthy (try the tuna melt!). I also HIGHLY recommend the nachos for an indulgence. Yum.
author: Jill M.

description: Really nice interior, I loved a lot of the artwork they had up.  (I love high ceilings) The waitresses were so awesome to us.  Extra sweet and welcoming, felt really good my first time here.  They had amazing appetizers, yummy dips, nachos, and some feta cheese thingy were some of what we ordered.  We shared the food and ordered some cocktails.  The music wasn't too loud either.  All in all a really great bar to chill at with great treats to munch on.
author: Mary R.

description: The happy hour here is quite good, but I'm not a huge sake cocktail fan.  Also, the crowd can get a little "marina" on the later weekend nights.  The food is decent bar food, but the portions are big.. and the salads are pretty good.
author: Liz C.

description: I can't comment on the weekend crowd but wqhat makes this place shine is the Happy Hour where you can get reasonable beer or cocktails and AWESOME CHEAP pizza.  The crust is very thin and parmesany.  They have a great selection of beer on tap and they are pretty friendly!  This is a nice place to go with a friend or a partner, when it isn't too crowded.
author: Aaron W.

description: low key, always friendly staff.  yummy food & a great happy hour w/ half price pizzas.  And the music is always fabulous.
author: Liz V.

description: I love this joint. Incredibly attractive bartender. Random folks who strike up conversation. Yummy mangosakitini drink.  Small neighborhood joint.  Conveniently close to the Independent. Excellent spot for grabbing a drink before heading out someplace else.  Came here a couple of weeks back...quiet enough to really talk to people and the crowd is friendly.  Good meeting up space.
author: Jolsna J.

description: I'm all about the Happy Hours.  Fly Bar does not disappoint in this respect.  1/2 price pizzas and super cheap drinks is good any day of the week.  The art is intriguing.  I especially like the mirror mosiac in the bathroom.   It's easy to make this your favorite neighborhood bar if you live in the area.  I used to suggest this as a first date place.  You can eat, have a couple of drinks and make a quick exit if you need to.  If not, you're in a good spot for the night.
author: Rachel C.

description: Fly Bar is only a few blocks from my house so I go there approx twice a month.  I love the draft beers, in-expensive & decent food choices, the people, (as long as the "bus" crowds bridge/tunnel guys stay away) and the staff.  Good choice if you live in the area & down to earth place :)
author: Beth P.

description: I do really like this place.  I dont hang out and party here but I have been enough times to say Better then Bar Food!  I have had a pretty fair sampling of the menu and it has not let me down.  Have had the the sake cocktails and treats from the tap.  I dig this place.  food.   drinks.  and the staff always seems pretty right on.  Its also a good stop in the afternoon for a meal and a soccer game.
author: Tony B.

description: All I know is every time I've been here-- on various days, at various hours of the day-- I've had a great time. The best reason to go, though, is happy hour. Very friendly service (though a bit slow during busy hours) and the drinks are cheap, delicious, and best of all, stronger than you'd expect for a sake cocktail. If you don't like sake, beers are $3 and they have a great selection. The menu is also great for bar food in terms of quality and variety, and during happy hour you get half off their yummy pizzas. Basically you can get blasted and fill your belly for maybe $10. A great place to start (or end) the night.
author: Janine M.

description: The Funky Chicken pizza is the best BBQ chicken pizza I've had in the States. Australians love it, so I had a ton of it when I visited their wonderful country a few years ago, but I hadn't had a good one since.
author: Katie I.

description: Gourmet pizzas, sangria on happy hour...what more can a girl ask for after a long week? How about eye candy at the bar (yes I am objectifying the bartenders) and the great energy of the patrons, that is enough for me to hop on  the crowded 21 and start my weekend right!
author: Annalies H.

description: I love The Fly. It's got great ambiance, cool bartenders and good food. It's been a while since my last visit but I was a big fan of their Happy Hour. Half off pizza's between 4:00pm-6:00pm. Bring it!
author: alexa c.

description: Great place to relax play a little bit of Pool. Megan is the best :)
author: James R.

description: Fun bar if you're in the neighborhood. The pizzas are good but it's the spinach & artichoke dip that really makes me drool! The gender ratio is good for a girl on the prowl but the selection is mediocre.
author: Tabitha O.

description: I used to be a regular here a while ago, and I blame a lot of my laziness at the time on how easy this place was to hang out at.  It's cool, but not overly hipster.  I would avoid it on the weekends, but it was a great place to grab drinks and one of those pizza/salad combos they have with the roomies on a Wednesday night.
author: James M.

description: Went here this past Saturday night for the first time in quite a while. Usually there for happy hour so it was interesting seeing what kind of scene it is later in the evening. Mostly neighborhood folk. When I was looking for parking I remembered why I hate this neighborhood so much. Mildly ghetto and no parking. The parking gods were upon me this evening though as I got a spot across the street and in less that 15 minutes. They have redone the artwork here and it looks nice. The bartender was cool and the food is always good. Too bad they don't have a sign that says, "No euro-trash allowed." One of them got lost and tried to molest me at the bar. I think I still might throw up from the trauma.
author: Heather L.

description: Not so (fly). It looked like Lindsay Lohan had been wrestling Bruce Willis in here, the furniture was all in disarray and the staff were all sort of out of it and sweaty.  Not that I give a crap where the furniture is, but it was all just sorta disheveled and crappy and poor service and did not meet my social needs.
author: Kevin S.

description: The Fly is just a few blocks from my house, so it remains one of if not THE default  "let's grab A beer [or maybe two, max]" place for myself & my roommates, & the place I'm most likely to take a friend on the evening he/she arrives in the city if they're jetlagged. Laid back, dark [but not dirty or dank] & comfy, if a bit crowded at times. Sometimes the patronage seem a bit overdressed [c'mon guys, this ain't Solstice!], but I've never had an unpleasant conversation in passing with anyone, so any pretention is assumed on my part, & usually pretty quickly dismissed. I've only tried friends' sake drinks, but if you're looking for a beer, try a poppy jasper. Very good stuff -- more bars in the city should have that one on tap.
author: Pete J.

description: I love this spot. The sangria is strong, dangerous and therefore excellent. There's no hard alcohol available, but you don't really need it here. The beer, wine, soju cocktails and super strong sangria make up for the absence of jack and cokes. There's a really hot bartender there too....yum...hello!
author: Chloe D.

description: Gotta give props to the half-priced happy hour pizza, and I love the Sake Breeze. Perfect place to go for some downtime after working all day. And the music selection is usually awesome as well.   I do miss Kiki the waitress though. She was the best.
author: Veronica B.

description: Fly Bar reminds me of my childhood playground-good times and happy kids.  Like the playground, I haven't been there in ages.  Although I can say when I frequented this watering hole it was a great place to chill out and grab a beer.  The music always put me in a good mood and the pool table was like the sandbox---all the cool kids hung around it.  Anywho, check it out--no hard liquor, but nevertheless a great jumping off point if you want to get hammered.
author: Rochelle B.

description: I don't love this place yet, but eventually I might.  The salads are pretty good and the 1/2 price pizza is a great deal.
author: Michael L.

description:
damn those sake bombs keep coming. thanks russell.
and damn that bathroom line seems to get longer and longer.

okay so this review is only for the sake, but the concoctions are fruity gloriousness. like kool aid when your 6 except they kind of make you feel funny.
author: Jeremi M.

description: I would have given it four stars, but everytime I've been in here for drinks, it has smelled like vomit! No joke. Seriously disgusting which is why I haven't been back in the last 3 months, but it's a shame. I actually like this place. Their sake drinks are great (sake & pineapple...YUM), and the bar food is tasty!
author: Nicole S.

description: Food is sooo tasty!  Not your average bar food.  I tried everything everyone ordered, and it was all damn good.  Spinach artichoke dip, chicken stix, and maybe the best nachos in the city.  The chips stay crispy.  What put me in a great mood was the music!  My toes were tapping.  But not too loud that you couldn't have a conversation.  And there is the added bonus of a pool table and a clean bathroom.  I only gave it four stars because perfection is overrated.
author: Charley C.

description: Great place! Great bartenders and the locals were tops. Happen to be in on night when they were celebrating one of the regulars bday's. Everyone had a blast while a girl serenaded the bday boy. She did a great job and they brought out cake for everyone. $4 beers was nice as well. Good work guys! I will be back!
author: Robert A.

description: Fly bar is pretty dependable; if I could, I'd give this place one more half star. My favorite time is to go around happy hour. At happy hour, their normally $8 plate-size pizzas are half off. They also have discounts on their sangria and beer. They dont serve hard A, so if you are cocktail dinner, you'll have to settle for a sake-based one. It's not an overly exciting place, but it can be a good place to start the night.
author: Jenica M.

description: Fly is my neighborhood bar, and I totally heart it.  They have a fantastic happy hour, excellent food, and fun ambiance. The music selection and rotating art are things that I always look forward to.  I recommend the nachos and a Poppy Jasper - YUM!
author: Melanie S.

description: Definitely a neighborhood place. The snacks are bar snacks, but they all go really well with beer. Sigh, I remember when it opened, and the big crush I had on the cute bartender.. It's never been quite the same for me since.
author: Stellah D.

description: Very friendly and chill neighborhood bar with a pool table.  Plenty of people here even on a Tuesday night.  Cool drink specials.  Had a shoju and redbull for $5.  Not a place to go out of your way to get to, but if you're in the neighborhood and need a drink, its a more than decent option.
author: Jason S.

description:
4 stars for pear cider, a tv that's mounted up high and therefore not obnoxiously distracting/in-your-face, cool decor, and excellent service.

unfortunately, we didn't get to try the food, but everything surrounding us looked great.

my only complaint was that we were informed that since we were just there for drinks, we'd have to give up our table if anyone arrived and wanted to order food.  i mean, i understand - but really, my party could've ordered enough $$ in booze to justify our seats, haha.
author: Allison B.

description: They have sake drinks for $4 that are quite sizeable.  Just for that I'll give it 5 stars.  You don't have to go broke while drinking in the city.  I wasn't a huge fan of the Suckle sake drink, but the other one I tried (something with mango) was pretty decent!
author: Wendy V.

description: Fly is one of my favorite local spots to hit up. The bartenders are awesome, and the food is great. It's almost always packed but if you wait till after the dinner rush, it lightens up. It's a beer/wine/sake bar and a great midweek place to hit up or as your bar-before-going-out-bar. Good tunes are always played.
author: Alyssa C.

description: Great place to go for a mellow night and lots of delicious sangria.  You'll stay longer than you expected because of the atmosphere, sangria & sake drinks, and great, simple food.  Definitely try the goat cheese quesadilla and the salads are giant and delicious.
author: Lija H.

description: I've gotta have love for this place because I have had a few get togethers here and they really came off the way I wanted.  The appetizers are satisfying bar food and the soju cocktails get me ripped with no residual hang-over.  The only downside is the frequently crowded or out of service bathroom but the upbeat staff makes up for it.  Seating has never been a problem for me and the people watching is great.
author: Jill D.

description: I have only been here for the happy hour specials, but they were pretty good deals.  The pizzas are tasty and $3 pints (not just for bud/coors, but for the good stuff too!) can make me a happy camper any day of the week.   Sitting at the bar is the way to go...
author: Robert R.

description: Great happy hour spot, but it can get super packed. The pink ginger and the sangria are deliciously dangerous. The food is really yummy and filling--nachos, pizzas, all the usual suspects, but done better than  most bars.
author: Leigh M.

description: Great food, great drinks, great atmosphere. The Fly Bar is a friendly, funky little bar with a diverse crowd. It's at an awesome location with lots of other bars and restaurants around the area as well. But it's pretty much a one stop shop, so that's not really an issue. However, if you want to get to get super smashed, that won't necessarily happen here as they don't serve hard liquor. But if you want to just hang out with friends or meet some interesting people, that's totally doable here.
author: Natalie T.

description: Boring neighborhood bar needs liquor license. Sake cocktails don't cut it. No news at 11.
author: Philip M.

description: I've lived near this place for four years and it's continually gone down hill. Luckily, some better places have opened up within blocks of it. A good happy hour, but no liquor to be happy about. And the space is crowded and uncomfortable, making it difficult to 'hang out'. Only go there if you want to sit down and eat a full meal. Otherwise, head to Madrone a few blocks up for better atmosphere.
author: Babs P.

description: I really like this bar. And, it has surprisingly much better than average bar food to satisfy those drunken munchies. Get the pizzas or healthy mixed greens salads. As for the drinks, they offer a wide selection of different beers and a few different wines. It's a great place to chill out, as they have lots of tables inside. I love the decor- lots of interesting art and mirrors. The staff is friendly too, always a plus.
author: Laura D.

description: Fly Bar serves food but in actuality it's more of a bar than a restaurant. The very San Franciscan interior is a blend of vintage Victorian and neo-modern art - a perfect place for the proverbial artist in angst struggling to make a trendy living. The dark burgundy walls, artwork by unknown artists, funky mirrors, and paper lantern lamps (that give off very little light) all combine to further the cozy and trendy San Franciscan aura. There's a pool table in the back, but according to the pool mavens, the space is too cramped to be acceptable. The pool table suited me just fine, although apparently I have a lot to learn about playing pool.  Read more at The Ballyhoo: http://www.ballyhoo.us/restaurants/review.cfm?review=26
author: Baochi N.

description: Really great bar that has a happy hour ($3 drafts - 20 ozs.) and 1/2 off all pizzas and salads.  Cool crowd and good vibe.  Great spot to go if you're going to see a show at the Independent.  Perfect for after work.
author: Steven M.

description: Pretty cool little bar. They serve food and have a funky little decor going. Happy Hour is good coz the food & booze are cheap. Friendly and cute bar staff.
author: Colleen B.

description: I get the soju complaints, i personally hate soju as well, but since I'm a beer or wine girl this bar suits me just fine.  They make a mean grilled cheese paired with one of the many beers I am very happy.  This place is conveniently located close to the independent which makes it a good place to go to for some food before a show.  I like it.
author: Jaime C.

description: More of a bar than a restaurant, but a really good bar. Very nice waitstaff and good pizza if you don't mind the sticky uneven table feel. I loved the 19 ounce beers. If I had been going strickly to drink this would be a four star rating but if you are looking for a sit down meal in this joint you better be with friends and be ready to have a beer while you wait. I would definitely return to this spot.
author: M L.

description: This is fast becoming one of my favorite watering holes.  They seem to spin alot of underground Hippity Hop, which I dig.  Haven't had the chance to sample their food, but the $4 beers and Soju concoctions are good enough for me.  Fairly eclectic crowd.  Minus one star for the restroom-notice the non plural form.  Unless you have a really cool pee dance get ready to suffer the queue with both sexes.  Makes my ureters cringe just thinking of that line...
author: Sam N.

description: Fly is another one of my favorite neighborhood bars.  I really like this place.  I've been coming here on a regular basis lately.  It works out perfect to grab a drink and food at Fly before heading to a show at the independent next door.  They only serve beer, wine and sake but the sake cocktails are pretty good.  And honestly, the food is pretty decent, I wouldn't say gourmet but very very decent for bar food.  The wall art is usually pretty interesting and entertaining.  I'm pretty happy it's in my hood.
author: Susan P.

description: Drinks are nice, always an interesting atmosphere, but nothing compares to the Fruit to Nuts Salad here. Nothing. It's so weird that the food is so good at a bar.
author: a m.

description: You cannot beat this happy hour, hit it up today, pizza half off/ cheap draft. i'm here twice a week!
author: scott g.

description:
We are not regular visitors of SF.Stopped in this bar before the concert next door for a quick bite. The floor was sticky... the table we found was sticky...
BUT
The waitress was very nice and cleaned up the table for us. It was a day of Bay Breakers so they were very busy. Waited for her to take our order for few minutes. Ordered three salads. The one ordered was the best - the spinach salad. It was surprisingly tasty despite the first impression of the place. The other two salads were also good. Midetirenian and Nick's.
I would come here again but maybe on a less busy day ))
author: Katerina K.

description: My friends and I always seem to end up here for happy hour. Half price pizzas are hard to beat! Salads are yummy, too. I definitely recommend the beer and sangria over the "mixed drinks", but the Pink Ginger is tasty. While service can vary from mediocre to excellent (free sake bombs!), it's the mellow, welcoming vibe that keeps us coming back.
author: Michie L.

description: I go here for the food.  mm mm.  They have some of the best salads in the entire city.  And I'm told they have THE best tuna melt in SF.
author: Kerry L.

description:
went to this place last night before a show at the independent. cute and homey, and my salad (the mediterranean sans dressing) was absolutely wonderful.

definitely will head back the next time i'm seeing someone at the independent.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
kept driving by this place but never stopped in until we needed to waste a few minutes waiting for a table at little star

the sangria isn't bad and the clientele is beautiful. servers are friendly and equally beautiful.

they don't have hard liquor [wine, beer, sake] but you shouldn't come here to get drunk anyway. it's all about the mood. kind of dark, yes, but when you're with your SO do you want to be completely visible to everyone? accordingly, high ceilings ensure that you can actually hold a conversation without yelling

can't wait to come back here and try the food, could be a great place to spend a few hours with good friends
author: Charles C.

description: My cousin sister and I went for an early dinner on a rainy Thursday. The service was so s-l-o-w but the great Happy Hour deal ($3.00 Sangria and discount on pizzas) and pitcher of sangrias we downed pretty much made us forget about the glacial speed service.  I was really impressed with the pizza and that's not just the alcohol addled memory talking.  Just don't go on a rainy day when the place is deserted.  Good food, good portions, great ambiance.
author: Captain Happy Pants H.

description:
i'm gonna keep this one short and sweet...

1.  great menu offerings with excellent pizza's & appetizers!!!!

2.  great selection of beer, which i am a fan of!!!!

3.  very very hospitable servers that now how to work that tip, ha ha ha!!!!

4.  a lil' on the loud side, but it is a bar so what are ya' gonna' do?



i have ben there on several occasions now and am still impressed with the consistency of this place...


eat/drink here!!!!!



***ursa major***
author: Michael M.

description: A little bit in the hood but a great neighborhood spot. I mean, I'd even travel across town to go here.  What to order: pitcher of sangria, nachos with chicken, and Nick's salad. I know it sounds simple but it's the best! The nachos come out hot and piled high with all the fixings. These are not your normal bar nachos - trust me. It's roasted sliced chicken on top, fresh salsa, and fresh guacamole. I also love Nick's salad b'c they pile it high with quality ingredients - chicken, bacon, shredded cheese, sliced ham, and more. The best part is the buttermilk ranch dressing that is homemade. I've already asked if they bottle it, they don't :(
author: Josephine H.

description: Absolutely one of the best happy hour spots I have experienced in SF.  I wish each date I've taken here or met here was as satisfying...great pizzas, fun crowd, "on it" staff...
author: Brian G.

description: Fly is a great place to enjoy a beer or a delicious glass of sangria while catching up with friends.  It does get crowded, but never out of control.  Kind of wish they had a full bar but hey -- none of us is perfect.  I can't speak for the food as I have never eaten there, but I hear good things.  I've been to Fly many times and it always satisfies.
author: Louis M.

description: This place has some pretty good food, although its a little salty at times, and I love me some salt!  But even this is a a bit much at times.  Great hummus, chicken pizza with watercress salad and some other tasty bits.  The drinks were kinda weak, but tasty.  It has a pretty good vibe, when the music isn't so loud you cannot hear the person next to you (but that isn't frequent)  I say, go here for a bite and a quick cocktail and then move on to some more grown-up drinks...that is if you don't want to mess around.
author: Suzanne L.

description: I love the Fly Bar for its sangria! Everyone seems to ooh and ahh over Cha Cha Cha's sangria. I think its a load of crap.  Fly Bar's sangria is one of the better sangria's made in the city.  Or maybe they just make it the way I do. Anyhow, their food is actually something tasty and not nasty bar food.  Their happy hour is respectable. The only thing to be concerned about is seating but well worth the visit if you get one!
author: Grace V.

description:
we were hungry and in the neighborhood so we decided to check it out.  

def recommend the sangria - it was strong but tasted just right.  jackie got one of the sake drinks - only judging by his face, it was intense!

food was perfect and far fancier than i expected in a bar - we split a spinach salad (very fresh, loads of espinacas) and a jimmy the greek pizza.  it was the perfect light dinner to coat our stomachs and enjoy our drinks.  

def recommend!
author: Kristin K.

description: This is a great chill neighborhood spot to meet up with friends, play pool, and nosh on their excellent bar food.  Beer/wine only.
author: Ellen O.

description: The pizza was ok.  My sake was great.  They have happy hour here on Fridays until 6:30PM.  Great deals.
author: Joanna S.

description: Perfect place for a chill drink and eats before a show at the Independent.  Seating was a bit limited, but since it's a bar/restaurant instead of a restaurant/bar, I suppose that is to be expected.  Pizza was yum.  Waitstaff was very friendly.
author: Matthew R.

description: Great happy hour...food is delicious and the drinks are reasonably priced. The place is small, but if you get there early enough, you can get a seat. The staff are usually overworked, but they do a great job on getting your order right on time :). I have had wonderful drunken nights there and I have never been kicked out yet!!!
author: Tricia M.

description: A little hipster but interesting drink menu. Sake madras was my fave selection.
author: Amanda H.

description: I've been here twice since I lived around the corner in the hood.  I don't know, some place you feel for, like Bar 821 across the street, and this place is just....there.  Pizza for happy hour is nice and at half off, a bargain.  It just feels like people sitting around, eating, waiting for something to happen.  I'll give it another shot since there are only a handful of bars on the Dis.  Though, my cousin, who lives in Lower Pac Heights, and refuses to go South of Geary to drink, likes the place.  I'm perplexed.   My cousin is funny, she wears a lot of jewelery, and when you pumped her with a few glasses of wine, watch out for the table dancing.
author: Christian N.

description: I hesitated giving Fly 5 stars, but then I tried to figure out what I would change and I realized I wouldn't change a thing.  I travel across town from Potrero Hill just to have the Nick's salad and a beer.  Their food selection is great, and decently priced.  The salads and pizzas are definite favorites!  The beer selection is awesome.  I love the staff there, always on top of things and really chill.  Whenever I go it's busy, but never too busy that you can't find a table.  Actually now that I type this, I guess the only recommendation I would have is that sometimes the music is overly loud.  I don't mind loud music, but there is a threshold, especially mid-day.  Oh and the happy hour is one of the best.  Go today.
author: Christie A.

description:
A friend invited me out to dinner and I asked if I had anywhere in mind. After living a year in the Western Addition I figure I should check out some places in my hood.  He suggested "Fly Bar" and I said, "perfect".

It is a comfortable place. Dark, candle lit with art on the walls and music in the room makes you feel at ease the minute you walk in. This of course helped along by the fact that we easily found a table as it was late on a week night. I imagine if it were crowded and you were hungry it could be a different story. The place looked familiar and I might have gone there before I had moved to SF on a visit but I wasn't sure. My friend ordered the "poor boy" special to drink which left our waitress perplexed and agitated. She responded with a couple head shakes, eye squints and "WHAT?" 's. He responded with, "you know what, um never mind...I'll have what she's having a...cab..."

Apparently I had been there before just I had suspected. The place had been remodeled, the poor boy special was taken out and new paint was put on the walls. The place was looking good. Before we had even looked at the menu our waitress asked for our order. We asked for a minute to decide. We decided and then we talked about the place, the pool table, the art, the interesting people at the bar, the interesting people in our lives, interesting people in general but we hadn't talked about the food yet as the minute we asked for extended for quite some time. Our waitress may have forgotten about us. Or possibly was ignoring the person I was with for offending her by ordering something she had never heard of. I'll blame him because she was noticebly nicer to me. Finally we asked another server working if we could put an order in which she sweetly responded, "yeah, no problem...sorry she's been busy today" 

We ordered the Chicken and goat cheese quesadilla and Thai Basil Chicken Pizzeta and the food was delicious and at the end of the night I was a happy girl.

I would definitely go here again. Although our waitress was absent minded (even when we would try to engage in conversation or make her laugh it seemed to go right over her head) the food and atmosphere made up for it. 

I hope when I do go to Fly for dinner again (which I will) that I get the same server I'd like to believe she just had a bad day, or not.
author: kristen s.

description: When I lived only a few blocks from this place, I still didn't frequent it.  Definitely not worth going out of your way for.  Straight up average.
author: matthew w.

description:
Any place that can combine soy milk and sake is a place for me (think Jean Simmons in Guys and Dolls "Dolce de Leche.  This would be a great way to get kids to drink milk!"
And the fact that Daniel Abbott's art was displayed on the wall takes an interesting comfortable neighborhood sake bar and turns it into a classy incredibly meaningful joint.
author: Anjali K.

description: With owners and employees like this, the neighborhood locals are bound to stay local!  A great happy hour to be had by all.  Keep it local people!
author: frankee U.

description: Cute and super cozy.  The tables are small and really close together, but just relax and enjoy the fact that you'll inevitably share a few pleasant words with your neighboring table(s)...  and if you haven't spoken to anybody you didn't come with yet, well you will when you wait in line for the only bathroom in the joint (really my only problem with Fly).  The music is always really fun, I always feel like it's my i-pod playing over the speakers!  Good salads and pizzas, I really like the spinach salad (it's got warm  bacon on it!!!).  Really friendly staff.  They do the beer and wine bar thing well enough that I don't even notice the lack of hard alcohol, and this is coming from a Jameson on the rocks kind of girl.
author: Erica S.

description: This is a nice lil neighborhood bar, merely a block away from my girlie's house! Its busy most nights, but it you wait around you'll snag a spot to sit. The selection is good and they have very reasonable prices.
author: Tom S.

description: Cool bar, played some WU and I respect that.  however my question is - what asshole builds a bar with one - 1 bathroom - total???
author: Bill S.

description: Ok. I love the happy hour at Fly. Personally, I love the pizza here. I pretty much think it's delicious. Every single one, in fact -- so I have no recommendations. And the fact that pizzas are half price during happy hour makes me a regular visitor. I've been keeping my eyes peeled for a happy hour as respectable as this one, but have yet to find anything. I think drinks are a dollar off during happy hour, but I pretty much stick to beer. Oh, Fridays can be kind of crowded, and I prefer this place when the vibe is a little more relaxed.
author: m t.

description: I always like establishments where the pool table is A.) in existence and B.) located on some sort of elevated platform, where you can peer out over the rest of the crowd with an air of impunity.  Fly Bar is such a place.  And close to my house.
author: Sam M.

description: Decent beer, soju and great vibes; I honestly just dig the awesome jazz art they have in the men's restroom.  Does anybody know the artist?
author: Justin C.

description: Yes, I like any joint that has a seven day a week happy hour. Better yet, I like a joint that has a great happy hour and an even better staff. I walked in and was in the process of taking off my jacket when a menu was placed on the table with a friendly greeting. The pizza was scrumptious, and the sangria made Cha Cha' Cha's taste look like Kool  Aid. Yes, that's right friends...their sangria is boss. While here solely for a date, the Fly has now gained a fan as long as SF will have me. Pop in and ask for Russell and company...they'll take care of you.
author: Kenny G.

description:
Stopped in here for dinner before a show at the Independent, and was pleasantly surprised.  From the door it looks like the place is trying too hard, with the red lighting and the wall of mirrors, and the - I cannot stress this enough - VERY STRANGE mural on the back wall.
Once we got inside, though, the place started to grow on me.  Seating is set up as a series of booths that can accommodate large parties or several small ones.  My friend and I sat in the back corner and were promptly provided with menus.  The selection is decent, and even includes one vegan option [though it's not listed as such].  Very good sangria, but the cocktail selection leaves something to be desired - like flavor, or alcohol.  Beer is good, though.
My friend said the pizza was exquisite, but my heart belongs to the goat cheese quesadillas.  Not just because chevre and quesadilla is a perfect marriage, but because they were topped with goat cheese chipotle - something which I now know should have been added to my life long ago.  Yum!
It got busier as the night went on, and we were eventually driven out by some obnoxious people playing pool.  Still, a four-star experience.  I'll be back as soon as I can!
author: T T.

description: small-ish bar that wasn't too crowded on a Friday night at 1:00am.  Would be OK but minus a star for having one bathroom, and coming out to our group and telling us that we had to grab our friend and leave because she was puking EVERYWHERE. minus a star because she was not puking everywhere, she puked in the garbage can, the obvious alternative to the bathroom. also they called last call early. boo.
author: C D.

description:
good grilled cheese 
good nachos
good pizza
author: David F.

description: I have to say this place has big time improved in the past couple years. It  has become a great neighborhood spot and has a pretty good happy hour. Half off pizzas. It can get pretty crowded and a little dark but the drinks have grown on me and they have a great beer selection.
author: Sierra d.

description: Great happy hour, half off of great pizza'a, good beer selection and always playing great tune's.  Any place that plays uneasylistening by z trip and dj P is ok by me.
author: brian m.

description:
I really like this place... the food is surprisingly good for a bar, as are the sake cocktails.  It's great for a 'meeting up, and getting the first couple of drinks' soiree, but not happening enough to spend the whole night.  
It's a tad loud, so meaningful conversations relying on voice inflections and dramatic pauses may suffer a bit (I know, I know... it's a bar!), but it suits my friends and me just fine (we save the 'meaningful' stuff for brunch, anyway).  
I suspect some might find it a bit too mellow for fridays and saturday nights.  How can Fly compare when you're just itching to watch the B&T crowd totter around in their 2 storey high heels hanging on to each other and their tube tops for dear life, shedding copious tears over some imagined slight, and regurgitating alcohol anywhere an unsoiled spot of road is to be seen?  Heck no, gotta head to North Beach and SoMa for that! :-)
All kidding aside, this really is a cool, laid back place, and that's why we continue to go back.  That, and the happy hour.
author: Godot -.

description: A little too trendy to get better marks. Good luck finding seating here on most nights. I prefer my hipster bars a little less douche-filled...
author: Andrew L.

description: The happy hour pizzas are a good deal, although I think the sandwhiches are a million times better.  The bartenders/servers always seem really friendly.  However there are 2 huge reasons I dont go here.  No hard liqour and weird smell.  I wish I liked it more.
author: b s.

description: Nice little place for a beer or some wine.  Pool table in back, nice art and a laid back 'tude.  Not a destination, but a nice oasis.  They have food, but I have not eaten here.
author: Tony A.

description: I was just here for the third time in the past year and it's good bar to kill an hour.  Pluses are friendly staff, 19oz beers for $4 and a great happy hour special everyday, (1/2 priced pizza and a buck off the beer).  There is a pool table in the back and a nice mix of people drinking.  It doesn't have hard liquor but does have a number of sake and soju cocktails.  Parking tends to be slightly more difficult than the average SF neighborhood.
author: John S.

description: I keep coming back to Fly bar, which I don't understand, because it is so thoroughly unremarkable. I hate Soju cocktails. The meat pizza is fine. The beer is beer. The pool table is a pool table. The decor is not divey, not designer, not minimalistic. It just is. The service just is too. It just does such a good job of meeting my need for a place packed with young people where I can eat and drink and talk loudly over the music. Will keep coming back until the end of time.
author: Geronimo G.

description:
I prefer the hipsters here over the other lots at Abir.

The happy hour special cant be beat.

The menu hasnt changed at all, but it is tasty.  Good beer prices, decent variety.

Avoid the soju cocktails.  FYI, soju is the korean version of Night Train.  Not to be consumed unless you want a headache or to courage up for an insult spree.
author: M M.

description: Fly Bar is one of my favorite neighborhood haunts. The food is quick, decent and reasonably priced. The service is really great here, too. Friendly staff and bar tenders. This is the perfect place to go for dinner and some beers/bottle of wine before the start of your night or if you plan on staying in.
author: Shannon C.

description: Excellent prices for tasty, well-prepared food. I had their tex-mex salad which was generous and friends had hummus platter and chicken goat cheese quesadillas. For SF, this place is a great find--good food, modest prices, good selection of beer/wine, and a warm environment.
author: Snora E.

description: solid four. good food, great prices, amazing happy hour.
author: Elise H.

description:
it was a little to yuppie for me. but it has a pool table and thats cool. 
i was not really impressed but its a bar. 
haven't eaten the food so i dont know about that.
author: Morgan G.

description:
Fly Bar is great!  The food is good (especially the nachos) and they have a great beer list.  They have Happy Hour everyday of the week....can't beat that!  

Not 5 stars because they don't have vodka.  :(
author: Marie N.

description:
The trick to enjoying Fly Bar is to not think of it as a bar. 
This is because bars should have liquor and Fly "Bar" does not.

I think of Fly as a restaurant, and thus it is one of my favorite local eateries.  The food is solid and relatively inexpensive. The low light and chill staff make it an excellent date spot. The thin crust pizzas are consistently good, but my favorite item is the warm spinach salad. It's huge and delicious.
author: David N.

description: A GREAT neighborhood bar.  Maybe the best bar food in the city, and the pizzas are half off during happy hour!  It's a nice place to grab a bite and a pint and play a game of pool... what more could you ask for?
author: Amy L.

description: This is a really fun place to go and have a beer with a few friends. One thing I didnt like was lack of seating... but it has a nice sake menu and the food is pretty good.  I used to live like a block away and it makes for a very nice local bar.  plus the service was great!!
author: Elizabeth M.

description: I suggested to my husband on Saturday that we go to the Fly bar for lunch w/ our 2 yr son on Saturday, because I knew at that time the crowd would be at a minimum and my son would be able to walk around w/out bothering everybody and I was right. This is a great neighborhood restaurant/bar, great SANGRIAS and food. Nites during the week are always pretty busy and it's just a great place to hang out.
author: Darlene R.

description: 5 bucks for a shot and beer.  hell yeah female dog.  i was pretty wasted here, but i think they have good pizza too or maybe it was a quesadilla either way, good deal for shot and beer.
author: christopher h.

description: Fly Bar has a great menu - i now often order food to go and pick it up on my way home from work.  If you plan on eating there - they usually play interesting low key music - and have cool artwork displayed that changes regularly.   If you have a show to go to at The Indepedent down the street, this is a perfect place to kick it before the show.
author: Chris S.

description: This bar has one of the best happy hours, half off pizzas and half price pitchers of sangria.  If you like a good pizza and decent Soju drinks, then this place is for you.
author: Yen T.

description: awesome 1/2 price happy hour pizzas (get the carmel blue and the mmm...meat), $3 sangria and beers before 6:30.  friednly staff, even when we broke a glass, cool crowd.  i wasn't even bothered that they don't have real booze.
author: e w.

description: i wish someone would chain the doors shut on a weekend night and burn this place down with everyone inside.
author: Mynameisdavid M.

description: there is always something (odd) to look at while eating/drinking/playing pool at fly. the walls have an interesting collection of paintings, mirrors and murals, even in the bathroom! happy hour is great: $4 sake cocktails and half-off killer pizzas. i like the "jimmy the greek." also, drink specials are featured on an impeccably written, colorful chalkboard. Tip: bring your own people along
author: Ligaya T.

description: i haven't actually had drinks here, but it was a good place for a weekend luch/snacks (nice personal pan pizza and good artichoke dip).  they had a good mix of music playing (culture club, johnny cash, and the cure all got some play time), and they have a pool table too.  basically a pretty chill neighborhood spot.
author: Roshni R.

description: me and the sparkle qween needed a kvetch session in the late afternoon. its a monday, and most of the spots around town are closed or not open till 5:30pm, so we choose fly bar. not because we drink, but because they have a big bar food menu, and its the year of the pig. we split a nachos and a sandwhich, the motz. i lament about not being a regular at any of the local bars in my beloved city or anywhere for that matter, except maybe the launderette. im a regualr there. fly bar. good in the late afternoon. buntcake stamp of approval.
author: coffeecake j.

description: I love the saki infused cocktails and happy hours there ! In terms of the food I am a fan of it! I like the salads the most and the pizza! Yummy! Warm ambiance with tv's streaming live soccer games or fun videos. I tend to like the music at this place too! It kind of maintains a neighborhood vibe, but not so much on the weekends. Check it out!
author: Laura R.

description: Came here after work; enjoyed the Happy Hour, great drinks, GREAT price -sake chiwawa & sake nectar ($3) and 1/2 off pizza...what?!?! I LOVE IT...4 drinks and a pizza to share for under $20....ummm, Mom..watch the kids, we are going to FLY BAR!!
author: D S.

description: Went here for drinks on a Saturday night and I found this a really comfortable place to go out with the girls! Drinks were delicious, generous and cheap. We had sangria and pear cider and both were $4 a glass- a BIG glass. Great atmosphere, nice set-up - next time we'll have to try the food; menu looked intriguing. Definitely will go back here! :)
author: Jessica B.

description: For what I went for - a drink with an old friend, it fit the bill, nice lighting and ambiance.
author: Jane F.

description: I don't understand all the bad reviews stating that their service is so bad. I've always found everyone there to be friendly. And yeah, sometimes it takes a few minutes to order a drink, but what's the rush anyway? The sake cocktails are interesting. And where else in this expensive city can you get a cocktail for only $5 dollars? Friendly, cozy, neighborhood bar where the music always clashes with what's on the t.v. But I've always found that more funny than anything else. Food is good too. And they take credit cards. Shout out to Russ, the bartender, who's not bad to look at either!
author: Alex M.

description: You know, I wasn't much a fan of this place, which was unfortunate since I'm about a block away.  The big "sake-tini" menu annoyed me, it was always full of somewhat annoying people, the music sucked, and the beer selection didn't really match what I liked.  Then, last month I was in the Toronado and Pauly asked if I had been back since they remodeled.  I told him no, but I'd have to check it out.  I've been back a few times since I and like what they've done to the place.  They have a cool concrete bar now, they got rid of the big silly fake cocktail menu on the wall, the music is better, the bartenders are great, AND they've added Hunter's Point Porter and Brother David's Double to the list of taps.  This place has gone from a place I hated, to a place that I don't mind grabbing a beer or three at after work.  If you've not been to the Fly Bar in the past couple of months you owe it to yourself to give them a second chance.
author: Joshua W.

description: one os my favorite casual bars in the city. good happy hour specials. the pizzas, salads, sandwiches are great!
author: Yinnie Q.

description: Went on a Tuesday night. Chill place. Decent selection of beer. Perfect noise level: can hear the person sitting next to you, but there is enough ambient noise to drown out the conversations of most of the other people in the bar. The decor was simple and inviting. The bartenders seemed friendly enough.
author: AJ C.

description: Hmmmm, I personally liked this place much better before they decided to be a yuppie hipster joint. Owned by the Solstice guys, it used be this cool,  Western Addition beer bar with great bartenders and great food. The crowd used to be more your fun locals, but now, though I still pop in about once every couple weeks for a beer and a bite, the scene has totally changed as they tried to make it swankier, the people are those boring cookie-cutter types who troll in from the Marina, from bridges, through tunnels, out of outer Sunset manholes. The kind of people who remind you of the people you were trying to never see again when you chose to move to San Francisco, (unless you were born here making you the only one ever). Guys who say bro, have matching colored shoes and shoelaces, tuck their t-shirts in, and probably tell girls they're 'producers,' cuz they recorded their friend's shitty hip-hop record on ProTools. Girls in slightly sideways baseball caps, probably own a small useless dogs, mouth the words to horseshit like Jay-Z and think they're slumming it at the Fly Bar. It's too bad, because Russ is a great bartender, the food is killer, the beer is great, but I just don't really want to spend my money with a bunch of assholes!!
author: Steve l.

description: I generally pop in here once a week on my day off for a couple of beers and a salad (yin and yang).  The people there are friendly (servers AND regulars) and generally know what I want at this point without having to ask.  That's a sign of a good server when it's maybe once a week or just once every couple of weeks you go and they know what you normally get.  Even better, they ask to make sure you're having your usual.  I am.
author: Jay F.

description: One of my fav bars/restaurants...a cool spot to have lunch and a few drinks for cheap. happy hour means half on drinks and pizzas....the pizzas are small but filling and the other stuff on the menu like the warm spinach salad balance out the drinks so you dont get super smashed.  most the drinks are mixed with soju which is a korean drink. try out the Toros. the atmosphere is cool, nice paintings everywhere, and even a pool table in the back. just make sure the grinch dont serve you
author: fern d.

description: came here two birthdays in a row for the same friend and this place is alright. they have happy hour specials which we came for and it's not bad. there is a variety of sake cocktails and pizzas (takes a while for it to cook). these are some of the things they have during happy hour. they also have beer and sangria for a couple of bucks. they have a pool table and a few tables. the setting is very mellow. i would recommend trying their pizzas with some sangria.
author: Lynn P.

description: I like the dark feeling. Great if you want to just sort of escape things and hang with friends incognito for what ever reason.  You won't get pestered if you are a woman out with friends and that is nice.  Sorry guys but sometimes we just want to be with our friends and not be interupted.
author: Misti L.

description: amazing happy hour (1/2 price pizzas and drink specials), plus great sangria. grabbing a table late at night can be a little tough.
author: Bee H.

description: Great motley assortment of neighborhood peeps with a down to earth kick ass staff running the joint. Food and drinks are solid and happy hour runs from opening until six. The good things in life are simple and reliable and the Fly is just that.
author: Cyril M.

description: f yeah.  this place is awesome.  come for happy hour, 1/2 off pizza.  we had the carmel blue and it was so yummy!  seriously, i could eat that every day if it was an option.  and we also ordered the chicken stix with spicy peanut sauce.  so good.  topped it all off with a few sake nectars.  and well, a few sake bombs too.  i will for sure be coming back to the fly bar next time i'm up in the city.
author: Kim C.

description: Happy hour from 1 til 630 including 1/2 price pizzas and 3 or 4 dollar beer.    This is my kind of place.  The pizza was really good.  I had the blanco.  It had garlic, jack, sun dried tomatoes and the perfect crust.  We just sat at the bar.  It was quite, but the bartender/server was very nice.  The picture on the all in case you are wondering (of the child ...) is a regular customer.  He was jealous of the photo collage in the hallway to the bathroom so he brought in that picture and surprisingly the owners put it up.  That's the story and it has been there ever since.  When they opened up a new location recently I guess he made a copy of the picture and continued the tradition.  AWWWW.  Not my favorite place, but I will be back every now and then for the cheep eats.
author: Mark S.

description: good, inexpensive, and creative drinks made with soju and sake; friendly service and clientele but it gets super packed.  I haven't had it yet but I hear the food is awesome.
author: Amanda L.

description: ok, when did this place turn into a marina bar? i've been coming here since i moved to SF and i actually like the place: fun drinks, pretty good food, and pool to boot. my friend recently had an art opening here and it was great - fly has a good time friends and family feel with a kick. but the bathroom line gets painfully long and it gets crowded and hot in there. i guess i would have to say 3.5 stars, really.
author: Mary V.

description: Good place to hang with 3-4 friends, no more, no less. Great pizzas and nice beer selection. If you're into it, they've got Hoegardeen on tap (i think). The folks that work here are all very cool and friendly.. i always feel welcome and love the local crowd that sits at the bar and stares... nice mix of new and old. definitely try to grab a bite here for a pre-party meal and drink-on.
author: David F.

description: Hard to find seating a lot of times, but their happy hour gets you $3 drinks, cocktails, etc & 1/2 off pizzas = $5 meal!  They've got tons of beers on tap and nice window seating to people watch and catch a few rays.
author: E G.

description: fly is a pretty great local bar. i usually run over in the afternoon for a lunchbreak and get a half price pizza and beer. really good food here, salads and pizzas are awesome and the bartenders are really nice. its very local and just a chill place. gets a little preppy for me at night sometimes and the weekends....but overall i really love this place and like the neighborhood feel it has during the afternoon and evenings.
author: kelly M.

description: If you live in NOPA and have not been to Fly, well, you can't call yourself a Nopaese just yet. I love Fly Bar. It's my favorite place time and time again.  Now, they only serve wine, beer and Soju. But, please don't let that stop you. And, if it does, then, more room for me at this great neighborhood bar. The salads there are so good, you have to try the El Tortilla or the Espinacha Caliente, and pair with it the Shroom Pie. Magnifico! The portions are huge, so it's fgood to share.  Many people go to Fly for the Nachos-so if you are into that-then definitely dive in (yummi). The music they play is always great, and the staff there is always so nice. And, they serve Chimay, and only the coolest bars serve Chimay. So, if you want to be part of the NOPA crowd, this is a must check out. smile.
author: nicole t.

description:
fly bar is the perfect neighborhood bar (provided you don't require hard liquor for your drinking experience). service is usually really good, and the beats are a funky mix of just about everything under the sun. the crowd is very chill.. no marina types, and for some reason, the college kids don't make it that far down fulton.. so no complaints in that regard.

the food is very good. i dig the mmmmMeat pizza, and the bbq chicken salad. so tasty, and nice size portions for the price. the star of the show for me though, is the sangria. don't forget to ask the staff for extra fruit.. makes an already great thing even better.
author: R. E.

description:
i have a bit of a love..and a hate for the fly bar...since i live a few blocks away....
1. great music(i once left a horrible show at the independent to go there and they were playing the white stripes all night long)
2.friendly staff
3.and walking distance home!

on the downside...
1.bro's are taking over(just like everywhere else)
2.not enough seating
3.and its walking distance home(aka im there all the time)
author: amber h.

description: unbelievalbe. i've been going to flly for years. years. and they won't let us in after bay to breakers. seriously, i've been a fan, but this is effiing inslulting. i will NEVER go there again. NEVER. there's nothing worse then having friends from out of town, and then being told at the door that they're "too drunk to get in". MY FAVORITE LOCAL BAR. FUCK YOU. I WILL NEVER. NEVER. go there again. NEVER. YOU ASSHOLES!. NEVER.
author: The M.

description: oddly tasty soju and sake cocktails, nice ambience, red lighting, one bathroom for the whole bar. the crowd is mostly in the 25-35 age range, aka not obnoxious and obscene (that job was left for me). i would go back for more potable delights
author: Erica C.
